hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great location! Very close to Ginza shopping district. But the overall quality of this Courtyard hotel is below average in Asia. The front desk staff speak poor English. Breakfast was good. Room was small. But it was a pleasant stay overall.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The staff at this hotel were incredibly helpful and friendly when we needed advice about navigating the train system. The hotel is well situated near to a subway station. Our room was very clean and spacious by Tokyo standards. The breakfasts were great. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I chose this hotel rather than Prince Sakura or Hilton Shinjuku where I stayed before due to its proximity to company office and Tokyo station. Both are 18 min walking distance.I was pleasantly surprised. Rooms are very nice. I got free breakfast with Platinum status, and they even had buffet dinner special at half price for hotel guests. I missed the fact that I did not get 20% platinum discount. Staff was very nice. Room’s Climate Control was very good - quiet and humidity was at 60%. Plenty of restaurants close by.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Situated at the centre of the Ginza. Nice room with amazing hospitality.The staffs are very friendly. We had dinner at Fiore. Famous for its grill section. Also Ginza Muraki. Authentic Japanese cuisine. Must have visit !!!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Awesome location and friendly staff. Room was small, but clean and what I expected. Very good hotel. Utilize the shuttle bus to the airport! Easier and way more convenient than a train, Uber or taxi. Ginza is an awesome neighborhood to explore.
user_name:
Randy D
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel because of its location near the shopping and restaurants in Ginza. Check in was very easy and I was in my room within minutes. The room was a bit on the small side but it worked for one person. I did like the universal outlets on the side of the desk so it was easy to charge electronics. The shower was nice and I did like the Japanese toilet. Overall the hotel was good. I did like the location the best.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Visited here in December 2019 with my daughter for a weekend away before a week of work started. My daughter was a last minute addition to the trip and as such I had to amend the hotel reservation from a double to a twin. When we arrived at the hotel we were informed we had been upgraded to a twin suite which was a nice surprise. Room itself was large with large bathroom with walk in shower and large bath. Room had two beds TV and mini bar stocked and also a iron and ironing board in the room. We also got complimentary Japanese pyjamas which my daughter loved.Hotel is perfectly located for the shops of Ginza which lies less than 5 minutes away.Staff were as you would expect in Japan very attentive, Breakfast was buffet style, but fresh and every kind of option available including fresh juices and take away coffees for those in a hurry. Bar downstairs was very Art Deco and reminded me of how a bar would have looked like in the 50's - I really like it. Again the service was very good there. Used the gym twice, its small but functional and has free weights, cables, and CV machines (runners, bike etc).A very well located hotel with good amenities

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Centrally located for tourists. Room was a bit on the small side, but ok. Breakfast was 5 star. Very rich and very good service. Location is tops, within walking distance to Ginza, to BIC Camera, and to numerous restaurants.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Very well situated in the financial district of Ginza. Handy for shopping, train station etc. Bedroom was large enough for two and very clean (as was the whole hotel). Great nights sleep in a comfy bed. Staff were very helpful (and English speaking). We didn't eat here so cant comment on food etc.
user_name:
David K
County Durham, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed here on our last night in Tokyo because of the convenient location to Tokyo Station. It is a great place to stay and we would definitely stay again. It is close to many metro lines as well. We explored the Ginza by foot and then took the train outside of town to eat an authentic Japanese steak house dinner. The staff were very accommodating and gracious.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Minako at the front desk is wonderful. We alway call directly to the hotel and speak to Minako to make my reservations. Nara, Tomomi, and Yuki, and everyone else at the front desk are great—helpful, friendly, welcoming! Ricardo, the concierge, is awesome! He has been a tremendous help every time we stay. He makes reservations, suggestions, finds information for us about everything we need, besides being a great guy to talk to. The staff at breakfast, especially Ayumi and Haruka, are also terrific. They anticipate exactly what we want every morning, and were especially warm on our last morning there, as was everyone else. Coming here is like coming “home” each time.Also, the location is great. A short walk to the Ginza area, which is great for shopping, dining, and close to the metro, which is super easy to use. If your there for several days, get a Pasmo card for simplicity in using the metro. Lots of English used in many places. There’s also a very helpful tourist information center a few blocks from the hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Ginza is one of the crowdest spot in Tokyo. Many tourists and businesses. However, this hotel is located 2 blocks away from the main Ginza street, but facing to a major traffic (which allows to get cab easily). So the hotel is really quiet and not crowded at all.Staffs greet you with smile, as always in Japan, and more than willing to chit chat with you or help you to enjoy the stay.One of the biggest pillow I ever experienced in hotels are really comfortable and provided me a great sleep. (bed and comforters are also very clean and cozy).The only thing was the low ceiling in the bathroom made me really hard to shower and blowing my hair. I had to walk out to hallway and use the full length mirror at closet. Bend my knees for showering.*I visited here during World Cup Rugby, so all the hotels were pricey. Among them, I would say the price was fair.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We started our Japan honeymoon at this wonderful hotel. The Courtyard team helped us get reservations all over the city even with my wife’s gluten allergy. Rooms are great and bathrooms clean with excellent showers. 10/10 would stay again. Also very close to old outer fish market (10min walk) and tons of trains to all the other neighborhoods around Tokyo. Great first stop on our adventure.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My wife and I just came back to Bangkok after having spent a whole week at the Courtyard in Ginza. We chose this hotel mainly because of its location. From there we could reach the shopping complex of Ginza within a few minutes. Although most of the time we were window shopping, but the mere fact that we were centrally located was already something we were looking for. Even one of the tours to Mt Fuji has its pickup point at this hotel. Breakfast was good and I was happy with the Japanese dishes that was offered every morning, be it the Mitso soup, the rice porridge or the steamed rice. Smoked salmon was always a delight and so were the variety of eggs that had been freshly prepared. The room was good, but with a street view it would have even much better. During the typhoon we were glad that our room was barricaded. Towards the end of our stay, the blocked view didn’t matter at all. All we had to do was just to take a walk outside.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at this Mariott hotel. It is in a busy shopping area of Tokyo, you can walk to a number of attractions from here. The staff at the hotel were wonderful. The breakfast was great. Comfortable room. The shower was hot with lots of pressure.I actually left my jacket in the room and we left the hotel, staying just 1 night, to travel in Japan. When we got back to Tokyo, I realized I didn't have my jacket and we called this hotel and they had saved it for me. I thought that was very kind and I did get my jacket back after a week of them hanging into it. Great service!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: It's a fine hotel. But given that Japan is such a warm and courteous place, I was a little surprised that they didn't recognize my Marriott status. Our plans didn't work out and we ended up in Tokyo a night early and needed a place to stay. Booked on the Marriott app, and redeem my pts for it. I've stayed at this hotel in the place for work and I feel like the service definitely hasn't kept up. I got checked in, no problem. But they didn't say thanks for coming back, or thanks for being a Marriott member. Didn't ask how my trip was. All pretty standard questions/greetings when you check in anywhere. The location is good, it's super close to the old fish market and we had breakfast there, the lobby is clean and looks new. The rooms are a little small, but not the smallest of the hotels we've stayed at.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Also tend to use the Marriott, the location is a breeze for the subway, I rode it from Haneda. It was a a five min walk from the subway.Location is literally off Ginza high street and behind Ginza Six (on street over).Food selection the neighbourhood is awesome, cannot daily location.Staff are great, although I still do not get why in this day and age not ALL hotels have USB outlets. Had to go down to reception and ask to borrow one - but please note.Room was ‘compact’ AC was on the cold side even with the thermo up to 28. I was told switch it off as it’s a central air system......great, then only dummies dial it up to 28 thinking there would be heat?!All in a good experience.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My go to place in Ginza for business. Have stayed over 45+ days in past 12 months. Amazing breakfast, clean and professional staff. The only smallest issue is the fact that the rooms are quite small. Great too as it is stop on the limousine bus from Narita. Location cannot be beat. One of the best thing is nespresso in the rooms!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is a Courtyard Marriott so my expectations have been adjusted to such. I did not expect a 5-star hotel - nevertheless this hotel has its pros and cons:Pros1) Friendly hotel staff - I also enjoyed my welcome gift (a lovely pink Japanese box of sweets), in addition to the usual Titanium Elite benefit2) Enjoyable breakfast buffet with good mix of Japanese / Continental spread and friendly accommodating wait staff3) Location that was not too far from a few Tokyo metro stations - a stone's throw away from the Tsujiki Wholesale Fish Market and the Ginza outpost of the always excellent Don Quijote store (to buy knick-knacks and souvenirs)4) this one is a wildcard but i really really loved the bedroom slippers!! By far the most comfy and substantial hotel bedroom slippers ive ever experienced - padded and cushioned at the bottom with Ginza written in the frontCons1) Rooms are cosy and i do mean cosy. I asked for a rollaway bed and instead of being upgraded i got a bed squeezed in the corner of the room which was not very comfortable but we made do2) The facilities are a bit dated but it wasn't too bad that we deemed unpleasant3) Limited Marriott Bonvoy privileges - no executive lounge You can tell from the tally above that the pros outweigh the cons, so if you're weighing whether to stay at this hotel. i would recommend it if you prefer to stay in the Ginza area, and if you don't mind that rooms can be quite cosy (but still reasonable by Tokyo standards!)Thanks to all at the hotel that made our stay comfortable.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We have recently stayed in Courtyard Tokyo Ginza Hotel and we were impressed with the services extended by the associates especially the Front Office Supervisor, Yoshito Ambo. His excellence service rendered was indeed a showcase of what true a hospitality is all about. Thank you for making our stay a pleasant and memorable one.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I had exchanged emails with Anna K. before our arrival. She was so helpful and professional, always replying so quickly. We took the Narita Access Bus (1,000 yen per person) and Anna sent me a link with specific directions from the Ginza Bus Stop where the bus dropped us off. It only took 15 mins to walk to the hotel. The location is terrific: 10-15 mins walk to the metro, shopping everywhere (Ginza 6 Mall is amazing), and lots of restaurants nearby. I would suggest a 3 day metro pass for 1,500 yen per person. Tokyo is huge- the metro is excellent and will get you everywhere very quickly. We were checked in by Haruka W. and she upgraded us to a spacious room. We were celebrating my adult son’s birthday, and she sent complimentary sandwiches and drinks to our room. Marriott does such a great job recognizing loyalty. Our room was super quiet, super clean, and had a safe and refrigerator. The hotel is a bit outdated, but the outstanding staff easily made up for the lack in decor. Every time Haruka saw us she personally greeted us with a huge smile. She helped us with directions, transportation, dining suggestions, and storing our luggage.It was our first time in Tokyo and the superior staff helped to make our stay perfect! Why did we have to leave? It was wonderful!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Was my 2nd visit to Tokyo. Last year I stayed in Shinjuku. I thoroughly enjoyed staying in the Ginza neighborhood. All of the convenience of Shinjuku with a bit less craziness. So, location was fine. And staff were uniformly kind and efficient. But property feels tired. I tend to prefer "modern concept" hotels, & this place is anything but. It felt like an airport hotel in the US. In the 1990s. Not something located in one of the world's premier, upscale neighborhoods. 1st room I checked into lacked a safe. Really, Marriott? You can't spring for safes for all your guest rooms? I opted to upgrade at my expense to higher tiered room that came with safe -- was my only option. Also, carpets. I LOATHE carpeting in hotel rooms. It just feels WRONG. Much prefer hard floors. Thankfully it's going the way of the dodo bird in an increasing percentage of the world's hotels, but, alas, not this one. And, although I'm not a zealot on the climate change issue, I've found most hotels in Asia these days require guests to deposit key cards into "power slots" to get electricity. This cuts down on energy waste, and (I've found, at least) is highly convenient, because it makes it easier to turn off the lights and appliances prior to leaving. Finally, there's construction going on. I didn't hear any noise, but, beware when you book you might not be so lucky. I believe the project in part of an expansion of the property. In summary, it was far from a bad experience, but wouldn't stay there again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel is well located, no doubt, just a 5 min walk to both metro lines, Ginza and Asakusa lines. Room is small, especially if you are more than 2 but you will find everything you need including a small bar. bottle of water complimentary which is always welcome in the hot summer of Japan. Everything was clean. We did find a small smell of humidity in our room but we were okay with it given we were only at the hotel for one night.You can have breakfast at the hotel for 1500 Yens per person which we thought was expensive so we went somewhere else.The Limousine Bus to Narita airport stops at this hotel, this is why we booked. The hotel will make reservation for you for 3,200 Yens per person and you can choose your pickup time. I am not sure the location justify the price per night for this hotel. I would give a 3/5 on price/value.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Spacious enough room and bathroom, good bed, quiet between rooms.Very nice to have a mobile phone for internet access available in the room to take with you for the duration of stay.Friendly staff. Though Ginza (and Tokyo) is known for expensive hotels, this was above what you get. Breakfast not included in the room charge and, while nice, too expensive for just a breakfast.Walking distance, around 10 min, to Simbashi station.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip and can say that my overall stay was not that bad. The location is very convenient only four short blocks from the Ginza and two blocks from the nearest subway station (Higashi-Ginza). The rooms were nice and comfortable.There will be a new AC Hotel build next door within the year, so that will be a definite upgrade. Overall good stay

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I made one of the biggest mistakes of my work trying to show loyalty to the Marriott Brand. Considering that there were much better (and cheaper) offers in Ginza, and that Marriott had the rate on their website advertised for around 400 usd per night, I figured that, as a way to show loyalty to them, considering we were going to stay for a full week, we found a rate on expedia for 250 USD / night - This was a mistake, because apparently if you book anywhere outside Marriott App or Website, your stay does not count - at all. It's like you were never there, so, either pay their rates (which, while in Tokyo are never cheap anyway) or, you're a nobody... In other words, if you're a bonvoy member, you have to be chained to bonvoy itself. Now, the hotel... Arriving from the Narita shuttle, the hotel lobby is pretty dark and dingy, like a 1970s movie, looks like it has not been changed in a long time, of course, on check in and being told that our status does not count, we get assigned to a double room, which are smaller than the walk in closet in other hotels. View ? You're in Ginza, you get the fantastic view of the construction site next door followed by rude staff down in the bar and the restaurant - why ? because by sitting in the common area next to the bar, you're inconveniencing them outside the hours (a big first in Japan) - and they don't hesitate to ask you to leave or not use the common area outside the serving hours. When serving, if you have a person who looks Japanese sitting with you, the server will turn to them and take the order from them despite speaking English, (quite embarassing if the person with you is a guest !!!!!) You're better off at the Denny's across the street, at least they will serve you drinks (not with a smile, but nonetheless) Breakfast was kind of OK, and the couple of times we used roomservice the food arrived hard and dry, very unpleasant with of course the bed being the only place to set it down (that's how small the rooms are). In short, I don't recommend this hotel, there are plenty of much better offers in and around Ginza, I'm just going to stick with other brands that take customer service much more seriously, and I recommend you do so too. It seems the central location did get to their head, and they don't hesitate to show it. Sorry guys, not for me.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed at this hotel at the suggestion of a co-worker and I was not disappointed. Although the hotel is somewhat dated, the enthusiastic staff makes up for that. The location is very convenient only four short blocks from the Ginza and two blocks from the nearest subway station (Higashi-Ginza).I cannot emphasize how friendly the staff is - they really care. Note that they are building a new AC Hotel next door, so this location will eventually be replaced by the AC. Hope they move all the staff there.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The only thing this hotel has going for it is its location. The rooms are bland, lacking any reason to stay other than sleeping. The breakfast is one step above continental. The staff puts on a good face, but they know they’re being propped up like used car salesmen. Everything about this hotel is overrated.
user_name:
Mrsinsay
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: First time to stay here and was immediately pleased by the location. It was easy to get a taxi to and from the hotel. Ginza 6 is also nearby, as with several restaurants and bars.though the room was small, it was clean. the bed was comfortable, and the pillow was good for my neck. Breakfast buffet offered several yummy options - both continental and Japanese. Room service was good, the staff was great and the food was quite tasty.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the Courtyard Ginza using our loyalty points on May 29 and stayed till May 31st. When we arrived just after 3 pm, we were told our rooms were not ready. Minako, the front office staff who looked after us, was most apologetic and offered us complimentary drinks while the room was getting ready. It was our 30th anniversary and she also make arrangements for a lovely welcome gift sent to our room. We barely finished our drinks and was told the room was ready and that our bags were sent to the room. As a business traveler, I have seen how a similar situation could have been mishandled. Minako was both professional and efficient and made the start of our stay both pleasant and enjoyable in spite of the inconvenience. Thank you.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I was shocked at the level of service for not only a Japanese establishment but also a Marriott property. There was nobody in front of the property to assist me with my large luggage when I exited the taxi unlike other Courtyard locations. I indicated in my Bonvoy app that I would be arriving at 10am. When I arrived at 10, I was told that my room wasn't ready, which was an unpleasant surprise, especially since I had purposely vacated my other hotel in Tokyo and made a long trip over to the Courtyard. I was asked to wait until 1130 for my room to be ready. When I came back to check in at 11 (being hopeful), I wasn't given a room upgrade, which is usual for Titanium Elite. Disappointing, but I know I'm not entitled to it based on availability. When I asked about complimentary breakfast, which is usually included for the status at all Marriott properties, I was told they do not offer that benefit to anyone of any status. The few positives is that the rooms are spacious and they offer nice yukatas. The other positive is that when I gave them feedback + a recording of the air conditioner sounding like a vacuum whenever it turned off, they offered to promptly to put me in another room, but since I was staying only one additional night, I declined, and asked them to quiet the AC if possible. I wish I would have stayed at my prior Tokyo property--while the room was far smaller, the amenities were nicer, and I felt like my business was welcomed.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Location is great but thats all the pros. The hotel is defiantly not an SPG brand level. All furnitures are old dirty outdated. Non working noisy ac. Marriott shouldDefiantly remove its logo or do a major renovation. For this price you can find modern, clean and much nicer hotel nearby!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The rooms are upper standard but our air-condition was not working, bathroom ok for Japan. Breakfast was good with very nice people. However the hotel bar is very expensive and without any view in the basement.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I can't say enough good things about the attention to detail and guest comfort at this hotel. The check in was easy and seamless and the staff was always willing to help quickly, kindly and efficiently with every request. The hotel itself was also quite nice - the lobby was well laid out, the rooms were fairly large for Tokyo, and there some welcome nice touches such as bottled water refreshed every day. Most of all, the hotel was quiet - such a relief in a big, busy city. As others have said, the location was great. It was easy to get to multiple subway lines and, when my work was completed, to enjoy Ginza. WiFi was strong and the breakfast buffet was both extensive and reasonably priced. I should also add that the staff always had good advice or offered extra help. When I was prepared to take a taxi to Haneda, they suggested the bus that picked up right outside their door. It was inexpensive, comfortable, and efficient. When I did take a taxi, they sent someone with me to let the driver know my destination in Japanese. When I needed to take the subway, they sold multi-day cards right at checkout. If it isn't clear from all of the above, I could not recommend the Courtyard Ginza more highly.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My friend and i were in Tokyo recently and we stayed at the Courtyard Tokyo Ginza Hotel. The location in Ginza was great! We were both given rooms in the 01 line-single rooms which we were told they do not bother to heat these rooms unless they are going to be used. My room was small but functional. They had a full coffee and tea service [replenished daily] however there were a limited amount of electrical outlets in the room overall. My first night I had no heat at all and had to call down for a blanket as well as for a heater which arrived immediately [I wonder why] I ended up using this heater for the entire time I was there. My room safe was not working and I had to ask for another one-this was promptly replaced the following day. The shower had no protective decals on the surface of the tub [dangerous for the elderly or poorly coordinated who could fall] and the shower liner was so thin and flimsy and would stick to your body which was annoying while showering. On a positive note, the electrical outlets were American as well as Japanese. There was also an iron, ironing board, hair dryer, a refrigerator but no microwave but a heated toilet and a bidet. My favorite feature was the Nespresso coffee maker with pods which was great in the morning before breakfast. We got the breakfast [Western and Asian options] as part of our package and this was comprehensive and delicious and the staff was extremely accommodating filling our coffee cups at every turn. I prefer staying at Marriotts when travelling and as I stated earlier, it was a comfortable stay despite these few glitches I mentioned.
user_name:
ianshamshey
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed at this property for 1 night upon my arrival for vacation in Japan. I stay at many Marriott's for business, mostly in the US, and this hotel was right on par with my usual Couryard experience. I enjoyed a quiet non-smoking room on a lower floor. Breakfast was wonderful (was included as I am a Platinum member) and had both Japanese and American options. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful with a metro map and also offered 72hr metro pass available for purchase on site. The location was excellent! I also stayed at 2 other Marriott/SPG properties in Tokyo and this one was by far in the best place. Easy to get to from 1 metro stops, and plenty of close food options. Will definitely be staying here again on my next trip to Tokyo!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Business trip...Close to office...Cheaper than the other Courtyards (Which is even closer to the office)...But, smacked in the middle of Ginza, close to many shops, restaurants and a bunch of metro stations...Staff are friendly and accommodated an early check in request quickly...Rooms are small, but this is Tokyo, so space is at a premium...Mos def I will be back if and when I have to be in Tokyo for work again...

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel is in a very convienient area in Ginza- not in the middle of the lights but a few blocks away in a quieter street. The metro stations are easy access. and if you want to shop and dine in Ginza... no porblem.The hotel staff is polite and very helpful. The rooms are tight which is the usual in Japan but very comfortable. I stayed in a single occupancy room, so the line generally doesn't have a high up Ginza view. At this time of year it can be cold, and it seemed like the room heat is not that strong or turned off. I had to ask to for a room heater. No issues thereafter. Breakfast was amazing with many choices and unlimited coffee.The bed is comfortable and firm. Pillows are nice- one hard and one soft. Take your pick or use both.Bathroom is the usual Japanese style Toto toilet with all the bells and whistles.This will now be my go to place when in Tokyo.
user_name:
Panchali D
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: First, some frame of reference: I’ve stayed at a lot of hotels in Tokyo, from the large legends (Peninsula) to the boutiques (Andaz) to the low-cost (b-Hotel) and capsule hotels (9-hours). This Marriott Courtyard doesn’t pretend to be anything it’s not. It’s a Bonvoy-centric property planted in a quieter area of Ginza. Not surprisingly, it leans to the West, but maintains a nice touch of the Japanese hospitality and efficiency. There are always plenty of staff that absolutely go out of their way to be friendly and helpful, but never fawning or intrusive. Japanese hospitality is always good, but this is great. The rooms are good sized for Japan, incredibly quiet, and the bathroom is well appointed with all the usuals you’d expect at a Courtyard. It’s well priced considering the location. Restaurant has an excellent buffet with both Eastern and Western fare, including cooked to order eggs and waffles. They also serve lunch and dinner, but I didn’t partake, so can’t comment. If you’re looking for predictable service and personable staff in a nicely appointed well-priced property in the Ginza area, this is worth considering. I’ve stayed two times in the past month, and my experience was 5-stars both times. Very much a top-of-line Marriott Courtyard with the right amount of legendary Japanese hospitality.
user_name:
Ronn2pints
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed several days at Courtyard Marriott Ginza. Hotel is overall nice and rooms are sufficient. Room maid was nice and efficient. The rooms are small but acceptable and everything in the rooms was clean and neat. Breakfast buffet was very good, with a lot of choices. Price was $15.00 USD per person for breakfast buffet if not high enough Marriott Status to get it free. Front desk staff were personable and helpful. I was only able to find the concierge one time, for about 15 minutes and he was able to help me plan a trip to the Samurai museum and a Shinkansen bullet train day trip to Odawara (which I highly recommend.) Four of us went down to the lower level bar for a drink about 7:00pm one evening, and although the bar was empty, they were charging 700 Yen each "cover charge" to sit for a drink. We declined and went upstairs to the "lobby bar/cafe" instead which is very sterile. We also tried dinner in the hotel Korin restaurant, which is highly forgettable and I do not recommend. One of our party had her dinner completely forgotten and we had to ask several times for it. Both the service and food (Sushi & Tempura) were just OK. There are, luckily, a wide range of good restaurants within walking distance.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great location and the breakfast here is fantastic for titanium members. The rooms are small (as with most rooms in Japan) but totally fine. I wouldnt hesitate to stay here again as I think it represents a very good value for your points. They also honor the full titanium benefits unlike others in the chain (I'm looking at you prince hotel) which members have been facing problems at.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: A well located hotel in the Ginza area. Walking distance to very upscale shopping and to many many eating establishments. The executive rooms are small and a bit dated but very clean. The breakfast was fabulous combining Asia and America foods.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed here last year and didn't think twice about returning because we had such a great time. While we weren't upgraded to a premium room on the 11th floor like last year, we were given a prime room on the 9th (#925) which, while a bit smaller than a premium, suited us just fine for 2 whole weeks. Can't say enough nice things about housekeeping, who came every single day and left our room pristine. Same goes for the breakfast crew who are all so efficient, but very personable and the front desk crew. The hotel's location is terrific. Close to several subway stations and the Ginza just a few blocks away. We availed of their world class subway system to go everywhere in Tokyo and had a blast. It was nice to come back to the hotel and have a beer at the bar (received complimentary drinks coupons as well) before retiring. There's no doubt this will be our go-to hotel when we return. ありがとうございました

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Hotel is well located to subway and walkable major attractions, (fish market, Temple, imperial palace) including all shopping Ginza area and many restaurant options.Only downside, hotel was last renovated in 2008, so not modern or contemporary, getting tired. However rooms are spotless and front desk associates are warm welcoming and helpful. As Mariott Bonvoy member don’t expect upgrade, as other reviews have mentioned.No special acknowledgment given and I am elite and requested upgrade in advance celebrating special occasion - disappointing

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The property itself is nicely located and maintained. But the service is just cold. We are a family of 8 with 6 year old and every morning we did not have any staff saying good morning to us except one nice gentleman manning the airport bus station.A few ladies at the receoption had poker face.A family of 8 with a young kid checking in. No porter service no trolley being offered no good morning or any greetings. My boy sayid ohayogozaimasu to instigate a “good morning” in the end.We do not expect exceptional service, but no offer to help with luggage and not even good mornings!I must say this is not a Marriott courtyard that I expect.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel locates in a walking distance from Shimbashi station and just one block away from Ginza shopping street. The hotel provides nice breakfast buffet. The room is large than normal Japanese hotels. The facilities are standard plus free wifi. The wifi speed is satisfactory.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The location is good, right in Ginza. The hotel is clean, the rooms are small and the business folk at breakfast are aggressive. If you don't move quickly, someone will snatch your place in the egg line or at the toaster. The rooms are fine. But for the price, you can get a better deal at other hotels including the Tokyo Marriott

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The room was large by Japanese standards. The huge tub was used several times throughout a two-week stay, especially after long afternoons of sight-seeing. The staff was welcoming, friendly and beyond helpful. The kimonos were a nice local touch and were super comfy!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I found the breakfast most appealing to me at this hotel. They offer fresh orange juice. They have a variety of international and Japanese food. I enjoyed most the croissants fresh from the oven being delivered to you by the courteous waitress. The Japanese rice congee was also hot and yummy. The bacon was crispy. The mini mushroom was tasty. The coffee was very good. The sunny side eggs were very well prepared. The only drawback was the milk for coffee was not in a jar but those packed cartridges. The price was value for money for hotel residents, just 1500 yens.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I recently stayed at this hotel. The hotel itself was pleasant but this review is about the incompetence of the hotel staffs on dealing with Marriott rewards points.Few days after my check-out, I realized that my stay was missing on my Marriott account. I stayed at the hotel for a long period of time, so I obviously cared about getting the points that I was entitled to. I called the hotel, initially thinking that it'd be an easy fix (as it should be!). Guess what, it has been over two weeks, I have talked to four different staffs, sent almost ten e-mails, and my stay still hasn't been posted to my Marriott account. The last staff that I talked to tells me that it'd take them a month to fix the issue. And of course, the staff didn't explain to me why they'd need an entire month to resolve such a simple problem.The hotel itself is nice. But if you are looking to stay here because you have a status with the SPG/Marriott rewards program, then think twice. The staffs have very little understanding of the rewards system and once they screw something up, it'd take them forever to fix the issue.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: If you are looking for a hotel near Ginza 6, Mitsukoshi, and Uniqlo, this property is only a couple of blocks away, manageable even in rain and wind. Rooms are small but adequate and impeccably clean. It would be nice if you could open a window as winter central heating can be suffocating. TV could use something other than CNN (France24, BBC, DW, anything else). Gym is small but adequate and never over subscribed. Food is very good as is the breakfast. Staff are consummately professional and helpful. Thank you all.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel is conveniently located in Ginza, close to the high-end shopping streets. The closest two metro stops are a few minute walk away, which is of course ideal. The hotel staff is great, and the breakfast buffet is okay (enough options but nothing particularly exciting). The rooms are quite small (including the prime room), and a bit outdated. No USB chargers, and one of the biggest problems: no AC that can be controlled from the room, so it gets pretty hot at night.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The staff was fantastic and the rooms were comfortable. The breakfast was very good as well with many choices. The hotel had a local mobile phone with internet to use while staying there which was a great feature, it had better battery life than my personal one. The concierge was very helpful in getting restaurant reservations.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This was an excellent hotel in an excellent location! the service was impeccable. They provide a free phone to you so that you can have access to google maps and are able to make calls while you are exploring Tokyo. We thought that was a very unique and helpful service. We made use of that phone all the time. This hotel had an excellent breakfast buffet, and was walkable to metro station and tons of excellent shopping and restaurants so it was very easy to manage getting to and from tours/excursions. Rooms were very clean, comfortable and fully equipped.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The Courtyard Tokyo Ginza is close to restaurants and shopping especially if you are into brand names. But the major factor is that it is easy walking distance to the bus station to take you to Narita and back to Tokyo. In my opinion the bus is a lot easier to take than the different options of train or metro.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Traveling with a friend and it was our first time in Tokyo. We thought the hotel was wonderful in many ways - the staff is excellent, efficient and accommodating, the breakfast fresh with many options, the room neat and very clean. Having robes provided was delightful and unexpected. The only reason I didn't rate it five stars is because they turned off the central air conditioning (due to the season) and our room was warmer than we wanted. The brought a fan, but all a fan does is move around already warm air. The location was near two subway stops. Other than the air conditioning issue, I would highly recommend this hotel. Compared to the typical U.S. Courtyard experience, this felt like a high-end hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Am back in Tokyo on business and the Courtyard Marriot Ginza has been delightful.Amazing staff , polite, efficient with total attention to detail.Rooms are typical Japanese size but have everything you need and are very up to date.Breakfast was outstanding with wonderful but very complete mix of both western and asian offers. Quality , freshness and flavor was right on point.Thank you.I shall return.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel has the some pros and cons. The pros first is the staff at the courtyard is excellent similar to all the other Asia countries that I have experienced. The cons is as lifetime platinum elite status, no upgrade was available. Given a very standard room. The worst part of the hotel is the room has no air conditioning. I do not know if that true for the premium rooms , but I would have not picked this hotel if that the case. This should be clearly advertise in advance in the web page.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is a very nice hotel for a Courtyard. I was apprehensive booking a stay there at first, given my somewhat uninspiring experiences with the Courtyard Marriotts in the US. This one is better by far, feels like at least a US Westin or Hyatt Regency (may be even better than some of those). Service was superb, attentive and always helpful. The breakfast buffet in the morning was very diverse, with both Eastern and Western options (it was included with my Platinum status). The rooms have been recently remodeled and are of a good size. I had a king room. It was quite spacious for Tokyo, definitely will be comfortable for 2 persons. It looked exactly like their web-site pictures. There is a mini bar (with a somewhat limited selection of drinks and snacks), it housed my dinner left overs well. There is a hot water kettle, hint: may be used for instant noodles (not provided), as well as tea and coffee (provided). There are two subway stations within walking distance - Higashi-ginza (5 min) and Ginza (9 min). The hotel provides a mobile phone in the room for the time of your stay (free of charge) that you can take out and use for navigation, phone calls (limited countries, but US is on the list), and general data surfing - very helpful when you don't get the international data plan. The price for the room was very reasonable as well. I will definitely stay here again. Big thanks to the staff!!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: expect to be upgraded here. As an effort to keep track of what hotels will upgrade their most loyal customers, I will start posting hotels that actually will be honoring their most loyal customers on here.For this hotel, it it clean, small (as most hotels in Japan, except the Conrad, to my knowledge that is, as I've only stayed there), but convenient. No lounges, but breakfast coupon for PP members if you choose to.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The staff at the courtyard Tokyo Ginza are fantastic, they are so friendly and professional. One of the most special staff members is Morgan, he is at your service and asking you how he can assist, before you even see him, phenomenal! I highly recommend staying at this hotel if you visit Ginza for pleasure, business or vacation, no matter the length of stay. They are the best throughout your entire trip. I've been there twice and their professional attitudes, kindness and assistance with anything is always above expectations.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I had a urgent trip to Tokyo and need to be in the Ginza - Onarimon area. This hotel fitted the bill, it was SPG/Marriott, and close to where I needed to be. I arrived on an early morning flight, and the airport Limousine bus route took me straight to the hotel. Unfortunately the hotel doesn't have a Club Level, but apart from that it is excellent. Check-in was quick, and they treated me well due to my Platinum status, the room was on the top floor, unfortunately no views as such but that's expected in a large crowded city. Room was clean, as was the bathroom, bed great, amenities great. shower excellent. I ate in the Japanese restaurant which was pleasant and good food, and had a few drinks in the bar which has a nice feel and atmosphere.All in all a greta experience.Service - 9/10Room - 8.5/10Food & Drinks - 8/10Atmosphere - 9/10Overall - 8.75

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Very nice hotel in Ginza. Modern, with a lounge, bar, and a restaurant. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms are very clean, and a little large then the typical hotel rooms in Japan. Good wife in the rooms too

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Wonderful stay. Highly recommend.At this price point I don't think I could be more statisfied with my stay. The staff were all fantastic and made sure all my needs and requests were met promptly and without fuss. Outstanding.The hotel is close to Higashi Ginza station and not too far from the Ginza shopping district. Rooms are slightly smaller than I am used to but well appointed and clean. The bed was awesome. Sheets clean and crisp. The bathroom was a bit cramped and my head nearly hit the ceiling when in the shower but the water was strong and hot.The amenities were very good - everything for him and her.Room was a bit chilly when I arrived despite the thermostat being set to 24°c. Wifi was fast and easy. 2 thumbs up.The complimentary mobile phone was helpful as well for making local calls when out and about.Note to management: Because this hotel has both English (not a transliteration of the Japanese name) and Japanese names, there can be some issues when telling drivers where to go. On the left of the entrance in Japanese it says 銀座東武ホテル (Ginza Tobu Hotel), but on the right of the entrance it says Courtyard Tokyo Ginza Hotel. This can lead to missunderstandings as about half of the drivers I encountered knew the hotel only as the Ginza Tobu Hotel, or just the Tobu Hotel. Perhaps mentioning this to visitors could help avoid any confusion. Handing out a taxi card with the room key might help.Also, when leaving the subway there is a sign, but without proper English (for example "you are here" is only written in Japanese - 現在地). Not helpful unless you can read Japanese. Also, while the closest exit is A1, and the placard is placed near A1, it shows it as Higashi Ginza exit A2 - not really helpful. Road names etc are all in Japanese. Before the Olympics, it would be important to remedy these issues and install appropriate signage.The airport bus from Narita stops at the hotel - which could be useful after a long journey to someone using public transportation.Overall a wonderful stay - will definitely return.
user_name:
MaikKubo
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Very good location. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Excellent breakfast with many nice choices. Staff is very nice and friendly. Many nice restaurants nearby. Close to shopping and metro station.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Courtyard in Ginza probably a tad bit nicer than the typical Courtyards in the US. The rooms were nice, but quite small. Location was nice in Ginza area and close to business district and lots of good restaurants. The breakfast buffet was decent, but obviously catering to Americans.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Just located near Ginza metro station in Tokyo central district, the most prosperous and busiest one here, this hotel might be the most convenient for visitors who would like to enjoy a comfortable stay at reasonable room rate and to experience a fashionable life style in this modern city. Belonging to Marriott International Group, the hotel did keep good quality of its facilities and services, as my standard room was spacious, neat, and even well-equipped for me with a handy phone for free nationwide calls and data use during my stay in Tokyo. The staff was also very friendly, courteous and helpful, even hospitably making an advanced lunch reservation for me at a very outstanding Michelin-Starred restaurant. Overall everything was perfect and satisfying at this hotel, and it will be my first choice next time I visit Tokyo again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The location of this hotel is the best part about it. This is located right in the heart of Ginza, walking distance from the restaurants and shops. The staff is friendly and courteous. Though the room sizes are bit disappointing..

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: It is unassuming and has all the charm of what a business hotel is supposed to haveI did see many families staying and because its close to upscale shopping and tokyo stationThe bar kiron is well stocked but would need more life to attract businessmen unwind ..The lobby bar is very popular and reasonable..

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Location is very convenient to Tokyo Station, and not far at all from the Emporer's Palace, Fish Market, museums and other travel highlights. Many nearby restaurants, as well as a very nice small grocery store that has wine, liquor, etc. Rooms are clean, but small. Nice reception area with free wifi, complimentary drinks for Marriott members and easy access to Tokyo Station to travel elsewhere, return to airport, etc.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The only positives are the location in central Ginza with easy walking for example to the Kabuki theatre. Also the bus that goes directly to Haneda.But the rooms were tiny, and old fashioned and really expensive. Fortunately only stayed 1 night and wouldn't stay there again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Hotel was clean but rooms too small and old fashioned. Location is good. Bed quality are not extremely good. Not too happy here. Will not come again. Other hotels are fresher in the neighborhood. However the breakfast costs JPY 2.500.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel’s location is close to a lot of interesting places, just walk around and you’ll already experience many Tokyo popular spots.The hotel is very clean, staff are so friendly and they’re very respectful and attentive to your needs and we really enjoyed their buffet breakfast!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed in this hotel in May accompanied my husband on his business trip. The location is great, being very close to the main shopping area ( not that I did any shopping) and a short walk to subways. The hotel staffs are polite and helpful. The breakfast selection was adequate. The stand out feature was the Handy mobile phone in guest room. It is a very innovative feature. It's like a GPS but with a lots of features. Before I came to Tokyo I was wondering how to explore the city without being able to speak the language. With Handy I was able to visit quite a few places on my own. The only low down is the hotel doesn't have an executive lounge. But over all I enjoyed my stay.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The rooms were clean and comfortable, and each room came with a smartphone (and data) that you could use throughout your stay. The hotel is also in a very good location, as it is close to a shopping street, to Ginza 6, to the train station, and various restaurants/stores. Its also very close to the Healing Gardens, which are only 20 mins away.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for 2 weeks and the location was perfect. Close to the subway (ginza-higashi i think) and walking distance to both malls and tsukiji market. I was also upgraded to a larger room. Breakfast was alright, not too much variety but there are some changes every now and then. The fried chicken was really good! Staff were very helpful and assisted us in restaurant reservations. Not much to watch on tv (which is norm in Japan it seems), but the internet works fine so I could stream Netflix. As this is courtyard instead of JW, I didn't have very high expectations, and all my needs were met. Will definitely stay here again, even for personal travels.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is not a typical Courtyard. It's more upscale. Located very close to many places you may want to visit, like the Tsukiji Fish Market, Hamariyu garden or the shopping area. Service is perfect, like in many Japanese establishments. Room, I was in the Premium one, is well appointed, comfortable, with everything I needed, including a fancy razor, toothbrush, hair brush, etc. TV had a couple of English channels. Internet is free.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel is in need of a serious upgrade! The rooms are very dark and depressing. The breakfast at the hotel was very good. It’s in a decent location if you are looking to shop in Ginza and the subway is a quick walk away

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: If you like American style hotels, you won't be disappointed with this Marriott property. Staff is nice, the rooms aren't huge but adequate in size and nicely appointed. The entire hotel is very clean. Breakfast buffet, which is not cheap, is excellent. Conveniently located close to two different train stations for different lines. Good location for the train to Asakusa to visit shrines and shopping, even rent a geisha outfit for the day. Tokyo Skytree observation tower is close by.If you're into high end shopping, there is numerous high-end retailers just a few blocks away to shop and lots of places to eat.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Qualifier: I am a Marriott Vacation Club member & as such qualify for some benefits that might incur additional costs. The below review is on the basis of having this membership.The Courtyard Tokyo Ginza Hotel is conveniently located near Higashi Ginza but in a quieter part of the tourist/fashion district on Showa Dori. We were checked in by Ms. Minako K. Her english ability & cheerful professional attitude made check-in very pleasant. We found the room to be spacious & well designed especially in a Tokyo location. The view was unremarkable but what to expect in a densely packed city! As part of our accommodation package, we were given the daily breakfast buffet. The food choices reflected the cosmopolitan nature of the hotel with both western & Japanese food well represented. I could not help noticing the range of languages spoken by the guests which made we wonder if we were truly in Japan.The downsides are minor but for Japan worth noting that the hotel does not have a public bath or onsen and the fitness center is quite small.The hotel has a free pocket size walking/running map from the hotel to either Hibiya Park or the Imperial Palace grounds. This is a better alternative than the treadmill. The closest subway entrance is near the Mitsui Millenium Hotel. If the weather is inclement, you can walk through the Higashi Ginza subway access all the way to the Ginza subway station for access to additional lines. Pasmo IC cards are especially useful here for public transportation.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Have stayed here many times and what hits the most is the great staff who go out of their way to assist.It is a small hotel well decorated and presented and not at all like a US Courtyard and Marriott should be very happy with this one. The rooms are neat and clean although smaller (Japanese style) but the hotel has a great location in Ginza, a great restaurant fro breakfast and also the Limousine Bus service to the airports.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Fantastic experience at the Courtyard Ginza! Compared to Courtyard properties in the US this was a a pleasant surprise. Our room (11th floor premium floor) was very spacious and comfortable. Plenty of room for 2 of us for 5 nights. We loved the heated toilet seat and built in bidet! Also the Japanese robes and slippers nightly was a great touch. -The breakfast (included if Platinum) was fantastic! Plenty of local cuisine and standard Western fare. Eggs made to order (eggs Benedict, omelets, you name it!), fresh squeezed orange juice, and great staff! Every morning was greeted with smiling friendly faces. -All the hotel staff we encountered were friendly and easy to talk to. Check in was a breeze. Even got coupons for 2 free drinks a night because of our status. -The concierge desk had plenty of one page print outs of local things to see that explained them as well as gave specific directions of how to get to them from the hotel. -Gym was biggest downfall/disappointment. No weight machines and limited weight lifting options. Plenty of cardio machines though.-Location: Great location in Ginza off the busy streets. Plenty to eat and drink around the hotel. Liquor store and convenience store right across the street. Metro a 5 minute walk, Tsukiji fish market 10 minute walk. After looking into all the Marriott properties in Tokyo I am glad we chose this one due to the location, amenities, and price.
user_name:
sailawaywithsean
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I really enjoyed staying at the Courtyard Ginza. The location is great near upscale shopping and dining. The rooms were big and the beds are comfy. I found the staff to be nice and helpful. They upgraded our room upon arrival. There isn’t a concierge so they give you a drink coupon and you get a buffet breakfast if you are elite. I definitely would stay here again. It is also the meeting place for the Mt Fuji day trip.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Nice and clean and well kept and well located hotel in The Ginza District of Tokyo, Japan. Stayed in this hotel during my recent holiday to Tokyo. Room was smaller than normal being Japan.Staff was friendly as well.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: such a poor check in experience. didn't have the room that we paid for. no info on food, wifi or daily rate given. room very average and bathroom needs some work done to it. An OK hotel for Tokyo city centre.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Located in a convenient spot for the Ginza area with the Main Street and subway a 5min wall away.Hotel is clean and comfortable, the rooms a decent size with all the usual amenities.Staff are polite and helpful all across.Breakfast spread is reasonable with the usual mix of western and local items.Gym is small but for Japanese hotel standards has a decent set of free weights and a couple cardio machines, and most importantly at no additional cost.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This was the first Marriott's I stayed in Japan and it had left a big positive impression of this hotel.So this second stay, which came after some 12 years later is sort of a disappointment.Though staff are great, the hotel is showing signs of wear. In addition while the bed n main room facilities in the room are ok, room amenities aren't comparable to other Marriott's in the same category.On my 1st stay, this hotel was categorised as a Cat 5 by Marriott. It's Cat 7 now but the standards are not comparable to the other Marriott's in the same category. I'd probably opt for other Marriott's on the next trip to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel is in a great location. Ideal for walking and offered a 24 hours Denny across the street. Most restaurants and coffee shops open later in the morning so having access to a Denny's early in the morning was nice. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights in December. The hotel was fine to use as a base with a fair selection for breakfast. The location was great to get around Tokyo. We had what we thought would be a traditional Japanese dinner one evening but the food was not to any of our tastes (despite all being very adventurous]. We actually fared better watching where locals went and not knowing what we were ordering.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed 3 nights on a B&B basis as part of a tour package. As with Marriott the rooms were large, comfortable with good WiFi. Reception staff had a good knowledge of English. The concierge had extensive A4 guides to local attractions with directions from the hotel including which Metro line and ticket price - all most helpful. Plenty of choice at breakfast with Western and local menus. Good lounge accommodation. Nearby there are plenty of cafes/restaurants and a large selection of top end shops. A very comfortable stay. Close to Metro stations. Used by many tour groups.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great place if you are staying in central Tokyo/Ginza. The airport bus drops you off outside and there is a very helpful English-speaking gentleman who can help with arranging transport and other issues. Book ahead and off-peak to secure a good rate. Rooms are not the biggest but we were not here to sit in the room.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Our stay at this hotel was uneventful. Everything went okay from the time we checked in until the time we left Tokyo. The rooms are generally more spacious considering its Tokyo where space is prime. I love the location of this hotel. Walking distance to the famous shopping and dining areas of Ginza as well as the Shimbashi and Ginza stations. If you’re planning to walk to the hotel, use the Ginza exit- it’s a shorter walk than Shimbashi. As we’ve come to expect the Marriott brand didn’t disappoint. However, if there’s one opportunity I would advise this hotel is to do a better job in managing their guests’ expectations. We arrived Monday and asked the concierge to make a reservation to one of the popular sushi restaurants in Tokyo. I gave Wen (she’s the concierge) a few options for our availability because I know it’s hard to get in. She promised to call the restaurant. Tuesday came, no update. Wednesday came, still no update. Thursday mid-day, no update (our flight back to SFO is Friday). I finally had to follow-up with the front desk only to learn that my account had been noted with “they called, no answer from restaurant”. I would’ve appreciated if I was informed right away so we could’ve made other plans. I could’ve gone to another restaurant that I also wanted to try. I also find the staff here not as friendly and caring as the other Marriott hotel staff I’ve encountered before. A refresher course on customer service is perhaps overdue.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Compared to Hilton Shinjuku which was highly rated by us for the location, the location of Courtyard Marriott Ginza was even more convenient as it was just a 10-minute walking to reach 4-Chome which was the most popular and busy street in Ginza for shopping and dinning. The disadvantage of this hotel was no upgrade and Executive Lounge facility even we are Elite Platinum member. The hotel room is small but neat and clean. Service in coffee house, Japanese restaurant was excellent. Our conclusion was that it was good if you are looking for convenience, otherwise, it was expensive and not really value for money.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great location and within walking distance of Imperial Palace and fish market and other places.Do NOT go cheap on the rooms and go for the largest you can afford. The cheap/smaller rooms are really, really small ... it's worth spending the extra for the larger room. Buffet breakfast, lunch & dinner are ok, built I recommend walking around and eating in a local restaurant ... couldn't find a bad one :)

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed in many great hotels during out month long trip to Asia. This was not one of them. The location is good and easy to book tours as they have a tour desk in the lobby (though watch out for the falsely advertised “tour of Kyoto”) and an easy walk to the famous fish market. If you are a plat in any of their award programs, however, there is no upgrade so be prepared for a tiny room and only use this place when booking on points because it is certainly not worth paying dollars as we did. Other than that, the beds are hard as the lower value hotels like this don’t use mattress toppers like the Ritz Carltons do so be prepared for hard beds. Good spot for access to subways but not a place to stay for comfort.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We had a very mixed experience at this hotel, so I'll list the good and bad:The good.Great Location, 2 subway stations within 3/5 minute walk.Friendly, helpful staff once you arrive.Breakfast was good.The Bad.Communication with the hotel prior to the stay was ignored, which was annoying as we were trying to provide our Mariott Rewards number so that the hotel would know our preferences, which would have avoided the problems we had on arrival.When we arrived, despite obviously booking as a family we were placed in a smoking room. We were moved after 3 days (of a 5 day stay), but by then all of our clothes smelt of smoke.The room, like most Japanese Hotels was small, but this was made worse by the fact that we were given 3 single beds- which made things even tighter.Pillows were quite small and not particularly comfortable.I am conscious that our review is lower than most, and can think of two reasons why:We stayed during the Sakura season, which meant the hotel was expensive, we were paying over USD$500 per night, but the hotel definitely doesn't provide value for that price. I imagine people rating the hotel a 5 paid much less.People expect Japanese Hotel rooms to be small, so don't mark it down. However I have stayed in hotels with small rooms before, but they have been very well designed, for instance the CitizenM Hotel in New York- the rooms there are much smaller than here, but the design is so good that it doesn't feel it. This hotel has very little design consideration, the lobby and bar areas aren't particularly welcoming with little atmosphere, and the rooms are a bog standard design.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The location is Great. You can walk to shopping and many restaurants. Subway is close to get around Tokyo. The hotel needs a renovation but the rooms were comfortable. The buffet breakfast is good. Staff is the best! Will stay here again my next trip to Tokyo

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: An amazingly welcoming and cozy Hotel, excellent location and best breakfast in town. The Fish market is within walking distance, great shops and the Imperial Palace grounds are nearby if you are a good walker. The staff was amazing from beginning to end. It gets my vote for the price, location and room quality.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Location is great. Airport limousine stops right outside the hotel, however, it took almost two hours from the airport as it's the last stop in Ginza, but it took just over an hour when going back to the airport cos it's also the last stop in town.Hotel room is big in Tokyo standard. We're a family of 3 and there's enough space for an extra bed in the room. Room was tidy and clean. Staff speaks fluent English and are very nice.You really can shop till you drop in the area, big varieties from luxurious LV shop, Sony store, Mitsukoshi and Matsuya department stores, Itoya (stationery), Uniqlo flagship store, to 24 hours supermaket / bargain store 'Donki'.I really enjoyed my stay in the Courtyard and have no hesitation to stay here again in my next visit.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The location is excellent (very close to Metro, shops, restaurants) as well as many business HQs are walkable so you can easily combine business with pleasure.Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast is a must. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the tiny size of my single room which didn't allow me to swing a cat let alone feel relaxed after a long day of meetings. Treat yourself to a room upgrade to avoid the shoebox feeling (the room was very clean and neat though).Great choice overall!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We were upgraded to a premium guest room on the 11th floor, given drinks coupons for all 5 days and complimentary breakfast daily (worth it's weight in gold), and we were even treated to an impromptu bday celebration tray delivered to our room, complete with candles! We've never had that sort of service in any Courtyard Marriott in the U.S., that's for sure. The bfast buffet was more than substantial, with both western and Asian bfast choices and again, excellent service by the wait staff. Our room was much larger than I expected and extremely comfortable, cleaned impeccably every single day. It was a great way to end our 2 week stay in Japan and there's no doubt we'll be staying here again next time we're in town. Oh, and finally, terrific location, right off of the Ginza, with easy access to the subway via Ginza Six.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: If you want to be in the hustle and bustle of the shops and nightlife of Ginza this is the hotel to stay in. The rooms are good and comfortable and the breakfast buffet is good. Everything is within walking distance from this hotel including a metro station so that you can get around Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: For tourists wanting to stay in Ginza, this is one of the best hotel to stay. From the airports, buses will take u straight in front of the hotel. Its a relatively old hotel which has been renovated, and so near to Ginza 6 mall. Around the block there are so many great restaurants, convinient stores and small cafes.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Excellent location, 2 minutes walk to the metro. The room was small. We did not buy the breakfasts so cannot tell what they were like. Hotel staff very polite and smiling, but this is normal in Tokyo. We stayed 4 nights and there was one evening when we came back very late to the hotel and the room was not made. Funny enough, somebody must have come in, as we had fresh bottles of water and chocolates left on the desk. Apart from hearing "sorry about that" we did not get anything else. Pick up by bus to go to the airport was quite chaotic - the concierge labelled our luggage and told us to leave it at the reception. When the bus arrived, however, nobody came with our luggage and we ended up putting it in the bus trunk ourselves. There were 3 hotel staff looking after this "process", but they did not seem to know how to manage this activity.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: one of the best locations in Tokyo -inside Ginza area, close to metro stations. very close to Tokyo station and walking distance from Shimbashi stationroom size is big compare to hotels in Tokyo - don't expect standard Asian hotels sizeshower is greatservice is excellent although its not a surprise in Japan

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed here twice on this trip—before and after a trip to Sapporo. Outstanding service, room, breakfast, and location! Everyone here is amazing. Can’t remember everyone’s names, but here goes: Ricardo and Lin (concierges), May Mon, Mina, Morgan, Kodate, Yui Yamashita, and others at the front desk, Orimoto and Nara in the lobby lounge. Also Sabitri Kapali and the rest of the staff in the breakfast area are great. We can’t say enough good things about the staff! Of all the places we’ve been in all of our travels, this has to be the best! From the moment we enter to check in to the moment we leave, everyone greets us by name and with a big smile. I’m sure this is partly due to the fact that my husband stays here three times a year, but I’m also sure it is sincere.Ricardo, in particular, went above and beyond for us for this trip. We contacted him about a month before we arrived to see if he could get us Shinkansen tickets to get to Sapporo for the annual snow festival, and he took care of it for us. We were very fortunate to have his assistance. He also helped us out several times with restaurant reservations, directions, etc. And he also explained the “mystery phone” in our room, which we had never seen before on previous trips. He told us it’s a smart phone that we could use to call the US for free, which was awesome, since we were able to check for messages on our home phone, in case there was something important. And it can also be used to look for restaurants, tours, etc. This is a VERY nice addition to this hotel’s amenities!May Mon was also very helpful to us for the trip to Sapporo. She reserved a room for us at a hotel that was perfectly located for the festival.Even as we were leaving, Sabitri came to us with a package of green tea as a gift, and Morgan came onto the bus specifically to say goodbye.This is a world-class hotel, and we will always stay here whenever we come to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: just off the main ginza area. short walk to shops, restaurants, train station. bus to/from narita airport stops right outside. helpful staff. very clean. breakfast very good, don't miss the fried chicken! good sized rooms. probably the biggest room i have had in my visits to tokyo. climate control could be better. room was quite warm and i couldn't bring down the temperature.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: On arrival, I was offered early check-in, complimentary breakfast for three for every day of our stay, and drink vouchers per person per day courtesy to Marriott gold elite members.Room, however was unbearably hot. (Hotel building is 30 years old so a/c is controlled centrally, nothing they could’ve done). I asked if there was anything the hotel could do and they offered me a fan. As someone who suffers from allergic rhinitis, that didn’t help either and to my surprise we were given an upgrade to an executive suite.Bottom line, the service is top-notch, miles better than other 5 star properties in Tokyo I’ve stayed at. Everything was done with a smile. Thanks!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: stayed here several times. the location is really good. it is literally at the doorstep of the famous ginza street. the rooms are clean and comfortable. staffs are friendly and helpful. i enjoyed their buffet breakfast...simple but enough selections.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I was in Tokyo on business. The shopping district is one of my favorite areas. The Courtyard was convenient but it had so much more. Wonderful staff. Top notch service. Great restaurant with lots of choices. I was able to really enjoy the rest of my Tokyo visit.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Courtyard Ginza for 5 nights in December. The location of the hotel is quite good. There are lots of things to see and do in the Ginza district and there are a few subway entrances within 10 minutes walking distance. It's also a pretty short walk (20 min) to Tokyo Station. The hotel staff were very friendly and got our room ready for an early check in. As a Gold Elite member, we were upgraded to a larger room on the top floor. As there is no executive lounge, we were provided with breakfast in the restaurant. Both the upgrade and delicious breakfast were very much appreciated! It's too bad that the Courtyard hotels in North America fall below Asian standards.I really enjoyed my time in Tokyo and would definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The room conditions was very good and had enough space. Room cleaning was perfect everyday. The most I was impressed about this hotel was the restaurant staffs on the lobby. I rember staff name Lasath who is very polite and helpful and the manager was also very professional and kind. All the things from Marriott Ginza, I truly appreciate all your support and kindness. I strongly recommend this hotel and willing to visit next time. See you soon and happy new year!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Staying for 4 nights in Ginza with family was nice. We had small room for three persons. But enough for us and luggages. Close to the shopping area. Breakfast was good and all staff was good enough to handle our requests.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Very convenient location 10 to 15mins walk from shimbashi train station , friendly staffs and with airport shuttle bus just infront of hotel another plus point. We did not try their breakfast as there are plenty of eateries nearby. We stayed here for 5 nites during december with 3 beds for 1 room. Very expensive as we paid around sgd750 per nite for 1 tiny room. We were offer electric fan for our room when we complain of the room temperature.December is a peak season i suppose in tokyo as most hotels are fully booked , will not stay here again at that price and will instead try to book earlier with other hotel.
