hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I recently traveled to Tokyo on the last leg of business trip a month long, I enjoyed visiting the fish market though if you don’t like large crowds or raw fish I don’t recommend you going there.I also visited Ginza shopping district, it was amazingly beautiful.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We did indeed return to this hotel for one night before flying onwards on our holiday. This time we were given a room on a much higher floor which was fabulous . It had city centre views - shops - lights - bustle - which we loved to watch. The room was spacious, and very well appointed with a walk in wardrobe - a beautifully well appointed bathroom and many other facilities. We had a lovely meal in the hotel restaurant with ever attentive staff as usual. With just an afternoon left we wandered to the Sumida Hokasai museum - this was relatively easy to get to using the underground (and with the assistance of the most helpful people we have every met on our travels around the world). Having always been fascinated by Hokasai we were not disappointed by this museum, worth a visit.On the basis of this room we would thoroughly recommend this hotel for city travellers. We loved our visit to Japan, we have never met more beautiful, respectful, funny and helpful people anywhere. It is a place so different to anywhere we have been, a place we found so easy to get around using public transport, a place with such tasty food.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I went with my family to Tokyo on November 2017 and decided to stay at Courtyard Tokyo Ginza Hotel. We arrived at Narita airport and took a bus shuttle that left us at the hotel door. Taxi prices are expensive! The Hotel is about three blocks away from a main beautiful shopping road. Also, lots of restaurants surround the hotel making it very convenient. The hotel is very comfortable, clean and has everything needed to make your stay great. The service is very good. You may find some language barrier with the staff, but their willingness to help, compensate for that and your doubt is always solved. If I have the chance to go back to Tokyo, I would stay at Courtyard Ginza again!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Flight delay so look for hotel. Last minute get a good deal for Marriott Courtyard of single room offer. Very decent well appointed room. Convenience location near Ginza with shuttle bus service to many airport. Warm welcome and efficient front desk service. No complaint but strongly recommend for single traveller.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Situated close to Tsukiji, and a stone's throw from a couple of subway stations, this hotel is very near a lot of good eating places. Rooms are reasonably-sized and well-kept, and I enjoyed the buffet breakfast there too.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed this hotel for 1 night with my family.Only a few minutes walking distance from the nearest subway station, Higashi Ginza.In the middle of Ginza high-end shopping district. Only a few steps away from Ginza's latest shopping mall "Ginza Six" and recently renovated Kabuki theater.Chcek-in was smooth and the staff at the front desk were all polite and very nice.Room was relatively small... I knew that the hotels, especially old ones, in tokyo have very small rooms, so does Hong Kong, even then, I thought this room was very small...My family and I had a dinner in the Japanese restaurant.The food was OK. Compare to the price paid, I would say it was good value. However, a lady service staff was not so attentive, couldn't answer our questions clearly and after went to ask someone but forgot to come back to us with the answer.Breakfast was very nice.The restaurant itself was not so big and selection of the food was just ok (if I compare to other 5star hotels...). but I loved the fact that I could enjoy both the Western food and Japanese food on the buffet.Staff were very attentive, passionate and assist us in many ways with smiles on their faces.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: While it’s not a full service Marriott, it had all I needed to leave a lasting impression. I’d easily stay here again as the location fits me just right. It is so close to all the activities and action the area provides. The room was Japanese comfortable sized with a king bed, mini bar, bathroom with tub, and a small sitting couch. It was a very quiet room for a bustling location. The staff is top notch. Breakfast was outstanding.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I gotta say I wouldn’t give this hotel a five stars review from the feeling I stepped into my room because everything is old....Especially they don’t have a executive lounge for Marriott member or happy hour, which is definitely a disappoint compared to courtyard shin Osaka and courtyard Tokyo station. Instead, they did give us 6 drink coupons for our three consecutive nights there. But, despite of the old interior of our room. Their service was amazingly as great as every all the Marriott hotels we had stayed. One of their reservation staff, Ms Izumi, helped me a lot with all the packages I ordered from the Internet. She’s like a good friend to me during this time. One of their front staff, Mr Yuki Sugo, helped us to make a phone call to community with a Japanese store, which really saved our day. So with their warm service, I believe they deserve a 5 stars point even though the hotel itself is not so new^_^

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I highly recommend this hotel. If you are Gold/Platinum elite members, they treat you like royalty. It was free breakfast buffet, and the choices were just amazing. They serve pretty much breakfast from all over the world with omelet bar. You have access to any drinks and food. Great gym in basement and the location was very good. Also free drinks at the coffee shop in the lobby as well.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: After a long day of travel, this was a welcome place to check in to. The front desk service was excellent, curtious, friendly and got us checked quickly. The room was on the smaller size to what we are use, but will appointed, clean and very comfortable.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel is very nicely located in Tokyo..................close to so many interesting tourist type places to see. I am a Lifetime Platinum Member and was quite disappointed that I was not acknowledged as such when I checked in and I was not offered a room upgrade. This rarely happens but it did this time.Our room was nice but very small. 2 people could not be in the bathroom at the same time unless one was standing in the tub. However the shower water pressure and water temperature were awesome............as they always are in Japan.The staff and service were good as well and very helpful in arranging our tour locations, etc. With all the choices in Tokyo I am not sure if I would choose this hotel again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stay my 1 last night in Courtyard Ginza Hotel before leaving to airport next morning.As we stay in Premium suite with separate living room on 11st floor, so the room and bathroom is quite spacious too.And we arrived in hotel at 10am, the front desk staff was kind to let us check in and we put our bags in room then straight out to explore the city. Tsukiji Fish Market just within walking distance.Hotel in great location in Ginza, walking distance to high-end shopping street in Ginza. And walking distance to Metro and subway station.Next morning, we took the limousine bus right in front of hotel to Narita Airport. Was convenient, not need to struggle with pulling the suitcase around in public transport.Will definitely come back to Courtyard Ginza Tokyo hotel again on my next visit to Tokyo!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: In true Marriott style, the hospitality at the hotel goes beyond the expected. A Gold Rewards member, I was greeted at the counter with a smile and several complimentary services and amenities. This is an excellent Courtyard.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Decent hotel at a great location. Close to Ginza station and higashi Ginza station. Connects direct to Haneda airport. Walking distance from most Ginza attractions. And reasonably priced ( for Tokyo city standard ). 30 Mins from Haneda airport.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Had to spend a night near here, so I thought I'd spend it at a small hotel on the Marriott chain. This one was generally fine. I realize this is Japan, yet even then the rooms felt really small... was fine as a business hotel but would have wanted something different if on vacation.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great hotel in a good area. All areas very clean and well maintained. The staff are wonderful any request was dealt with to my complete satisfaction. Room was typical of many hotels but more than adequate for our needs with a nice comfy bed. Food in the buffet and room service was of a very high standard.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The rooms are nice and I really liked the bed. In fact I plan on going to the Courtyard website to order bedding for my home. The breakfast buffet was great and they had many options for a vegan like myself with a variety of fruits, vegetables, legumes and grains. Tokyo isn't an easy place to be plant based so having starting your day with a good breakfast is nice. The location of the hotel was very convenient to Ginza shopping and bars. There is a nice indoor/outdoor bar at Tommy Bahamas a few yards from the hotel that I'd recommend if you like to relax and people watch. Speaking of people watching, the hotel lobby bar, Oasis, was a nice place for a tea or drink with a large glass window facing the street. This is a great medium priced hotel with good value for what you'll spend. I will definitely return to this hotel again. Thanks Marriott!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is a good location for getting around Ginza and Tokyo. You can easily walk to different attractions and good restaurants. Easy to access the subway and train. Great service especially from the hotel concierge. He answered a ton of questions in perfect English.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I was in Tokyo for a business trip, the hotel is central which was good for meetings, the accomodation was fine, good quality, though as you would expect the room was slightly smaller than normal Marriott rooms.The breakfast covered both Japanese and Western options, and the staff were helpful.We had a seminar in the hotel and the quality of lunch provided was exceptional.I arrived at 07.00 having got an overnight flight in, and the hotel were very good at giving me a room immediately so I could crash out for a few hours.The hotel is very close to the main upmarket shopping area and a short walk to the Imperial Palace, a great location.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel is a short walk from the centre of the Ginza shopping district, and an even shorter walk from the nearest subway station, Higashi-Ginza. The staff spoke good English, and were very helpful with advice when we needed it. There is a wine bar and a coffee shop in the lobby, which was useful, particularly as the first visit was complimentary. We had room-service dinner on the first night, and were given a discount because it was delayed, not that that had bothered us. We used the hotel buffet restaurant for breakfasts, and found it well provided with a variety of Western and Asian dishes. We were surprised to find the restaurant booked out on our second night, but that was no problem because there were so many other eating places nearby. Our room was a bit cramped for three adults, but quite clean and comfortable.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights for combined business/leisure. Before we left home I had many questions by email which were answered promptly by concierge. Check in was smooth and front office staff were welcoming. We enjoyed the location close to the Ginza line station which made it easy to travel around the city. The rooms were a decent size for a city hotel and the bed was comfortable.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My family ( wife and adult daughter) recently visited Tokyo for 5 days we stayed at the Ginza Courtyard. This hotel was built 30 years ago but does not look like however the rooms are larger than recently built hotels. Our room with 1 king bed was like a NA room with multiple electric sockets. Bathroom was large, typical Toto toilet with all the fancy buttons and heated seat. In addition to CNN, Bloomberg TV there was also a 24 hour movie channel. Our daughters room was a single but again roomy. Breakfast was vast and combined Japanese and Western offerings including an egg bar. The lobby bar was a great place to unwind after a hectic day. The Ginza subway line was 2 blocks away, as was a Tully's coffee store, Starbucks was 1 block away in the Ginza 6 shopping mall. The high end Ginza area was a 10 minute walk. 1 block away was a great Teppenaki restaurant ( grilled beef/fish). The staff was professional, helpful and very friendly. It was an unanimous decision to stay here on our next visit.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great location for the city. Easy access to the metro. Lovely staff and well informed desk personel. This is a well appointed hotel, which is well maintained. Lovely rooms with big beds, a real good night sleep. Great variety self service breakfast to suit all appetites. It's a must!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel is in a fantastic location, it has all the right amenities, the rooms are modern and clean, and the staff is exceptional. Five stars for everything except the staff. They get TEN stars. They're ALL professional, well-trained, polite, and extremely competent. Certainly many Tokyo hotel options to choose from, but if you don't choose this one, you'll be missing out on the best hotel in Tokyo. Period.
user_name:
Fishers_from_VA
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great hotel in best location for visitors to Tokyo. Good sized well appointed rooms as you would expect from Marriot.Close to major visitor sights and very convenient for metro.Airport limousine bus stops here so excellent service to and from airport.Front desk staff extra helpful and obliging when giving sightseeing advice.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed for two nights at the hotel. I paid approximately US $250 per night for the King Size Room through the Marriott site. As a Gold Marriott member I also received the free breakfast buffet which is very good with a nice mix of Japanese and Western Cuisine. The room was good sized for Tokyo. The bedding was nice and a small refrigerator in the room. The only concern I would state that when taking a shower a tall person 6 foot or higher will feel their head close to the ceiling when standing in the bathtub.The location is great as Ginza is busy with a lot of restaurants nearby as well as the subway station. The Fish Market is a 10 minute walk and a great experience. The staff at the front desk was helpful as was the waitstaff for breakfastI took the Airport Limousine service from Narita that dropped me off and picked me right in front of the hotel. It was around US $28 each way Would definitely stay again
user_name:
AlcoholProf
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Of the 3 hotels I stayed in Tokyo, the Courtyard Marriott is by far the best one in terms of location/breakfast/room/price.Rooms are not very big, but are comfortable and clean. The breakfast buffet is amazing! The staff does not speak much english though......100% worth staying in this hotel!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We chose this hotel because of it's location, it's next to a metro station which makes it super easy to navigate the city, it mas our first time in Tokyo but the metro was very easy to use, the only trouble we had was when we tried buying the tickets since there are different prices depending the station where you're getting off, but there was always in the ticket booth ready to help.This hotel was very helpful when we asked the best routes to get to certain parts of town.Also, we stayed in Japan por 7 days, but we left the hotel for a couple of days to do a quick visit to Kyoto, they let us leave our bags since we only wanted to take small bags and when we arrived back they had already put everything in our room. 100pts for that!We had no bad experiences in this hotel, the breakfast was tasty, the rooms comfortable, the whole hotel was clean and smelled nice.They are associated with an airport transportation service, which is pretty much cheaper than getting a taxi..unless you want to go by train.Would totally go back again!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed here for a quick long weekend trip and this is by far the nicest Courtyard Marriott I have ever stayed in. The location was perfect as a base to explore Tokyo and was particularly convenient to walk to the Tsukiji market. Great places to eat within easy 5-10 minutes walking distance and subway connections close by. The breakfast buffet was amazing with a huge variety of food. The rooms were clean and comfortable and as Marriott Gold, the free high speed wifi and complimentary drinks were a plus. Would highly recommend for future visits to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I recently stayed for 1 night at this hotel. From the time I arrived until the moment I left the staff always gave me a smile and good vibes. I asked for an extension to my checkout time and it wasn't a problem at all. My room was located on the 10th floor and the view wasn't anything special but pleasant. The room was small but the layout very functional and nice. Fitness center well equipped and clean. The bar lounge is good for a drink or two, not very active. I did not eat any of the hotel restaurants but outside you will find all sort of options in this fascinating area of Tokyo. I recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Smallish room but big enough and recently renovated so very well appointed. Ideal location (near subway, access to key sites etc, although not as many good reasonable restaurants nearby as in other areas). Very good breakfast. Very helpful staff (arranging airport transfers, subways tickets etc). Very reasonably priced for Tokyo in high season too.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: First time visit.Choose here to be near to the meeting place. The accomodation is small and expensive. Could have select another location since Tokyo is well connected by train networks.The most convenient to note is that this hotel location is the final stop for the direct airport limousine bus.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: In Japan, service is generally above average. At this hotel, it was near perfect. From reception, concierge, and restaurant staff to the bellboys and maids, everyone was professional, attentive, and polite. The hotel is minutes walk from the famous Tsukiji Fish Market in one direction and the Ginza shopping district in another. We really enjoyed our stay here.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel is ideally situated with easy means to get around Tokyo even for 2 stumbling Brits! The food is delicious especially the breakfasts. The toiletries in the room are also above average and appreciated as we are travelling all over Japan and need to limit luggage. Check in and out was easy, all staff everywhere were polite and helpful. The room size was as compact as we expected as we had read trip advisor reviews. My one disappointment was the view - this was our first visit to Japan and our first hotel and our view was a wall for 4 nights so was very unimpressed with this and found it a bit depressing. We ate not big business clients we pay a lot of money ourselves from the UK to visit and stay in hotels such as this. Of the many city centre hotels we have stayed in this is by far the worst view we have ever had. We are returning here for one night before we leave Japan and would appreciate a room with a city centre view.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Based on the price of a room, I was expecting more from this hotel. We traveled throughout Japan for 14 days and this is the only hotel I had a problem with my allergies. I noticed there was a lot of mold in the bathroom... in sort of hidden places. The bathroom was barely big enough for one person to stand in... you could only just turn around in-place. The ceiling was so low in the shower that my husband could not wash his hair without bending down because his hands did not fit between his head and the ceiling. We did not like that the showers had shower curtains. The sheets were also very scratchy. We were expecting the standard, soft Marriott bedding. The carpeting was very old. The room was just not comfortable to us and felt a little icky.On the day of our check out...they started doing construction work on the rooms across the hall from ours. We had to step over plastic sheeting and the smell was terrible. I felt like my health might be in danger from whatever fumes were coming from the construction. It seems like they could have waited a day until we were out of the room and not filled those rooms until the construction was over. We were checking out on a Sunday.We are platinum members, so we stay in almost exclusively Marriotts. We had two rooms... when we checked in, they wanted to change our king bed to two twins, but luckily we did get a king room. The second room, a two twin room, was not ready still at 5pm...which seemed a little unacceptable. Maybe the hotel was full, but we did not get upgraded in anyway in spite of being Platinum members.The staff was all really friendly. The buffet breakfast was pretty good with even an omelet bar, fresh fruit, a cappuccino maker, standard Japanese breakfast items, etc. The hotel is close to the Higashi-Giza station, exit A1, on the Hibiya and Asukasa lines...so, the location was good. It was also nice to get two bottles of water per room per day because it was so hot. However, I don't think I would stay at this hotel again just because it was way too expensive for what the room was. During our trip to Japan, we stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Tokyo and that was amazing. Just before staying at this Courtyard, we were staying at the St. Regis in Osaka which was 5,000 Yen less than this Courtyard and I think it was one of the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in. This hotel is ok, but really the value was not there and because of the other reasons I mentioned... I rate it as poor.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Perfect location if you are into shopping in the Ginza area.Very friendly and helpful staffs. Rooms are nice and clean. We were in the lower floors and did not get any good view.We certainly will consider this hotel when we come to Tokyo again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Excellent business hotel top locations near shopping center very good staff and grate hospitality. Everything is simply flawless about this hotel. Breakfast buffet of this hotel is really grate with good variety.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Even to tokyo standards the rooms are very tight, and could use refreshing.Facilities are spotless clean and service excellent.Breakfast spread is very high quality, varied and well presented.Location is great, in the center of a great district.Good for short business trip.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We had a lovely receptionnist at check in. She was very helpful and provided us with adequate information for our stay.The room was comfortable, cozy and quiet. The hotel location is convenient as it is close to Higashi-Ginza metro station (A1 exit), shops and restaurants.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed here for one night because of its prime location. Actually it also takes around 10 minutes walk from JR Shinbashi station, but if you take metro I think it is quite close to Ginza East Station, so it all depends on what transport you take. It is also convenient because the hotel is the pick up and drop off point of the airport limousine bus to Haneda and Narita airport. There are also lots of stores and shopping malls nearby, especially there are one mega store and one supermarket which are opened for 24 hours nearby.We arrived at 11:00 and left the baggage first. Then we went back to JR station to catch the Shinkansen. Not much people wait for check in so we can do it quickly. We found the staff there are more international, compared to other hotels I stayed in Japan.We came back at around 1100pm and most restaurants are closed. They offer us the high floor room and the welcome drink voucher but unluckily the bar is already closed. The room is not big but fair enough. They also gave us welcome amenities including nuts, ice cream, fruit and cheese because of the member status, which were quite generous as other Marriott hotels, even including JW marriott only offer 1-2 type amenities while they offer both of us, which means 4 types of amenities in total.After 15 minutes the amenities arrive. I expect those are cut fruits and cut cheese, instead, they are unpeeled whole fruit and packed cheese. Since we are not that keen on eating during night time, we are fine with them. Bedding is also good. But I cant find the humidifier which is normally installed in Japanese hotel. We had breakfast on the next morning in the cafe. Choices are great and I am impressed by their live cooking station, including the soup noodle, egg and pancake station. The taste are great and service is good too.We left early to go to other places. Overall the staying experience is good. With the prime location, the rate of this hotel is not low. But I will definitely consider to stay here again for my next visit in Tokyo.
user_name:
porkypugpug
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I love the location of this hotel. The rest of Ginza is waiting right outside, and Tsukiji Market is less than a kilometer away. The breakfast buffet offered a wide variety of selections, from staple Japanese favorites to continental cuisine. The staff were also very helpful.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Our family stayed at this Courtyard for three nights on our first visit to Japan. Everything worked great for us. We really liked our room which is small but comfortable and well equipped. The bathrooms were super neat and clean and the room decor is fantastic. Beds/pillows were nice. No light streaked in through the blinds which helped us fight the jet lag and sleep well.The breakfast buffet is really good with a very wide spread and customized egg station and noodle bar. Everyone at the hotel (just like everyone else in the country) is nice and polite all the time. WiFi worked great for all our devices though I didn't try to stream videos - just checked email and such. They gave us WSJ every morning which I really enjoy.The hotel itself is a quick 3 min walk from the Higashi-Ginza metro station (take the A1 exit to save time and effort).

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Chose this initially primarily to be close to Tokyo Station and in Ginza area and was more than pleasantly surprised. One of big benefits is that Hotel is one of stops from Narita and Haneda on Friendly Bus Service so makes it very easy and convenient to get here - ie no need for cab. Upgraded to a great room that had a bathroom with sauna in it as well as massage chair. Room 112- ask for it as is very spacious and great layout. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Breakfast included which was well done with lots of options. Easy 10 minute walk to Tsukiji Fish market. Close to main shopping area of Ginza but not as crowded. Would highly recommend this Hotel for a great convenient stay.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: As a Marriott Platinum member, it's clear to see they always treat you better at international Courtyards vs USA Courtyards, and this one is no exception! Great Free breakfast with both International cuisine and Western food for Marriott Gold&Platinum members, along with a free drink coupon. Thank you Staff members at the Courtyard Marriott Ginza for an amazing stay! Part of the Tokyo charm is staying in the small rooms, but it's always nice to take a break with an amazing Platinum member upgrade to one of the large premium top-level rooms with a full massage chair, and a personal sauna. In my 1,822 nights at Marriott properties, I've never had either of those things in my room, and I finally had an upgrade I could enjoy with my wife! Thanks again for an unforgettable experience!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: A clean and comfortable hotel in central Ginza close to metro and within walking distance of excellent shopping and several tourist attractions. Rooms were a good size and breakfast catered for all tastes. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We had pleasure to stay at Ginza three nights on May, excellent service! Especially French guy who advised us to go just right place, I found just what looked for, Omega Speedmaster! Breakfast was nice as well!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed in Courtyard Mariott Ginza in Tokyo. Nicely located beside the main shopping area in Ginza. Booked 2 rooms and being Platinum Member being accorded with Free breakfast which was excellent variety of food being served. Room are quite standard size, with slightly low ceiling. But Bed comfort was good and amenities provided was excellent. Will definately stay here gain.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Clean with very helpful staff in a great location. It a good for business or leisure travel.Breakfast had good selection. Fitness room was just average. The room is well set up with plugs for computer and phone. I would go back again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is our second time staying at the Courtyard. This hotel is well located in the Ginza with easy access to subway. It is a really good value. The rooms are large and comfortable. The buffet breakfast is quite good with both western and Japanese options.The staff are very friendly and knowledgeable.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The best thing about the hotel is it's "location".Room size was average but the best thing was bathroom, with digital commode with water. Excellent for Muslim travellers.Gym has all the basic exercise machines.Breakfast was normal with continental choices. Overall all the hospitality was superb....Japanese hospitality...

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The room was incredibly small and basic - just A bed in a tiny room with a terrible view. Thankfully I wasn't in the room very much b/c it was quite depressing. The location was very convenient and near a central metro stop.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The Courtyard Tokyo Ginza Hotel is old but well maintained hotel in a good location. There's a direct train to and from both Haneda and Narita airports and it's also an airport limousine bus hotel (although timings to and from Haneda are few and far between). It's around 3 mins walk to Higashi-Ginza station (2 lines) and about 8 minutes walk to Ginza station (3 lines). Higashi-Ginza even offers direct trains to Yokohama (2 every hour). The main Ginza shopping stretch is just two streets away and there are plenty of restaurants nearby especially steak restaurants such as the famous Gyu-An. We were allowed to check-in at 10am, which is almost unheard of in Tokyo.The hotel itself isn't the newest but the room itself is fairly modern although certain touches are obviously old though well maintained. For example, we had a National brand hairdryer and torch, both yellowed with age although working fine, and that brand ceased to exist quite long ago.Room is of a good size for Japan, beds are comfortable and windows can be opened (huge plus in my book). However, the hotel does seem to have some power downtime once in awhile where electricity gets cut off past 2am till about 6am, so do finish all you need to do by then.Marriott Elite Gold and above members get a free scrumptious breakfast spread and drink coupons for the lounge. I'd recommend the orange juice in the lounge. Freshly squeezed and one of the best I've ever tasted.We got a really good rate for our stay so it was great value for us, but if you're paying the rack rates, the same amount could probably get you some place better. Its sister hotel, the Courtyard Tokyo Station, is much newer and also very nice.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The Courtyard Ginza is a nice hotel in a great location. It is clean and has friendly staff, and the location is in walking distance from many great restaurants. There is also wonderful shopping all around you.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I travel quite frequently to this location for work and have a very good impression of the hotel.It is in the middle of the Ginza district which is near most of my business meetings. The breakfast is good and I typically get an upgraded room.It does not have a lounge for Elite Marriott members but they do give you a drink coupon and discounts at the hotel restaurants for your membership, along with a room upgrade, when available.Overall, it is a good hotel for business travel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Had to change my reservations from the Courtyard Tokyo Station since the one day per year the hotel is closed for Japanese inspections overlapped my stay. The handoff between the hotels was seamless and as a Marriott Platinum I could not have asked for better service. Great location near two metro stations, very convenient limo from the hotel to Haneda (the times worked good well for me, but only runs 4x per day. Great buffet breakfast included which is not the norm for most Courtyards around the world and was upgrade to a junior suite that had a large sitting area and bathroom. This is my new hotel pick when I plan to visit Tokyo. Both this and the Tokyo Station were great, I give the the slight edge to this hotel for the nicer rooms and in-hotel lounge.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We where on a tour with 9 other friends, and this hotel had been selected by the tour. The room was compact, but well organized, with little room for luggage. Small bathroom.. The included buffet breakfast was quite good, with omelet choice and plenty of both Japanese and western choices.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Marriot Hotel has a good location near from the Ginza Street and best places to eat. I always stay in this hotel because from the airport has a direct shuttle to hotel and vice versa, and the japanese hospitality is very good, the service and the coffe bar are excelent.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Rooms as in all of Tokyo are very small, but clean, modern and a comfortable bed. Plenty of sockets, including one to take European or British plugs. As it is not a tall hotel, you will get a view of a concrete wall and possible some pipework and ducting, but the central location is very useful - just a short walk from two subway stations, and the lovely Hamarikyu Gardens. Main problem was the bathroom - it has a raised floor and a lowered ceiling, so if you are taller than 5' 10" you will not be able to stand upright in the shower. Queues for the overpriced breakfast ( a very short walk to a Gooz shop for coffee and fresh pastries is better), "lounge" area not particularly comfortable. Staff at the front desk, and the concierge, are excellent and very helpful. English is spoken fluently by all staff.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel is ideally located around multiple train stations. Despite speaking Japanese, I easily navigated to the hotel from Haneda Airport. The room was decent. There was no view. It was reasonably priced, and once again, location was the primary reason I booked this hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I must have booked a smonking room by mistake and when I got to the hotel the staff was quite inflexible and rude, which is so not common in Japan. He said that if I wanted to change to a non smoking room I would have to pay double the price, close to USD. I was tired and in need of sleep I just took the smoking room. The room was clean but poorly kept. All kinds of stains in the walls. See pictures attached. Overall the room was small for this price point in Tokyo and there was no view. However, the location is excellent and the other staff in the hotel is cheerful and helpful, the norm in Japanese hospitality culture. I was very disappointed with my room and with the interaction with the person who checked me in. Avoid rooms in the 4th floor. My room was number 404.
user_name:
Trekker2020
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stay in this hotel for 2 nights during my last business trip, I really enjoy the location, and the front desk team are very helpful and very great customer service. the room was ok, only things I felt a little dusty but to be honest your room service food is not up to the market.. but for sure if I come back to tokyo I ll stay in your hotel only for the costumer service and for the location, very helpful also the french concierge...

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We booked this hotel mainly for its location. and it is at a very convenient spot to shopping area, lots of restaurants around, easy walking distance to subway stations and walking distance to fish market. Fish market was our key focus. And hope to stay closer and being able to go every day so this hotel is definitely a great option for above reasons. Maybe i have too much of expectation for Japanese hospitality- from the great review of this hotel from lots of people, we found it odd that we did not feel and receive the warm welcome and hospitality during our stay from our trip inquiries or front desk. It is just a usual business oriented hotel for convenience, clean and good night rest. Normally this type of hotel is okay for me for business but for leisure, it is not our type of hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We enjoyed our trip to this hotel, which was clean, well located and has friendly and helpful staff. The room was small but well designed and nice to stay in. The breakfast was great, Thanks to the concierge who was very helpful.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The only surprise at this hotel was the great breakfast buffet, which offers both Japanese and Western favorites. The rooms, service, bar, gym, etc., offer all the quality you would expect to find at a Marriott Courtyard. Location in Find a is convenient to great shopping, dining, transit and attractions like the Emperor's Palace grounds, fish market, Hamarikyu Gardens and the Kabuki theater. A great value.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: For our first few nights, husband and I stayed in this Marriott using our hotel points. We were very happy and satisfied with our stay (even yearning for this hotel while later staying at Conrad Tokyo (more expensive but not as good)). Pluses: - Easy walking distance to restaurants and shopping- English-speaking staff (good for me with limited Japanese)- Proximity to public transportation (easy walking)- 24-hour access to fitness facilities- Breakfast buffet, including ramen station and egg station - starting at 6:30 AM for early risers like me - free with member benefits- Room card reader for the elevator - auto selects the floor for better security Minuses:- ??? I can't think of any off handWe would definitely stay here again! Until our next visit to Tokyo!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Nice hotel. Took a taxi from JR Tokyo station. Was roughly $10.00. Wanted to get to the hotel the fastest way since we had been traveling for over 12 hours. Room is comfortable, yes it's probably smaller than rooms in the US. but it has everything you need. We were worried about the bed being really hard, firm, it was comfortable. Nice to take a bath in very hot water. Bathtub was comfortable as well. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the courtyard for 7 night, the location of the hotel is everything, few minutes walk to ginza shopping street. The rooms are clean and has everything you need. Its very quiet. The only thing is i wished the rooms were a bit more spacious. Other than that its perfect for a short trip to tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I have now stayed at the courtyard several times. Most of the rooms are very small. The top floor has nicer rooms but still small. The price point for the room, given its location I believe is fair. It is very much a hotel for tourists and not necessarily one for a business trip, but not to worry if you chose this for business trip. The staff are very nice and helpful with a very good level of English. The only real downsides. The breakfast area reminds be of an office canteen. A double espresso and a cup ( not pot) of tea will cost up more than $25. The absolute worst and in my option quite inappropriate is you have to, even as guest in the hotel, pay a cover charge to have a decent quality drink in their bar.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Excellent small Marriott style hotel in heart of Tokyo's premier shopping neighborhood. Rooms are a little small but bigger than others in the area. 3 restaurants in such a small hotel was a pleasant surprise with excellent Japanese one in basement. Close to shopping, metro, restaurants and bars. But a highlight is walking a few blocks to check out nearby old world city park in Shindome. We had a ball in Tokyo and this hotel is a great home away from home.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Compared to the room sizes of other hotels in New York and London for example; even these rooms are tiny. Once you overcome the size issue, the hotel is amazing. We picked Marriott as Americans because we know they understand our US-centric mentality. We could communicate in English, and the hotel felt familiar in a strange land. I am over-explaining this point, but if Japan is foreign to you, this location will help ease your transition.The location is great. Close enough to 2 different metro stations on separate lines to get anywhere you want in the city with 1 or less transfers. The shopping in Ginza puts Chicago's Michigan Ave., New York's 5th Ave. and even Rodeo Drive to shame. You can walk to all of the shopping these three areas have to offer and then some from this hotel. The value of the inventory in new Ginza 6 mall which just opened, is probably larger than the GDP of most small countries.The breakfast was outstanding and not to be missed. If your room rate includes breakfast, be sure and take advantage of it every day. It is well worth it.In terms of logistics, the airport limo-bus drops off directly at this hotel which is a plus. Also, the more popular bus tours pick up at this hotel which is another plus. Many people from around the area come to this hotel to start their tours. It's great when you can just walk downstairs and go.The staff are gracious and excellent. Everyone from the front desk to the cleaning staff, the bell desk to the concierge were all top notch, professional, and friendly.We are planning a return trip to Tokyo next year and we will plan it around availability at this hotel. It was that great of an experience.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel is just off the main shopping areas of Ginza and this was one of the reasons for us choosing to stay here. The availability of a shuttle to the airport for our return flight was another reason.Check in was quick and efficient. The room was much smaller than what we had expected from a Marriott. However, we were now accustomed to the idea of small rooms, hence it did not bother us too much. Our room was tucked into a side corridor, and there wasn't much of a view. Since there are buildings all around, I do not think that any room would come with a view. Our luggage had not arrived when we checked in. The bell captain’s desk was manned by Anna. What she lacked in English, she more than made up with her sincerity and her ability to appease our concerns. Many phone calls later, using the few words at her command and a lot of (I guess) Google translate, she informed us that the luggage would be delivered by the next morning. What impressed us was that she went the extra mile to allay our fearsIn Mr. Ricardo Sasaki, who mans the concierge desk, the Marriott has one of their best assets. Fluent in English, and a very pleasing demeanour, he has a ton of information at his fingertips and the ability to help you plan the day around Tokyo. Breakfast, included in our package, was excellent. The pancakes were fluffy. They have this quaint habit of bringing the freshly baked croissant around and while they are flaky enough, the freshly baked ones just melt in the mouth.The main streets of Ginza are barely a 5 minute walk. Tsukiji market is about 10 minutes away, while the Hamarikiyu gardens are also about the same distance. Shimbashi station is about 10 minutes away, while Ginza is about 10 minutes Hence it is quite centrally located. All in all, barring the lack of a good view, we had a very pleasant stay in the Marriott.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Flew from Dubai to Narita and caught an Airport Limousine bus right to the hotel. Not expensive. A bit of a wait and 3 hours between landing and arriving at hotel. Wonderful to get there and have friendly efficient staff, which was the case for our whole 6 night stay. Couldn't fault any member of staff. Great room, 1106, really good size though we paid the price! Initially thought we had chosen a really boring area, but peaceful to come back to and close to subway. Bed comfortable, duvets too hot! I never like hotel breakfasts, but my husband thought it was good.. Handy location for the 8.15am walking tour of the fish market, no more than a 10 minute walk.. If you want to stay in a really lively area, this hotel is not for you, otherwise RECOMMENDED!!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for 3 days and 2 nights on king guest rooms and double deluxe for our family of 7. Booked 3 rooms as online reservation indicated that each room could only accommodate 2 occupants. This was troublesome since our children are ages 2-13 years old. Worse, this maximum 2-occupant-per-room-regardless-of-age-of children policy was confirmed by the Marriott toll-free customer service agent. Fortunately, the property responded to our email when prodded that our 2-year old was not considered an adult and even offered to set up a baby cot in any of the 3 rooms. In truth, we found the 2 king rooms spacious enough for the 7 of us but did not cancel the 3rd room anymore. Based on this experience, this property does not come across as family-with-young children-friendly. Note: other reviews in TripAdvisor did not mention similar issues regarding children staying with them in the room. I do not understand why ours was different. In case we would consider staying here again, it would be wiser to communicate directly to the hotel vs general Marriott hotline. The good points: complimentary bottled water and Marriott chocolate thins, tv program with English channels, good bed and pillows and strong shower. The service from front desk to concierge was warm, smiling and professional. They arranged take-out breakfast for us when we informed them that our flight was at 9am and even made sure food contained no allergens. They also gave excellent recommendations on Kobe beef restaurants and ramen places within a block around the hotel. Accessibility wise, it is a good 4 blocks away from the main street (shops and train station) or 8-10-minute walk when walking with young children. A convenience store is on the same block as hotel property. Tip: book with breakfast. The choices may not be as widespread as Shangri-la but the quality is crazy good, especially the pastries. Allot an hour at least. This is one breakfast not to be eaten in a rush.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is a very well located hotel in Ginza and although not large and some rooms are Japanese standard it is a very good hotel.The staff go out of their way to assist and for someone that has stayed there a number of times they remember who you are and give you a warm welcome back greeting.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed at Courtyard in Ginza which altogether was a good experience.Not a top 4 rating but more towards for than 3.The room was clean, not too small, bathroom with amenities and bathrobes for the guests. We got a room at 6 floor and the view was nothing a backyard with construction site. Had breakfast a couple of days, not included, which had an egg station, muesli/youghurt, bread as well as some Asian food as well.Walking distance to Fish market (however already sold out at 3.30 when we tried it at 5 one morning.) Metro take you around everywhere in the city, best way to go around.The Narita 1000 yen bus takes you to around 8 blocks from the hotel, quite convenient.We arrived very late and it was raining and ended up taking a taxi from airport even though we knew it could be expensive....it was more than that.. more like a flight ticket. So prepare yourself better than we did :)

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed here in late March 2017 due to a short business / leisure trip to Tokyo centering around Ginza / Tsukiji. The hotel location is superb, within easy walking distance to the Kabuki-za, Tsukiji fish market and Ginza shopping district. Multiple Tokyo Metro subway stations are close by.The hotel itself is relatively old, but has been refurbished to a high standard along with its rebranding under the Marriott name, although you will notice some minor faults which betray its age (some worn carpets and furnishings, old-fashioned hotel features). None were particularly troubling, however.I stayed in one of their modest "16 square metre" rooms and I was pleased with the room, which had a very comfortable king single mattress, modern TV and was well maintained. I enjoyed having adequately bright lighting, something some hotels don't seem to understand is required for proper work and reading. The room is very small by Western standards (be warned - there are even smaller 13 square metre rooms!), but for the price I paid (around JPY 18,000) and the location, it is pretty reasonable. You can choose a much larger room but with a corresponding significant increase in price, so you do get what you pay for!Some minor niggles - the bathroom had the usual Japanese "washlet" toilet seat but it was rather old strangely enough, not heated. I wasn't sure if this was because the seat was broken or it was just an old model. Occasionally the smell of cigarettes in the corridor and other parts of the hotel were overpowering and very unpleasant. I really hope major hotel chains like Marriott eventually embrace a 100% No Smoking policy for ALL of their rooms, for the comfort, amenity and safety of its customers.The view out of the 10th floor (which is the second highest level) was not particularly interesting, but this didn't trouble me as I don't generally spend hours by my hotel window. If you really want a hotel with a view, choose one that is much higher!I would definitely recommend this hotel as a convenient location to stay close to Ginza. It doesn't quite live up to a 5-Star hotel (like the Park Hyatt or Shangri La) -- it is more like a really excellent 4-Star hotel. Just make sure you confirm the room size when you book to avoid disappointment!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Was stay in just two day. It was so bad. I see the cockroach. And international adapter plug was broken. (Didn't work when i was check in)So worst memory in japan and worst memory in marriott in the world.Hotel Front was just say to sorry. And i was claim to front desk . And then they just suggested grossroom charge.  Actually i don't need to discount room chage i just want to stay more two day with another room. But especially manager didn't help me. And attitude was a little bit rude. Cuz i am just check out. (And paid gross room charge.)

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Checked in to this hotel for a 2 nights stay. To my horror, the room that was booked was a very small one (13 square m) located at the end of the floor furthest from the lift. There is only a super single size bed in the room. There is no proper wardrobe, but instead a few hangers hidden in a small closet near to the door. It is a real mistake on my part selecting this room without checking out the room size or viewing the photos on line. But there again, i did not expect a Marriott Courtyard brand to allow for such pathetic room offerings. I will advise guests to really check their room size when selecting this hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I just back from my wonderful holiday in Japan. I always choose Courtyard by Marriott brand hotel to stay around the world. This Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza is one of my favorite. Good location in the heart of shopping center, restaurants, and only 3 minutes walk to Higashi-Ginza station. Room very clean and comfortable bed, many choices of breakfast, In Room Dinning service on time and food very fresh. The restaurant Manager Kumar (he is originally from Nepal) always around and talking with guest. Not so many F&B leader are doing this hospitality. The concierge staff as always typical Courtyard is the best. They arranged my tour to Fuji mountain and my bus to transfer to the airport. I was amazing when the concierge staff (I forgot the name) came to me and advise me to cancel to send my luggage to airport by Currier due to if I use bus airport transfer is already included with 2 luggages can put in the trunk. So i can safe my money for buy some gift from Japan or enjoy local food while in Tokyo .... so nice ya! I would like to thank you to all CY Tokyo Ginza team and Chikako Ema - san who made my first time holiday in Japan wonderful. Definitely will come back here next year for stay.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is a bit of an unusual review. My group stayed at a different hotel in the Tokyo area and wanted to visit the Tsuiji Market. We called this Courtyard to see if it was possible to check our bags while we visited the market and then catch their shuttle to the Norita Airport. They said they could and helped us sign up for the shuttle. When we arrived in the morning, they even remembered my name from when I had called! On top of all that, they even helped us mail a package. They did all this even though we weren't staying at the Courtyard! Based on the customer service alone, I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Good hotel, very clean and staff very friendly and helpful. A bit expensive. good location for Ginza shopping area and the fish market, all within walking distance. they also have a bus that leaves from the hotel to the two main airports, was really handy as we had our two young daughters with us.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We arrived early in the morning for a one night stay, and did not expect a room to be ready, but we received a room in 15 minutes. As a low Marriott Silver member, we contacted the hotel in advance and let them know it was a birthday trip, and they gave us a surprise! They upgraded us to a large premium room, comped our breakfast, and set up a beautiful room with celebration letters. We enjoyed the stay, and will definitely be back again! Pros: Close to subway, 10 minute walk.Close to Tsukiji Fish market with endless seafood.Kind staffLarge roomCons: Nothing

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Room size is big for Japan standards. Amenities include toothbrush, comb, cotton pads, cotton buds, shower gel, shampoo, conditioner. Bottled water / coffee / tea are also provided. Location is very convenient, only 5 to 8 mins walk from Higashi-Ginza / Ginza station and Shimbashi station. Also walking distance to all branded stores in Chuo dori and the biggest Uniqlo store in Ginza.Tokyo metro pass (1,2 or 3 days pass, cannot be used on JR trains) can be bought from reception.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed here 4 nights on business. My impression is the hotel is geared more towards the business traveler than tourist so review is from that perspective. Front desk check-in, check-out and service is excellent. Like many westerners I was up well before 4am and took a walk to stretch and look for coffee. Nothing was open and upon my return the front desk employee had a pot brewed from the restaurant just in case I returned empty handed. This type of nice gesture and quality of service was shown from everyone I encountered.Rooms are small/moderate but well proportioned for Tokyo standards. Stocked nicely with bathroom necessities, water, etc. Cleaning staff is meticulous, and helpful Bed firm but comfortable. Only complaint is lack of English TV options, but you are in Japan after all. Also if very tall,will have to duck in shower. Manageable but slightly inconvenient. I had free wifi in room and lobby but don't know if that is standard. Good location in Ginza, near shops, many restaurants and about 3-5 minute walk to subway. About a 15 minute walk to Tokyo train station or 7 minute cab ride. I did not find my room noisy at night but window was closed. Breakfast buffet is well stocked and varied given clientele is from all over world. Professional bar on lower floor, business traveler oriented. Would say from my observation guests were about 65% US/European/Australian and 35% Asian, so well staffed to handle varied requests. I did ask the concierge for dinner recommendations but felt I could get more selection and ideas on-line. Steered me to the hotel restaurant which reviews suggest is OK if just want a convenient meal.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed during March 2016 and decided to stay here again this Feb/Mar as we enjoyed it last year.Flawless stay from start to finish. Their service once again exceeds my expectations. The staffs are helpful, efficient with humble and warming personality. I felt very welcomed during the entire stay in Tokyo. Specific room request, luggage storage/handling, shuttle bus to HND & NRT, late check-out, directions/recommendations, onsite dining are well thought, arranged and executed smoothly. The extremely comfortable bed and shower with perfectly high pressure water is a big plus after a long day of city walking! Combination of convenient location, excellent service, extremely comfortable bed & quiet/clean/functioning room. I have no doubt Courtyard Ginza makes a top hotel in Tokyo. I would stay here again next time in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: They changed my room to satisfy my needs (quiet and away from vending machines and elevators), even though I would have preferred a higher floor. The beds were extremely comfortable and everything in the room worked perfectly (best wi-fi connection I ever experienced). They made up the room every day and their concierge was quite helpful in giving recommendations and directions to all the main sites. They even had a page of description and directions for each site that they gave quests to keep. The hotel is conveniently located near transportation (metro line), Please note that most of the neighboring restaurants close by 9:00 PM. I would stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed just one night after a week in Hakuba skiing.Its a great location to see the high end shops in Ginza. You can also walk 5mins down the road & visit Hamarikyuteien (like botanical gardens) then jump on a river cruise & go to the markets at Asakusa. Then subway back. Its a great day out.The Hotel staff were very accommodating, the rooms are small but clean & comfortable. They have an airport shuttle for Y930 which is excellent. They let our friends store there luggage for 5hrs at no costs & get the shuttle bus with us.They also allow you to extend your room check out at a price, but its well worth it if your flying out at 10pm at night. We checked out at 6pm for a 50% of room rate fee. Worth every penny.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Location is absolutely perfect walking distance to everything! Rooms are typical small Japanese traditional rooms a bit dated could use improvements. But if your not spending much time in the room doesn't make a difference.Would defiantly stay there again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Courtyard Marriott Ginza is in an excellent location. It is in the heart of the Ginza district in it just doesn't get any better than this. The service is absolutely outstanding. And yes, they do speak English here; this is very helpful when you need assistance with things such as learning how to maneuver the various subway stations, or, when you're lost in the Ginza district and you need assistance on how to get back to the hotel.They offer free breakfast every morning for elite members. This is by far the post extensive breakfast that I have experienced and I've stayed at the Marriott's around the world. They definitely take pride in customer service at this location. Not only did I receive free breakfast each morning, along with free Wi-Fi, I also received a nice welcom gift. This is pure class and the United States Marriott location should take note.The breakfast was awesome! They offered Western breakfast selections as well as Asian fair. The omelette station was wonderful; there, you could order eggs Benedict, scrambled eggs, etc. Next to the omelette station where pancakes and waffles. There was also an assortment fresh fruit yogurt and a bread station. I always opted for the Asian breakfast which included miso soup, rice, a Ramen bar, and dim sum to name a few. The coffee maker was always popular. There you could choose from a latte, cappuccino, café Meastowe, espresso, or a blend. The coffee was always delicious and was a great way to start the day.The rooms are comfortable and appropriately sized. Many reviews indicate that the rooms are small. I did not find that this was the case. While the bathroom is slightly on the small size, everything is more than manageable. The only downside to this hotel is that they do not offer shuttle service to and from the airport. I understand that Narita is over an hour away, so perhaps a shuttle would be unreasonable for that airport. However, Haneda is less than 20 minutes away, so shuttle service shouldn't be that much to ask for; especially, given the number of loyal Marriott members that stay at this hotel. Having to pay $250 for transportation to Narita is excessive. Further $80 for transportation to Haneda is also excessive. Yes, the airport limousine bus is an economical choice at roughly US $8.00. However, they only offered two times to Haneda which did not work for my particular airport itinerary. I can only assume that this happens quite a bit.Dear management, I hope you'll consider offering shuttle transportation to and from the airport and order to and from the nearby metro stations just like the other Marriott hotels in the Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Courtyard, Tokyo Ginza for our honeymoon. We booked with our Marriott points and are Platinum Premier members.The hotel is in the business district, but was only a short walking distance to the subway, bars & restaurants, main shopping district, and the famous Tsukiji fish market.5-Star Experience:o Personal, warm, and welcoming correspondence, even prior to our trip to Japano The hotel upgraded us from the standard room to the spacious PH corner suite. Not once, but every time! The largest room available at the hotel, with its own sauna!o Check-in amenities included various drinks (sparkling water, beer, wines), fruits, chocolates, cakes, cheese, and snacks. The staff also left us various congratulatory cards and gifts given it was our honeymoon.o Member benefits included complementary drinks at the hotel bar and breakfast buffet.This hotel has one of the best breakfast buffets in town. Organized, clean, and delicious. The food options varied from traditional Japanese items to made-to-order omelets!o The staff at the hotel were all warm, welcoming, and most importantly, they were genuine. They inquire about our trip, recommended things to eat and places to visit (even outside of Tokyo), and helped us not only store our luggage, but also coordinate their delivery to the airport.o They even extended our check-out to 4 PM.... yes, 4 PM!The Courtyard, Tokyo Ginza was our home away from home. Having stayed at mid-range and luxury hotels on our trip to Japan (from Prince, Westin, Mandarin, St. Regis, to Ritz-Carlton), this hotel certainly felt like hidden gem. My wife and I were both pleasantly surprised with the level of service (which was personalized and anticipatory of our needs) from a brand that is typically known to tailor to business travelers. It was Simply Amazing! A hidden Luxury Hotel!Thank you Courtyard, Ginza for making our honeymoon to Japan that much more memorable and that much more wonderful! And a thank you to to Ms. Yui Yamashita for all the details and special touches!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Absolutely thrilled with this property. My first time travelling internationally alone and it couldn't have gone better. The staff first of all extremely welcoming, helpful, and outgoing to ensure my expectations were exceeded. The location remarkable, every time I walked back to the hotel I couldn't believe how lucky I was to end up in such a great spot. Breakfast and dinners both abundant and delicious. Wifi was the best and easiest I have ever used at any hotel anywhere in the world. Room exceeded what my preconceived ideas were too. I can't fault this hotel or any of my experiences with it at all. Will never consider staying anywhere else in Tokyo again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the Courtyard Tokyo Ginza for a few days last week. The location is close to the subway and Metro stations. Lovely stores and cafes close by; there is a Tully's coffee right next door Our room was beautifully decorated and immaculate. Morgan Gustave in the lobby was the quintessential bellman; he was so helpful and gave us wonderful recommendations. It was so nice to be remembered by him when we walked through the lobby. I've already told my friends when they visit Courtyard Tokyo Ginza, they must ask for Morgan. Additionally, Mina Ming was lovely and also gave us good recommendations also. Overall, a wonderful stay.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
TiffanyR673
New York, New York, United States

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is almost like a second home for my husband, and I've been here several times, so when we arrived at the hotel, all of the folks at the front desk stood up and greeted and welcomed us back so warmly by name. We love this place! The staff are wonderful--May Mon, Mina, and Morgan at the front desk, along with the French gentleman whose name I unfortunately forgot to note, are super friendly and helpful, as is Ricardo at the concierge desk and Nara in the Oasis lounge located in the lobby. And the first night we were there, the Oasis manager came over and gave us a lovely greeting as well.The hotel is in a very convenient location, a couple of blocks from the Ginza shopping area and the metro station. The room was great, and they even have western-style outlets, so we don't even need our converter for our electronics. Since my husband is a Marriott lifetime platinum member, breakfast is included, and what a breakfast! It's a huge buffet of wonderful Asian and western foods.This is a great hotel that we will always come back to when traveling to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I really enjoyed this hotel. The location is a great, just steps away from great shopping, transportation and restaurants (close to fish market). The staff was wonderful and extremely helpful. It was even better that this hotel was a pick up location for several of day excursions (Mt Fuji and Kyoto).

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: centrally located convenient transport options good value hi-quality hotel, nicely decorated, good for business or leisure stay nice sized rooms and excellent service, helpful staff! a good option when travelling to tokyo

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Located in Ginza, a short distance from the Central Station and right by a major avenue, the Courtyard Tokyo Ginza Hotel is very convenient. Staff is courteous, efficient and international, a successful recipe for great customer service. Our room was clean, of a good size and it had a nice city view.Overall this hotel provides great value and gives you instantaneous access to the Ginza area, perfect for a shopping trip or for being in the chic and happening neighbourhood after business meetings are done.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great location, only 2 blocks in either direction to subway stops. The staff speak fluent English. The breakfast buffet was amazing, including both Japanese and Western-style food. The rooms were also pleasantly quiet. I didn't notice any street noise at all during our two-day stay.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The Courtyard has a great location to a lot of great restaurants within walking distance and the imperial palace is not too far either. The room was nice and had everything I needed. The TV remote was different but manageable to figure out.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: There is nothing negative to be said about this hotel! The small rooms are packed with amenities and everything single thing is amazingly clean! Every person in the hotel and restaurant staff was courteous and professional and extremely helpful! I ate at the restaurant buffet twice and impressed both times with the service, the variety of food, and the quality of the food offered! I would love to go back to this hotel again!!
user_name:
Pam J
Havelock, North Carolina, United States

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: very nice location for this small hotel, and farily priced for its location really close to anything you could be look for in Ginza! Shops, Sushi bars, whatever... !Rooms are not too big, but ok for a business hotel. Very good service, everybody speaking english!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We spent a couple of nights at this property and it was a very good experience. Room size was acceptable (for Japan standards) although bathroom was certainly small.Location is very convenient. A taxi from Tokyo Station will take 5 minutes and less than 1.000 JPY to the Hotel and you have many subway stations nearby. Ginza line is just 5 minutes walking distance and you have many shops around.Breakfast was very good. Many choices both Japanese and western and very good service.Actually, service was extremely good with all the people we have to interact, so excellent place to consider if you have to stay in Ginza area.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is a great hotel located in the heart of the Ginza. A short walk to restaurants bars and shops. We spent four nights here and it was a very pleasant break in Tokyo. It's not the most opulent hotel, but is comfortable and reasonably priced for central Tokyo. The breakfast bar has an excellent range of Asian and Western dishes and staff are obliging. Our check-in/out was seamless and all staff spoke good English. The bar area is nothing spectacular, but comfortable enough after a hard day of retail therapy. Rooms are small, however, they are comfortable and clean. We would certainly return.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel is maybe 8 blocks from courtyard Tokyo station. I stayed here just to mix it up a bit. This hotel does have bigger rooms than Tokyo station. But does not include dinner for the Marriott platinum members. Breakfast is included. And a bus to the airport can be had for about $30 after currency conversion. Just as enjoyable as Tokyo Station. Bottom line on your decision....do you want a bigger room or the dinner and drinks amenity? Both are fine hotels that I thoroughly enjoyed.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: `the location is great if you like to stay in Gina. The breakfast is excellent, the rooms are ok the beds are great. Staff was not always very friendly and flexible. the bus from the airport has her stop in front of the hotel so that is perfect

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: For me, the best of this hotel is location, so near to Chuo Dori St. and several underground stations; breakfast a little bit expensive and it wasn´t buffett; rooms quite nice and silent, nothing out of ordinary; so great idea having a shuttle service direct to Narita International Airport, that's nice because if you don't familiarized with Tokyo underground lines, could be a nightmare trying to understand them and get to your destination.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I have stayed here many many times over the past five years. This is a very modern and comfortable hotel in the heart of Tokyo's most desirable area. The rooms are immaculately clean, the beds are very comfortable. If you're lucky enough to get the upgrade to a suite, you'll find additional amenities and more space. The staff here is gracious and helpful. I would make this my base of operations for all of my Tokyo trips. This hotel offers the right mix of western and eastern styles. Also conveniently located on the Limo-bus line from Narita airport.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for one night and was good value for money. Rooms clean, as spacious as you'll get for this price in Japan. Excellent standard of toiletries, linen etc. Great coffee machine. 5 minute walk to subway. Great buffet breakfast catering to all tastes - western, european, asian. Highly recommend for sightseeing or business.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: At first hesitant to stay, because only Courtyard but my cousin insisted we should stay in that area because it is the center of everything , I am very glad I did, the location is perfect near the train station if you want to visit the tourist spots very accessible, good restaurants around their area ( also their in house restos are good) It is like JW or better if you compare here in US( 10x better than courtyards here in US, their Concierge Lounge is very very good( guess because they cater to a lot of business men) , the food Wow!! Heavenly best pancake I ever tasted in my lifeTheir other asset the wonderful very efficient staff, very very courteous, polite, sincere, you can feel they are very very happy to serve and please you, they care for you, they will advise you what to do and make sure you go home this time and use this and that for safety reasons, they put their 200% best to serve and please youBy the way they have a shuttle service, actually a bus shared with other hotels, very very efficient, price very reasonable, will pick you up in front of hotel( train is good but if you have luggages you do not want to carry them to the stations) when I arrived at the airport they helped me also with my luggages. Will be back this year with longer stay, I love their food very very healthy and delicious, btw if you are into shopping high end stores are easy walk from the hotelThank You again Marriott Courtyard Ginza!!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Just came for 4 nights hotel clean everything you needed in the room. Room very well set out aircon did not get super cool but given time of year was not a problem. Breakfast was of a reasonable standard when busy staff struggled with the crowds overall not bad choices at the buffet. Had to wait on the last morning as very busy. Handy to a few of the big attractions unfortunately most are closed at this time of year. Please check if you think of staying over New Years not the hotels issue just a holiday time.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We wanted a hotel close to the Ginza and this hotel fit the bill. The room was somewhat larger than many tourist type hotels in Japan. The staff were great and the restaurants quite good. We would certainly stay there again on another trip to Tokyo..

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is a great small hotel with excellent staff who go out of their way to give service.
