The hotel is not large and some rooms are smaller than US standards but it is clean, neat and a great place to stay right in the heart of Ginza. It is probably the best Marriott property in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Was on a business trip to Tokyo and stayed for a night in this hotel. Great location in the "happening" Ginza. Rooms are spacious and very well furnished. Good to have English speaking staff providing prompt service. The Breakfast was good with lots of variety. Though bit expensive compared with other hotels, would highly recommend a stay here if in or near Ginza

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This central hotel (for its district) offered a good base for sightseeing. We walked to the fish market, down the elegant main shopping streets, and even to the Emperor's palace gardens and the Museum of Modern Art (MOMAT). Our room was pleasant and the included breakfast offered even more delicious choices than I could want. The staff was great and we appreciated their help (especially Ricardo's).

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: It was a great experiencia to staying in this hotel! The breakfast was very good with lots of good choices. The staff were very friendly ! This is a great area to stay in Tokyo, Ginza! Lots of shopping around, the fish market where you can get great fresh sushi ! The subway very close to the hotel . Just some walking to the Royal Palace .

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I booked this while needing to find a hotel within the Ginza area. There weren't many that pulled up on the internet and I feel comfortable booking with Marriott brand companies. The hotel was clean, convenient and the associates were all very helpful and well trained.I read a few reviews about the A/C and was nervous, almost to point of booking a new hotel. I'm glad I didn't as it was a nonissue. The room temp in my room was completely fine. The one thing I didn't like about the hotel was the bar. It opens at 5pm, and when you arrive, it is very formal in a sense of arrival (although the bar itself isn't formal.) They also charge a "cover charge," which I found odd. I also don't like that people can smoke in the bars as a woman next to me kept blowing smoke in my face, to a point where I had to leave.Otherwise it was a wonderful experience.
user_name:
DCJD2012
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This Hotel is by far the best hotel in Tokyo...The service was outstanding..The food was Great...The location is close to subway...The area was clean...The prices where good...I really enjoyed my stay...

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: First time to Tokyo. This Courtyard was in a great location. The room and the food at the hotel were very good. Everyone spoke English and I really felt at home. Morning buffet is quite extensive with American and Asian food.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Where this hotel is - an area with smaller restaurants, convenience stores and a nice liquor supermarket. Our room is located just next to the elevators and we never hear any single noise. Very greatly build hotel - great infrastructure-once you open the shower tap, hot water comes out without delay. Also, lots of electrical outlets! Last but not least, the hotel provides bus transfer to both Narita and Haneda airport.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel room was nicely laid out even with the relatively small room size. Bed was comfortable. Switches for room lighting were convenient to access. Key access to the floor provides an added security feature. Good Breakfast spread with variety and good taste. The Japanese restaurant in the basement floor was also convenient and good value for lunch. Finally it was a great location with many restaurants, Tsukiji and Ginza nearby.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Currently on my last night of a 3 night stay at this property. All is well as expected i.e. Very helpful and professional staff especially Ricardo the concierge. The room, although not large by western standards, is adequate and yes the AC was not to be had as mentioned by previous reviewers. I requested a fan which helped. Management needs to look into this in addition to cigarette smoke seeping into my non smoking room.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Had a great 6 days at this hotel in nOV....just off the Ginza by 3 streets - food ok ish...but lots of restaurants around....the Narita bus stops right outside the hotel and the hotel people carry you bags to the room!.....very helpful staff

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel is located very close to the shopping area and the Fish market, so perfect for visitor. The room is average compared to Japanese standard, but small compared to Western standrad.I have read one review that the room is too hot, and it is true because in winter they only have heat air con. But we have a solution that we turned off the air con and just keep the room at their normal temperature which is agreeable enough to sleep, otherwise if the air con is turned on, it is too hot and dry. There are lots of restaurants nearby, We only try the Italian restaurant and it was very nice.During our stay here, everything went smooth, the staffs are efficient and polite. The limousine airport transfer picks and drop you to/from airport in front of the hotel which makes everything quite easy. Try the food court at Mitshukoshi. They have much variety of high quality foods and sweets,

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel is a 7-10 minute walk from a major JR station and 5 minute walk to the subway. It's located in a high end shopping district and is currently close (before it moves) to the famous fish market. Staff is friendly and accommodating and helped us book several restaurants around town. It would have been nice if they had more than one concierge.
user_name:
stina_anits
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The Peninsula Hotel was full and the Andaz was too expensive to I elected to stay here. The hotel is clean and in a nice part of the city....particularly if you are there for shopping or to see the fish market which is walking distance. However, the rooms are very basic and you won't want to spend much time in the room. And value for money is quite good for Tokyo but poor relative to other cities in Asia.
user_name:
SDodge56
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I scheduled a last minute trip to Tokyo that included four nights stay in this property. I travel often for please and usually limit my time to 4 or 5 nights stay. To my great fortune I booked the Courtyard Tokyo Ginza Hotel by Marriott. To say that this property exceed my expectations would be an understatement. The staff was excellent, the rooms among the best I have experienced, the breakfasts were excelent and the location to access the very friendly subway system was superb. Some of the reviews regarding subway access left me with a bit of concern as I always want to be in close proximity to the subway access points. In this case it is a short 2 block walk and I was very pleased that I chose this hotel. The hotel is also only a couple blocks from the popular Ginza Shopping District. As an added benefit the toilets in the hotel are all smart toilets if you get my meaning. Even in the lobby. If you stay in this property will not be disappointed.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Currently on night 3 of 8 and regretting it. I stayed here back in May/June (when there was air conditioning) and enjoyed my stay so much I booked a hotel again for 8 nights while on vacation now in November. I'm paying an arm and a leg for a standard room. I am disappointed this stay though because my room is super hot!!! I'm from Hawaii so I'm used to hot weather but the room is hot and the windows are not able to be opened (understand only on the 9th and 10th floor they have windows that can be opened). The front desk brought in a fan but it doesn't help. Apparently the hotel turns off the air conditioning at this time of year which I understand is common in Japan but if you can't open the windows since it is just a window pane, you subject your guests to torture. I don't understand why the hallways are cool but the room is so hot. I complained to the front desk but they could not do much but tell me to turn off the air conditioner since it will blow hot air and put a fan in my room. I will never again stay here again if it is not during the summer when the air conditioner is on. If I could open my window I would be fine but there is no window to open on the 7th floor.I am also a Marriott gold member so have stayed in a lot of hotels and this is my most unhappy stay. It's so hot I can't sleep at night and I lived in hot Hawaii my entire life. Save your money and go somewhere else. I'm on my 3rd night of 8 and debating on switching hotels.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel is conventiantly located from the railway station and right in the middle of all the action. All the shops and restaurants are walking distance including the popular fish market of Tokyo. I received a complimentary Wall Street Journal. The hotel had a standard gym like most North American Marriotts. I liked their technology for the elevators where you scan your card and the floor automatically selects where your intended to go. The staff were all friendly from the door and front desk. We borrowed an umbrella since there was light rain the first night. I liked the coffee in the room since it wasn't very strong. Their bathtubs are relaxing since they are deep enough to lounge into.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great and quick service. The Doorman got a taxi right away when we needed it and gave us a map of Tokyo. Location of this hotel is close to the train station and shopping area in ginza . Only 2 blocks away, walking distance. The best part is the buffet breakfast, lots of choices. Rooms are clean and not too small.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Initially put off when I booked it, thinking the price was very high for a Courtyard. In the USA, the Courtyards are on the dumpy side and took away the free breakfast.It is more like the AC Hotels in Spain than the Courtyards in the USA. The breakfast buffet is a bit better quality of food than in the Manilla Marriott, but not as many selections. The staff is quite helpful.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Good location near Ginza comercial area, small average rooms at an expensive rate. Convenient limo bus stop to both airports; count on an hour journey if you head to Narita. Good staff service and good English from all the team at the front desk.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Well-maintained and quiet hotel a few minutes' walk from the heart of the Ginza shopping area. Easy access to most metro lines, and a 20-minute walk to Tokyo Station. Staff friendly and helpful, good breakfast in the lobby restaurant.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is a good old school hotel in Ginza area, ticking all regular boxes. Good points are; there are a few spacious restaurants and bar, there is a fitness gym (rare in Ginza area), English service is very good and consistent (for this reason, there are many international guests here). Downside are; the building is getting old, a tiny bit far to everything (stations, convenience store etc). I felt this one was more for holidays rather than business.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The rooms are average to fair, Check-in, and concierge are pleasant enough. I thought I would get that out of the way before I jump into the reason I am writing this review.The Bars, down stairs and lobby, are hilariously hysterical over the use of drink coupons given to Elite Status Guests at the hotel. There is no "club" at this hotel so in turn they will give you "coupons for drinks and breakfast". However if you are going to use the drink coupons apparently you MUST tell the waitstaff and bartender before you order. At the bar the use of a coupon relegates you to the cheapest draft beer or whatever is under the "bottom shelf" of liquor. The bartender pointed at a few dusty bottles of hooch when I asked him what kind of drink I could get besides a beer. This was of course AFTER I had ordered a beer, tried to pay with the coupon, and received an angry lecture about telling him I had a coupon prior to ordering next time.At the "Wine Bar" on the main floor it is the same comical antics. If you use a coupon you are not worthy of the "free nuts" that comes with a beer ordered by a human (aka paying cash). The ladies there made a loud and obvious effort to determine whether the scoundrel (aka Folks that stay with Marriott, A LOT) in front of them were using coupons. If no coupon the attitude was pleasant and helpful, if coupon then the service was brisk, cold, and a "drink quickly and leave".I know these are small details but I think it speaks to a larger view of the hotel. They, Tokyo Ginza Courtyard, staff are there to squeeze every dollar out of their guests. They are grudgingly providing Corporate Benefits and services to frequent Marriott guests. It gives the whole place a cheap and shady feel and it makes you wonder about where else they are squeezing costs to make a buck. I mean how much does it cost to wash and change the sheets and is it worth the investment to them, ya know?I travel about two weeks out of the month in ASIA and have stayed predominately at Marriott properties. Some are OK and some are not. Its a real shame the owners (or management) of this particular Ginza Marriott properties have decided a shakedown is more profitable than an investment in attracting frequent "high mileage" guests.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The better one so far I stayed in Ginza a few times with different hotel. Need a little more walk to the core Ginza but still convenient. Neat room and comfortable. Impressed. However, a bit pricy with this standard of the room. Last convenient access airport shuttle.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Rooms are a good size and accommodations are very nice. The staff is very friendly, helpful, and can provide plenty of recommendations around the area. Only a few minutes walk from a station and from downtown Ginza. There are a couple of small local places to eat, a short walk away, if you choose not to dine in at the hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: It is probably the best of the Marriott offerings in Tokyo when you consider the staff, the quality of the rooms and the food offering and of course the location in the heart of Ginza. Do not expect a big flashy hotel but just good clean and neat rooms and very friendly staff.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the Courtyard Tokyo Ginza Hotel as a family. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Tokyo. The location is very convenient to the metro - about a 5 minute walk. The rooms are on the small side compared to US hotels, but average for Tokyo. The only slight negative of our stay was the breakfast buffet. Our room included breakfast which was laid out in what I would call a cafeteria style. My children have nut allergies and they mislabeled some items as being nut free when they clearly contained nuts. I did not feel comfortable having them eat at the buffet. This is a big thing for my particular situation, but minor for almost anyone else. Everyone else seemed to be very pleased with the breakfast buffet. The buffet itself has everything one might want and is run very efficiently. A lot of people continually arrived at the same time and no one had to wait for a table. The bell desk was also extremely helpful to us. We decided to take the airport bus and that was an excellent choice. The bell desk set up the reservation for us and told us what time to arrive. We arrived slightly before the time they gave us and at the exact time we expected, we were loaded quickly onto the bus and rode to the airport in comfort. Also, I had made a number of purchases for friends and ran out of room in our suitcases. I needed to mail these items home to the States. The bell desk helped me package and weigh my shipment. The package arrived as promised, no problems.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: It's close to the Metro station about 5 mins by walk. Room is simple, clean and spacious. It also included the breakfast, which have a lot of variety and tasty. I enjoy it very much. Staff are friendly. Also have a 24 hours store next to the hotel. Few restaurant around the hotel and a big Game Center nearby.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Wife and I staying here for 4 nights as part of a tour. Can't really comment on value for $ for that reason. Clean, spacious and quiet rooms allowing for a great night rest. Friendly English speaking staff. Would return.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The Courtyard Marriott Tokyo Ginza was the perfect choice of accommodation for my stay! At the price, it was luxurious, close to all the sites and subways, and shopping. It is also walking distance to the Tsukiji Fish Market, at its current location (key if you want to wake up early for the fish auction). The staff were amazingand assisted me with all of my needs - especially the concierge who helped me in booking a fabulous sushi dinner! They were able to assist with transport options to and from the airport, give recommendations on must do/see locations, and provide guidance when needed. The rooms were wonderfully comfortable. I cannot speak highly enough of the breakfast - amazing! So many choices and all was delicious!!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My husband is a marriott platinum rewards member and our stay was fantastic. Everyone was very attentive and helpful. The rooms were perfect as well as the location. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Definitely super exceeded my expectations! I chose this hotel because I am a Marriott reward elite member. They definitely recognize your membership here. I was upgraded to a deluxe room on the 11th floor. Clean and spacious room with lots of amenities. Staff is very professional and friendly. Excellent true Japanese customer service. Courtyard hotels are usually more or less basic hotels in the US, however this hotel is way beyond basic. This was my first visit to Japan and the location was central to explore Tokyo. 2 subway stations nearby. Tokyo station is not that far as well. And the breakfast!! This is the best part! So many choices! Omelette station, Japanese and American breakfast. I found their breakfast buffet is even better than the Marriott in Osaka, which is super luxurious hotel. I used points but it is an excellent value.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed 4 nights at this hotel as part of our holiday in Japan. Great location for exploring all the sites Tokyo has to offer. Room was a great size I was expecting a much smaller room after reading some of the reviews. Breakfast was the best so far this trip and the staff were all friendly and helpful

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed for a week in Marriott and below are the pros & ConsPros->1->Awesome location,right in the heart of tokyo shopping district Ginza.2-> Walk able distance to the metro station.3->Near to the Imperial palace.4->Lots of restaurant nearby.5->Awesome hospitality.Cons->Room size is bit small.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Just returned from a six night stay in this property.I had a single room which was a double bed room.It is very small but more than adequate for a single person. Bed was comfortable, shower was hot or cold as required.Staff were very pleasant at all times.Location brilliant Hope to return to Tokyo and this hotelDefinitely value for money

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Excellent place to stay. Rooms were a bit small but it had everything. I will surely stay again. The best and the most economical shopping place is just near by. Also visit GU and Donkey... these places are just walking distance away where u find things at exonomical rates.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The Marriott Courtyard Ginza is a marvellous hotel in the trendy Ginza area. It is extremely well located to visit the Tsukiji Fish Market.The Kabuki-za is a 5-7min walk from the hotel. Shibuya, Shinjuku and Roppongi Hills are within easy reach by metro. Higashi Ginza and Ginza metro stations are both within walking distance. Our luggage was delayed getting to the hotel from a previous hotel. The man at the check-in desk(apologies for not noting his name) was extremely helpful in ensuring that our luggage was delivered as soon as possible. He could not have been kinder. The rooms were very clean and comfortable.We stayed at the hotel for two nights and wished we could have stayed longer.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is a story... Standard and friendly checkin. I show my passport as usual. We get our keys and move to our room. About 10-15 minutes after someone knock at the door with a birthday cake, Perrier and a greeting card signed by everyone in front desk. I never said anything, someone (sorry I don't know her name!) saw my birth date on my passport and they did this to me. This is a unique experience. I never have seen someone so thoughtful in an hotel... Many thanks to Courtyard Tokyo Ginza Hotel staff. In French we say "Chapeau!". And by the way I recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The Marriott Courtyard Ginza is a beautiful hotel in the heart of the shopping district with the best stores just blocks away. Right near the front of the hotel is a major bus stop that can take you around the city including to the famous Tsukiji Fish Market.One evening while staying there, there was a local parade in front of the hotel. (I have no idea what the parade was celebrating.)The lobby is beautiful and the rooms are elegant and very comfortable. We recommend this fine hotel because it is also modestly priced for the area it is located in.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed twice at the Marriott Courtyard Ginza, 3 nights from July 14 to 17 and then again July 25 to 27. The Courtyard is certainly not like any Courtyard in North America. To us it came across like any regular Marriott property. We found that the rooms were immaculately clean and very well appointed. The rooms were certainly big enough for us and we had 4 suitcases between the two of us. The mattress was comfortable and the sheets were super crisp.As I am a gold elite member there were free breakfasts (more about that later) and 2 fee drinks each per day. The front desk and bell staff were very welcoming and very helpful, answering all of our questions to the best of their abilities. The breakfasts were great, with an egg station, fruit, pasteries, cerials, breads, fruit and various Asian foods. They (the chef) even came around with a fresh tray of croissants. I used the fitness room every day and all equipment was in working order. The lobby of the hotel was real nice.While I found it to be expensive (I guess that is what you get for staying at a hotel in the Ginza) I would certainly stay there again and I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Hotel and staff were really wonderful. The staff were very helpful and informative. Good location for walking if you don't want to eat in the hotel. Very near to the transportation to get to other parts of the city. Shopping in immediate area was great.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed here for two nights before I flew home to Stockholm. The hotel is really well placed on a sidestreet to the main shopping street in Ginza. This is probably the only positive about this hotel. The rooms are small even at a Tokyostandard. It feels a bit plastic. The bathroom is really small and plastic. I unfortunately got a room at the end off the korridor, facing the really busy street outside. If I have'nt had earplugs,I would'nt have been able to sleep. The hotel is unfortunately a bit pricy. If you need wi-fi, it will cost you 1350 yen/24 hours. It's not included in the roomprice. The breakfast is rather good though. The hotel is clean and well maintained and the staff speaks really good english, but their are other places in Ginza that's better for the price you pay at Courtyard.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Loved being right in Ginza. Could walk to most places. Modern room. Breakfast buffet was more western than I expected (that's a good thing).Bar is nice but silly expensive.Be sure to take a bus or train to airport. Cabs are very expensive and drivers know little English.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This Courtyard is more like an upscale regular Marriott hotel. Several restaurants, a great lobby bar/lounge and all the amenities. Room and bathroom are larger than the others I encountered in Japan, more the size we are used to in the US. Buffet breakfast has everything you would want. Staff was friendly and helpful. Perfect location for wandering the Ginza area to shop, eat and sightsee. Also 1 minute walk to subway station. Shuttle direct to Narita airport (approx $30 fee) right from the hotel - no hauling luggage to the train or spending an exorbitant amount for a cab. Highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I had been in a couple of Courtyards in the USA and was expecting the same, it was not even close. The property was closer to the level of the AC Hotels in Madrid and Barcelona. However, the staff was outstanding. The breakfast, as a gold member, was good, but still did not meet the level you get at the Marriott in Manila. The hors d'oeuvres for the evening were quite good. The hamburger was one of the best I ever had.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Spacious rooms for Tokyo. Convenient Ginza location with access to multiple subway lines and the Tsukiji fish market.Many restaurants, convenience stores, grocery stores, and Ginza shopping within walking distance.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This place is 5 minutes walk from downtown Ginza & the train stations. Lots of restaurants around. There is a family mart right behind the hotel which can be useful for drinks & snacks. The hotel room size is decent & clean. Breakfast is good & serves both western & Japanese cuisines. You can get free breakfast if you have certain status with Marriott Rewards. They have kimono in the room for you which is kinda cool.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Very nice hotel and close to metro station and shops. The room was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable, which is important. There is a very nice free breakfast if have an elite membership. Staff are friendly. Would definitely stay again next time we find ourselves in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Have stayed here twice now and I love it here! The location is AMAZING...great location in Ginza area and super close to Toyko Subway system. The rooms are smallish, but to be expected in Tokyo. They do have nice amenities in all the rooms, and the staff service is very good. As a gold member I love the HUGE buffet and cooked to order eggs in the morning. The western and Asian breakfast are excellent options! I will only stay in Ginza and love this property.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel is in a great location walking distance to many different things as well as close to subway stations. Breakfast was included and was also nice. Loved the music in the hallways at night time.Will stay there again if/when we go to Tokyo

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: As other reviewers mentioned, the location for this hotel is super convenient. Short walk to subway station, and main Ginza shopping areas. Plenty to do and good restaurant near by. When it comes to level of services and attention to details, this hotel is head above shoulder compare to any Courtyard I've stayed at in the US. Great job to the staff here, would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I was here for 12 days for a business trip and it was a great hotel. Close to everything in Ginza including subways, shops, restaurants. The staff is super nice and friendly. Concierge is really helpful for asking questions, recommendations, finding places, giving directions, etc., AMAZING breakfast buffet everyday. Rooms were small but very nice. And they have a very inexpensive and super luxury shuttle to airport.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The fish market is moving this year, in anticipation of that, we took the trip to Japan this year and I booked months ahead the stay at the Courtyard Tokyo Ginza since I’m a Lifetime Marriott Reward member and this is the closest Marriott property to Tsukiji. First night was awful since we didn’t get our usual upgrades, there were 4 of us and we got a room with 2 twin beds. Mind you these are not double let alone queen-sized bed, it’s twin-sized! With much difficulties we passed the night, perhaps from being too tired after 3 hours Shinkansen ride from Osaka and arriving pretty late at the hotel. However we did not let the disappointing room stopped us from waking up at 3 am and went to Tsukiji only to find out it’s Wednesday and they are closed! Well, we went again the next day and successfully partook in what we came here for, the Tsukiji Tuna auction. But if we didn’t stay here, there’s no way we would’ve done that. Anyway after morning naps, I spoke to the staff in the reception and she kindly offered to upgrade us to a larger room on a higher floor as well as give us a roll-away bed without extra charge. Yay! Kudos to the super friendly front desk staff, this was easily the best experience. The breakfast is pretty good, with good selection of Asian and Western fares, although the selection is not as good as Courtyard Shin-Osaka’s. The restaurant area itself is not too big, mind you this is Tokyo where everything is small, crampy and expensive, so yes, the hotel is actually doing pretty good given all these disadvantages. Everything is on the ground floor, unlike Marriott Marquis where I’m not even sure where the lobby is. So again, the hotel has a very nice and convenient setting that doesn’t require you to climb up 8 levels only to check in. The hotel is very close to, I hope I got this right, Higashi-Ginza Station which is a subway station on the Toei Asakusa Line. In other words, this is the one of the Marriott properties in a strategic location (Ginza) that is within a train ride from Narita. We scheduled our trip to end at this hotel with the understanding we could directly go to Narita from here, and it didn’t disappoint. After 3 nights stay, the day of our departure is here. We woke up at 5.30, went downstairs for breakfast with our luggage and then caught the 7.15 Toei-Asakusa subway which turn into the train heading for Narita. There’s no need to change train and it only costs us 1300 yen for adults and a little over 600 for kids. Perfect ending to our Japan trip. Thanks again Courtyard Tokyo Ginza for the wonderful stay!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We had a quick trip to Japan and wanted a good location. Hotel is near subway stations, great shopping, great food and fish market. Wonderful staff and great breakfast buffet. Couldn't ask for more for a visit to Disneyland or shopping heaven.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I want to Thank the Staff at the Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel for their exceptional service during our stay in Tokyo. The staff is extremely professional and courteous, but my accolades do not stop there. During our stay not only did they assist with all the transportation and logistic needs, subways, taxis and trains. They help us with our daily actiivites to various sightseeing locations, and helped plan our visit to the Disney theme parks including where to buy tickets ahead of time to avoid the lines. Explaining the various details n our native langauge English. The biggest Thank You is for the help of when my daughter came down ill near the end of stay. They recommended an interantional hospital and arragned a taxi for us. I am so Thankful for their thoughtfulness and concern for my family. Thank you for making my family feel so welcomed to be in Japan and for taking such great care of us.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This Courtyard is in a very central location and just a few blocks from the subway station. I'm a Platinum Elite at Marriott and found this hotel up to par with US standards except the rooms are very tiny, which I think is probably because of the scarcity of space in Tokyo. The restaurant downstairs is good except I found it awkward that in a metropolitan city like Tokyo people still hold old world prejudices. They refused to seat us inside even though the restaurant was COMPLETELY empty, claiming all tables were reserved. I was with two other colleagues from the US and even they felt awkward at the treatment. It's relatively common in Tokyo to find signs at restaurants and establishments with signs saying Japanese Only. I don't hold this against Marriott as it was a reasonable hotel to stay at and served it's business purpose. I would likely not visit Tokyo unless absolutely required for business.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We were able to check in early after a long-haul flight, which was very helpful. Room lovely with all amenities and very well-equipped bathroom very comfortable and quiet. We loved the robes so much we bought ourselves one each. The staff were exceptionally kind and courteous We ate in the hotel (different restaurants) for 2 nights as we had busy days and both were good value.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed here for a total of five nights, spread over two visits. The location is nice, very close to two subway stops, within walking distance of Tokyo Station (about 20 minutes), and in a relatively quiet area of Tokyo. The staff are good, the rooms are nice, and the rooms are quiet. Wifi works well.Breakfast is very good and worth the cost. If you are a Marriott Silver Elite (10 or more nights be year), they give it to you free, so then the hotel is an even better value.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I chose this hotel since it is a Marriott property, but I was disappointed after spending my first week in Japan at the Ana Intercontinental. Comparable in price, this Courtyard does not measure up to the Ana or to Courtyards in the USA. I'm only 5'3", and if I had been any taller, my feet would have hung off the bed. Additionally, the bathroom has plastic walls with no ventilation, and as with the bed is designed for very short folks. However my biggest complaint is lack of air conditioning. Although it was running, my room never cooled down. I notified the front desk and they sent maintenance, but their only solution was to offer me a fan. This is simply not acceptable for a hotel charging well over $300 per night. On a positive note, the hotel is in a good location close to the fabulous Ginza shopping area.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel has great location and near many restaurants and convenience shops in Ginza. The shopping area is walking distance. Another great bonus is that the shuttle bus from the airport stops right in front of the hotel. Our room was a bit dusty but bedding was excellent and rooms were quiet.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This was our first hotel on our first visit to Japan - what a responsibility, but it didn't let us down.We had been warned that Tokyo hotel rooms were small- poppycock. I have stayed at, and reviewed, much smaller hotels in London and Paris. They're not massive rooms - but entirely adequate. The service through the hotel was excellent, the staff there are incredibly helpful and enthusiastic. The hotel is perfectly sited near the shopping area of Ginza, but our room was quiet enough.Breakfast was great. Japanese style service means that you may need to wait a few moments before being led to your table, but you soon get used to this. Once there, there is a wide offer open to you. We were in Japan for two weeks and this was the best breakfast we had - in fact this was the best hotel we stayed in.One slight drawback, which won't affect my overall 'score' as it is just a personal niggle. The lounge bar closes at nine, which means if you want a pre-bed drink- of any nature- you have to go down to the bar one floor down. One floor down and forty years behind the times - this was a real throwback to the seventies (even down to the Bee Gees music played). This is a smoky, dimly lit, area (smoky: really off putting now to Europeans) which is quite expensive - with a totally unnecessary cover charge and is just not in keeping with this modern, efficient hotel. I think this needs looking at; we went in once, were the only people there and didn't return a second time. A small gripe - otherwise a splendid stay.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We had to change hotel while in Tokyo so we went from the ANA Intercontinental to the Courtyard Marriott Ginza.I must say .... Much better the Marriott!!Staff was very kind and helpful.Room was okay, not so big but clean.Service also very good.Cappuccino ... not so good! These days to have a simple NESPRESSO machine to prepare a good cappuccino wouldn't be such a big investment!Before leaving for the airport we had a quick dinner which was surprisingly good, including a pasta dish cooked "al dente"!Overall I would select this hotel again ...just hoping for a better morning coffee!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: History: Originally built and opened in 1987 as Ginza Tobu Hotel. Re-branded most recently in 2007 as Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel. Renovated most recently in 2008. Location: 2 minutes walk from Toei Asakusa Subway Line Higashi Ginza train station in Chuo Ward, Tokyo. Very conveniently located in the middle of Ginza area.Interior Decor: Courtyard standard. Calm and relaxing Nice inviting lobby.Exterior Apperance: 11 story hotel in commercialized business area of Ginza. Outside view from the room I stayed at 807: Many commercialized buildings.Room Size: Approximately 26 square meters. Adequate - perhaps a bit small. Room Cleanness: Very well maintained.Bathroom: Adequate size. Noise Insulation: Good.Price and Value: Reasonable for the location and very good sets of amenities.Bed: Twin size. Firm softness.Breakfast: Complimentary breakfast buffet at Cafe Restaurant Fiore on 1st floor for Silver Elite Members. Surprisingly great varieties of food in both western and Japanese styles.Services: Professionally trained and friendly hotel staffs. I've been staying at this hotel occasionally since 2004, with my previous stay in 2011. Great to see renovations to make the appearance relevant to the modern trends.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel is in good location. Their staff speak quite good English. The size of the room is ok compare to other business hotel. This is business hotel but also good for family with kids. There are few convenience store near by and just 10 minuet walk to Ginza.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Made a one week combination business/pleasure trip with my wife so I wanted a hotel with reasonably sized rooms in an convenient area that didn't break the bank. The Courtyard fit the bill perfectly. The rooms were well appointed with plenty of room for two people and the occasional visit from our son. The staff were very nice and helpful. I had a pleasant surprise of complimentary breakfast for two. Good proximity to the subway and the Ginza shopping area.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Hotel is centrally located in Ginza, few minutes walk from the Ginza subway station / Chuo Dori street. Though rates are quite expensive and rooms are small, it is decent enough space to sit relax and sleep. Check-in was smooth and staff are very courteous. They did offer us a discount coupon for breakfast but we preferred the nearby Tsukiji market. The concierge is quite helpful and they have detailed guide pages of each location in Tokyo. Lot of restaurants nearby so we did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants. Recommend to use the airport limousine from the hotel to the Narita airport (JPY 3100 per adult). This is quite a convenience especially if you have large bags to haul around to the train / subway station. Overall experience was quite nice and would stay again if visiting central Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great location, near a very high-end shopping street, friendly and accommodating front office staff, very gracious and helpful, very clean hotel, our room had a steam sauna, great selection for breakfast. Highly recommend this hotel for families or those who want to hang out near Ginza because it is centrally located. We took the train from the airport and the hotel was literally two blocks away.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The courtyard Marriott was an awesome experience even though I only stayed one night and it was my first time in Japan! My room had a beautiful Japanese bathrobe laid out on the bed when I arrived. The room was very clean and updated. I dined at the lobby OASIS restaurant which was very late in the evening and they still accommodated my order even though after hours.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: It was perfectly located in the heart of Ginza. within walking distance to metro station, fish market, upscale shopping district and an endless number of amazing restaurants. Will definitely choose this hotel again.
user_name:
Leila008
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Hard bed. Broom closet. Have had nicer rooms in this hotel, but you must select a queen size bed or you will be sorry. I didn't have the chance to select my bed size and I was feeling trapped in my room all night in a bed pushed up towards the wall. I could touch the tv from the bed and one step to the bathroom. I tried to upgrade and they said they would for 70 dollars. I didn't due to being on a company card.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is a great hotel for those who wish to be based in Ginza. It is just 5 mins walk away from 2 major luxurious department stores. Check in and check out was prompt and efficient. The hotel staff were more than happy to help with restaurant reservations and advice on how to get from one place to another. The rooms however were a little cramp but thats normal in Tokyo. In addition, the amenities provided in the room were a little basic considering the rates charged per night. Convenient hotel in the heart of Ginza!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: What can I say about the Courtyard Tokyo Ginza Hotel that hasn't been said by others. This was an amazing place to stay on our first trip to Tokyo and Japan. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and nice, starting with the 20 questions we sent the concierge a couple of weeks before we got there to the spot on recommendations on how to navigate the Tokyo Subway System (which is awesome). Perfect location in Ginza, close to the best stores in Ginza and near the Tsukiji Fish Market. Welcomed by the staff when we got there, greeted everytime we went through the lobby, and helped out magnificently when we left I never felt more at home in a hotel. The buffet breakfast at the hotel was outstanding as well, especially for the first morning when you are acclimating. A couple of tips, take the orange bus shuttle (they call it a Limo) from Narita to the hotel and back, you are dropped off and picked up at the door of the hotel, and if you have never been I would recommend Tokyo Disneyland and DisneySea!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: When you are staying in Ginza, make sure that you are within walking proximity to everything, this is what this hotel is about. Good location in a quiet area but it is just behind all the flashing shops of Ginza. Service wise is international standard, attentive and friendly staff. Clean room and complete amenities.The only comment I have is since I am used to solo traveling, I usually get double bed. Upon arrival however, the hotel assigned me in a twin room, saying that 'we give you a bigger room' as extra privilige. Ok, I thanked. Upon arrival in the room, I found it not spacious as I have expected. Everything is too cramped with two beds, chairs and coffee table are squeezed in the room (I am comparing the space with my hotel in Kyoto). Since I was tired from long day tour and all my luggage have been put in the room, I just gave it a try to adapt to the space given. Having used to sleeping on a big bed, the first night on a small bed is a little bit uncomfortable with 'almost rolling fall' couple of times. Silly indeed, but finally on the 2nd night I could manage my space and the second bed was perfect for unpacking-packing after shopping days in Ginza. Win win...

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I just returned from a 10 day stay at the hotel. The staff went above and beyond in every category possible to make my stay a very memorable one. Originally I had gone back and forth between staying at the Marriott, Prince Sakura Tower (Autograph collection), Courtyard at Tokyo Station or Courtyard Ginza. After calling to speak with someone over the phone at the Marriott and Tokyo Station, it was clear that English would be a challenge for communication. When I had spoken with the representative at Ginza, I immediately knew that it would be the hotel to stay at due to the level of effective communications and I was not ever disappointed at the hotel from arrival through to departure. I also personally like to walk places and found Courtyard Ginza great with excellent restaurants near by, as well as a 2 minute walk from the train station and tons of high end shopping options. You also have a Lawson's (convenience store) and a Tully's coffee shop almost next door. There is a Denny's across the street but I wouldn't travel to Tokyo to go to Denny's personally. Cabs were plentiful, however make sure you take the hotel business card with you as many Taxi drivers don't speak English but once I had shown them the hotel address card, all was well. I didn't have a chance to arrange tours prior to arriving in Tokyo however the staff was able to help set up two day tours for my son and I that were both excellent. As a Platinum member, I was very pleased to have breakfast coupon's for my son and I each day. The breakfast was excellent as well as the service and options. We were also given drink coupons which made it very nice as well. I was upgraded on arrival and then upgraded again later in the week regarding bed type request. I would clearly, without question, stay at the Courtyard Ginza again! Thank you for the memorable stay.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We appreciated this hotel because it was quiet, but ideally located. Subway, restaurants, shopping not very far. Great price for Tokyo and decent meals. Rooms were typical Marriott - no surprises! A huge plus was the limo from the airport to hotel - otherwise cost would have been five times! Staff were helpful and made suggestions when asked. Never seemed in a hurry to get to the next guest.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Hotel is in a good location, being very close to the subway and the shopping/restaurants of Ginza, and is a 10 min walk from Tsukiji Market. All the employees that worked there were also very nice and helpful.However, the room was small and seemed dated. We picked this hotel because of this location compared to other Marriott properties in Tokyo. The full-service Marriott and Autograph Collection seemed a little out of the way, but may have been worth the extra travel time to get to the tourist areas since the rooms look bigger/nicer.
user_name:
croberts82
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: With airport-to-hotel service by Limousine airport bus at fractions of the cost of Taxi, is a big plus. The hotel is located just steps from everything: restaurants, name brand stores, department stores, restaurants, attractions ...... hey, even a Denny's across the street.As expected, the room size is smaller than a typical Courtyard due to expensive real estate in Tokyo, but the room has everything a business traveller would like. English speaking staff with Japanese hospitality make my visit very pleasant. For example, Mr Sasaki from the Guest Services was able to give me all the questions answered.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This wonderful hotel is located just two blocks away from Higashi Ginza subway stations. The staff are wonderful and do their best to serve you. Never seen people so happy to serve guests. Must be Japanese way. The rooms are similar to ones in Europe and smaller than in USA. This is because space is at a premium in Tokyo. Since, I was a platinum member, I was upgraded to the highest floor with free breakfast. The breakfast is splendid with a lot of choices and an omlette station. This hotel will be an excellent location to visit the tuna auction at Tsukuji market. The famous ginza way is just two blocks away. The airport limousine from Haneda and Narita airports stop and it is very convenient. Tokyo train station is also within walking distance and you can catch the bullet train from there. The Kabuki theater is two blocks away. There are many restaurants and bars behind the hotel and a Denny's is located in front of the hotel across the street. This could be the best location to visit the major attractions in Tokyo using the Subway. Tokyo attractions are mostly within a half hour away and this makes the hotel a convenient central location. There is a very popular Japanese restaurant in the hotel too.
user_name:
Sundncr
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed here on the last leg of a business trip from China. The airport shuttle from Narita took us straight to the hotel door. Check-in was fine with our group of five and three separate rooms booked. Enjoyable buffet in the hotel and a great bar downstairs to relax in which is open until late. Location was perfect and behind the hotel down a side street to the right walking distance of approx 150m is a traditional Kobe beef restaurant. Open for lunch from 11am with queues out the door and down the stairs into the restaurant at noon when we arrived but worth the wait. Shoes off orders taken at the door whilst waiting to be seated. The place was packed and our steaks arrived not long after we were seated and I must say they are the most delicious steaks we have ever eaten. Two of the group had eaten here before and we will all be returning in November. Not cheap as expected. $543 NZ dollars for three steaks but memorable. The hotel rooms are compact but that's Japan and we had a lot of luggage. We managed to fit it all in without breaking our necks walking around the room! Our bathroom had separate bath and shower and was all we needed. Robes and slippers in the smallish wardrobe and tiny cakes left on the bedside table were a nice touch. It's all there and we will stay again

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The usual Marriot standards. The fluent english speaking concierge a bonus in Tokyo.We wrongly thought it had it's own airport shuttle. Great location near 2 stations and the Kabuki theatre. Not cheap but comparable with other similar hotels in Tokyo.Breakfast great.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: For anyone on business, and on their own, this hotel does it well. Rooms are small but well appointed, free wi-firm and very well located near Tokyo Metro.Don't expect spa pool or gym - but if you are out most of the day this is great. And quiet.Afternoon tea was functional at best - but no-one should expect great coffee in Tokyo, least of all from a mid-level hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I'm happy to review this hotel. The room was squeaky clean. White sheets looked new and pressed. Two yukatas were provided everyday. The king bed was comfortable and we had no problem with our wifi connection. Ginza is convenient to train, shopping and restaurants. The Rikyu garden, Imperial Palace, fish market are all a walking distance. Fiore restaurant has wonderful buffet breakfast and dinner. This hotel has only eleven floors. We stayed here for eight days. Only complaint - windows don't open.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed with my two college daughters and we were upgraded to one of the semi-suite rooms on Premium Floor! Third bed was an extra but it was well worth and it was very roomy and comfy with great amenities! Breakfast has always been our favorite here, just carries everything that you can think of. Both Japanese (a hint of Chinese)and Western breakfast are available. Eggs of any styles, pastries, fresh salads, fruits and so on incl. my favorite eggs benedict. You may want to be a little earlier because there will be a line over the weekends and holidays. Ginza station is close and Kabukiza, Tsukiji Fishmarket, shiodome district and all th Ginza restaurants are all comfy walking distance. Staff working here are all friendly and prodfessional. I think that they are well trained may be because it used to be a Renaissance Hotel. I already booked the stay in December!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: If your looking for a good hotel in a good location, the Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza should fill your needs. The rooms, as are typical of Tokyo rooms are on the small size. Larger rooms are available on the 11th Premier Rooms floor. The lobby is just adequate, the restaurant is overpriced and the food is just adequate. Many shopping mall nearby hotel. The staff is very good and always helpful. I stay here because:-I am a member of the Marriott Rewards program-I do like the location. It is close to subways and the Ginza district

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel has a great location with a very attentive front desk staff. Although the rooms are small in size, they are quite efficient in the lay-out. The healthclub is in the basement, and does not contain any 'wet' areas. The restaurant has a nice breakfast buffet and one also for dinner. This hotel is located very close to the Ginza /Tokyo station and is less than a 10 minute walk to great shopping in the Ginza.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Spend 4 nights at the property. Hotel service is very good, all staff are pleasant and professional. English is spoken by nearly all employees and I found them to be extremely helpful to secure cabs and provide address information to get to and from the property. The Hotel has a good breakfast service with many choices, the sushi and fruits were all very fresh. There are on-site restaurants and two bars as well. Beware a bit of the bar downstairs, smoking is OK and there is no ventilation or windows and it can be quite unpleasant. Also the HVAC system is OK at best and rooms tend to get quite warm. I would recommend the property and stay there again. Very close to Ginza and many, many restaurants and high-end shopping.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The area of Ginza y great to shop, many stores and malls around it. Very good places to eat. The rooms are average in size but very comfortable, more luxurious than any courtyard I've seen. Front desk and concierge are amazing. A lot of eating options around the hotel and withing walking distance. Definetly want to come back. Very close to Haneda Airport, and close to the train station if you are coming from Narita and take the express train.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel is in Ginza, close to everything with major metro lines within walking distance.One of the pluses is that the "Airport Limousine" - the Narita bus - stops at the hotel adding to the convenience. The room was comfortable with a nice size bathroom and plenty of storage. The staff was very friendly and responsive, giving all kinds of advice on restaurants, neighborhoods to visit or places to shop. The breakfast buffer was extremely good but expensive ($25), a mix of Japanese, American and continental European. The only real issue with the hotel was the room rate which was much higher than comparable hotels the same week in the same area. For some reason, the rate shot up from $300 to $500 for one night , then on top of the tax and service charge, it turned our to almost $400 a night for a 6 night stay! I didn't have the choice of hotels which is why I booked there but could have saved a lot at other 4 stars.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I had booked the hotel for business and had paid for the wifi as I really needed it. (I do think in 2016 paying for wifi especially in a city like Tokyo is outrageous)The staff was welcoming and pretty nice. But my room was more than tiny and view was of a wall 1 meter away and the bathroom was more like a cabinet, and the wifi in the room worked poorly for something I paid for..My room had only very few sockets and the power was very low. I had to ask for room service to bring a transformer.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I had a very good experience except for the size of the room I was given. There was hardly any walking space even though everything had been provided. The electric kettle was giving trouble and they replaced it immediately. I found the staff very responsive and helpful. Very close to Ginza subway station and shopping centre. The airport Limousine coach will drop you right at the hotel - a big advantage for seniors. However the service of the coach is not as frequent as i would have liked.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel has very good location, in the middle of Ginza area. Also it close to nearby metro station, just 5 minutes walking. The room is quiet comfy and tidy, just enough to get a rest after busy day. The staff also very friendly and helpfull. The breakfast is good enough to enjoy. For me this hotel isbgood enough to stay in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Very comfortable clean place to stay close to everything. A great value for the money. The room was reasonably sized, bed comfortable, the service was consistently friendly and helpful. Felt like a home away from home :)

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The location is within central Ginza and in close proximity to various metro lines for connectivity. Best to use the airport limousine (bus shuttle) to reach the hotel though - it was challenging for us having taken the Narita Express to Tokyo Station, only to then face the prospect of finding the connecting line to Ginza and walk some distance with luggage and toddlers. We took a taxi instead which was a relief but considerably pricey.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Spent the first 4 nights of a 14 day visit to Japan and thoroughly enjoyed it. Rooms are large by Tokyo standards, spotlessly clean and modern. Location was great, 5 minute walk to the metro and lots of options to eat nearby. Front desk and concierge very helpful - can sort you out with a tourist metro pass (much easier option than finding a Bic Camera as you can't buy them at the station). Also have some useful brochures on all the different regions of Tokyo.  If you're having a longer stay I'd recommend splitting your trip between Ginza and Shibuya - very different Tokyo experiences and also lets you explore each area thourougly and minimise your travel time.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: It is not big but it is excellently located in Ginza and the rooms overall are well fitted out and generally larger than some other hotels around. The staff are excellent and provide great service with a smile. You cannot do much better than this hotel all things considered.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: First time in Tokyo and booked the Hotel From the third party for two nights- the booking showed ou rroom with smoking ( we might forgot to choose it the room with non smoking) but we asked to change it but it's complicated reception with unhappy tone told us that we could not change it. We asked them for a better deal since we were staying for two days there.Finally we got the room with non smoking after more 30 minutes dialogue and Unhappy face.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: When booking at a Courtyard you have to go in with the correct expectation. I preface my review saying simply because I don't want to provide a false reality based upon my own personal review of this hotel.To start, everyone at the hotel was beyond accommodating. In typical Japanese fashion, we were very well taken care of. The room we had was larger than another a room I stayed in at the Courtyard Tokyo Station previously. The rooms still aren't large but I knew that upon arriving. The breakfast buffet was nothing mind-blowing however really good and everything my wife and I needed each morning. Being Platinum at Marriott it was free every morning as well. The Bar in B1 was also very Japanese, relatively quiet and all of the service staff were so kind. We hung out here many of nights just to relax and talk. We couldn't get wi-fi in the bar so it forced my wife and I to talk to one another which was very enjoyable.Outside of the hotel, the location was perfect!! It's a short cab ride, or reasonable walk, to Roppongi, short walk to Tokyo Station, the Emperor's Palace and a short cab ride to Shibuya (which was our favorite part of this trip). Anything you want to do is within walking distance! It's also a short walk to the Tsukiji Fish Market (if you are willing to wake up earlier enough, 3am, to witness the huge fish auction).Overall, when we go back to Tokyo, we will stay at this hotel again for sure.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My husband and I stayed for six nights--the room, service, gracious hospitality, and meals were excellent, and the hotel is very convenient to the subway, taxi, shuttles, restaurants, ATM, banks, and shops in Ginza area. We would definitely stay there again.
user_name:
Leinui
Mililani Town, Hawaii, United States

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My friend and I recently traveled to Tokyo with our sons and stayed in the Ginza neighborhood. We could not have been more pleased with our stay at the Courtyard Ginza hotel! First of all, if you take the airport limousine bus from Narita, the courtyard is the final stop on the route, so we were literally dropped at the front door of the hotel! How is that for convenience after a 13 hour flight?! We were greeted by hotel staff outside and they accompanied us to the check in desk. A lady named May checked us in and she was ever so helpful and sweet! We had many questions about tourist destinations and the hotel itself and she was a wealth of information and made us feel like we were the only guests staying there. She offered our two young boys a treat of pop and they got to pick out a snack! how nice! Being a Marriott rewards member, we received 2 free drink coupons and free hot buffet breakfast for our entire stay- this was amazing!! This is a serious perk and I was pleasantly surprised to receive it! The rooms were clean and comfortable with mini bars and kimonos! The hotel is in the Ginza district with high end shopping; just a few blocks away was a street of nothing but quaint restaurants, so dining options were abundant. Everyone at the hotel was helpful and ever so accommodating. They made us feel very welcome. We received a call from our airline that our return flight was cancelled and we had to cut our trip short. the hotel allowed us to cancel our last night and also to take a quick shower and pack in our rooms even though technically, we had extended past check-out time. that was gracious and very helpful as we now had to dash to the airport to make the flight on which they rebooked us. The location is only a few blocks from the Tsujiki Fish market as well. this world famous market is leaving its location as of November 2016, so you must visit! ARIGATO to everyone at the courtyard Ginza hotel...we would stay here again no questions asked if ever back in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I had a amazing time at this hotel, I was so impressed with everything. The customer service was 5.0! I ended up with a nice size room on the top floor. Everything was super clean. The hotel had a nice restaurant and bar on the first floor as well as a breakfast area. The breakfast was buffet style with eggs to order. So good!The hotel is located in an excellent area. There are a lot of restaurants and bars in the blocks surrounding the area. If you like shopping, this area is like 5th ave., all the high end stores. You are also only a few blocks from the train station, so you can easily travel all over Tokyo if you choose. I would love to stay here again!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: First and foremost, one needs to rest, function/be productive in the room. Unfortunately this property over represented the room. Very small (ok, that's fine), BUT the desk and chair were really, basically, like a small narrow shelf and a kids wooden chair from Ikea. The over chair is not a chair but a small chase. No table (at all) more of a folder size slider that goes over the chase. Bottom line: ok for sleeping but not for working. Yes, you can get Marriott points but a big price to pay at this location. p.s.: Surfaced issues to management who could not grasp the problem and simply sent another (horrid) chair to the room. Resv released and found another place. The point is all this was confirmed ahead of time to avoid issues. BTW - pretty far from the subway compared to representation.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Checked in this hotel for a business trip. Really great location right in the center of Ginza. Near to all things you need restaurant, shopping malls, and offices. My room was quite small but clean and comfortable. The staff are great and helpful
user_name:
Louie antonio L
Lapu Lapu, Philippines

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: In the middle of the shopping area of Ginza and 3 minutes walk from Tokyo station.Nice and friendly staff.Very confortable rooms.For sure the best value for money place to stay in the most expensive area of Tokyo

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed here for 9 days in December and really enjoyed my stay. The staff was always super helpful and went above and beyond to accomodate my requests.The breakfast buffet provided plenty of options both Japanese and Western. The chef available to offer fresh omelets and eggs is a great option.The rooms are fairly roomy for Tokyo and provide all necessary amenities.It is conveniently located 5 minutes walk from Ginza, offering Tokyo's best shopping.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This was our first trip to Japan and we were not disappointed! The hotel was clean and the amenities in Japanese style were a nice surprise. Our smaller room was equipped with a rice steamer (standard here) and a stocked mini fridge. The bath also supplied most personal products one could need, as well as robes and slippers.We were slightly disappointed in the air system in that we couldn't cool the room so we left our window open for the duration of our stay.We chose not to eat any meals at the hotel as they offered a New Years buffet that was rather pricey so we opted to venture out and explore the local eateries.We felt very safe and comfortable walking the area shopping at night. We also used the nearby subway to do some sightseeing in other prefectures. While Tokyo and Japan are densly populated, we never felt any anxiety with mass people, even on the subway. The transit system is very well run and the airports and transportation stations have staff that speak English and are happy to assist.We also arranged for a day tour to include Mt Fuji and the bus picked us up at the front of our hotel.We loved our trip and will return!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great place to be. Excellent staff and service, a big thank you for a job well done. Location is just perfect, the area is not busy and it's really close to train stations and shopping. Room was clean and comfortable for 2 persons.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This was one of half a dozen hotels I stayed at during a recent business trip to Japan, and it definitely had the best buffet breakfast! Beautifully laid out, with many options for both Asian and Western palates. The hotel itself was also good quality, with the standard of service that is so delightfully common in Japan. It had the nicest, softest cotton bathrobes of any of the hotels I stayed at. I actually purchased one before I left. While was not quite as modern or as efficiently laid out as the Marriott near Tokyo Station, I enjoyed my stay... especially with that breakfast!!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My husband always stays at this hotel when he comes to Tokyo a couple of times a year, and this was my third time here, but I was astounded at the amazing warm greeting when we walked in the door to register. All the ladies behind the desk gave us huge smiles and big greetings as we walked to the desk...such a lovely welcome back! Yui Yamashita, Lin, May Mon, and Ami Suzuki at the front desk and Ricardo at the concierge desk were all so wonderful and helpful all week while we were there. They even gave us an upgrade to their premier floor with larger rooms with both bathtub and separate shower.The breakfast buffet (which is included in our stay because my husband is a platinum Marriott member) is wonderful, with both Japanese and Western foods. Another benefit is a glass of wine for both of us every night of our stay. And wifi is included as well with our membership. The hotel is wonderfully located, a few blocks away from the Ginza shopping area, and also close to the metro, which is a great public transportation. Just buy a Pasmo card and you're on your way. And if it's raining, the hotel will even lend you an umbrella. This is the best place to stay in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I have stayed at the Courtyard 4 times over the past year now and have had no issues. Used exclusively for business travel with no complaints. Appreciate the location for walking distance to Ginza nightlife and easy taxi to office and early morning fish market visits.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Amenities are very basic, but it's a good value considering the prime location in the heart of Ginza.Service is good, and the breakfast is a good selection and the staff at the egg station really know what they are doing. Pastry and bread choices were also excellent.Lots of foreigners staying here. I'd say overall its a good choice for a business hotel in the area.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed 5 nights here and I found the place to be convenient as a base and for walking around Ginza.Room was comfortable and there was water supplied daily. Good internet connection (free only if you are a Marriott member - should be free for all). Breakfast was above average with a good selection of western and Japanese options.There is travel or concierge info desk in the lobby with very helpful printed guides of popular places to visit. This is a great resource.The only downer here happened when I misplaced my room card and requested for another one. The man attending to the front desk replied to look for it again as they are very expensive...and didn't provide another one! My same request to another person a few days later was granted without such comments. Major SERVICE FAIL in this aspect for the first man as we also paid to stay at rates that are surely higher compared to a missing keycard.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel is not only easily accessible by Haneda and Narita Airport limousine shuttles (direct access) but also right in the middle of the upscale shopping Ginza area. Breakfast has enough choices and can be considered as decent. Everything else is just ok. This is a great stop for people who travel with family and would like to merge into the Japanese huzzle buzzle. They have interconnecting rooms but need to be requested earlier. I was not able ot book this hotel any earlier than 1 week right before my arrival date. Maybe they got booked by travel agency. One thing, however, I found is that this hotel did not seem to be familiar to taxi drivers. Every time we wanted to take taxi back to this hotel, we always had a hard time to explain to the driver where this hotel is. The driver basically needed the exact address and telephone number of this hotel so that they could input the details to their GPS. Even so, they still had problem to exactly identify the location of the hotel. We always got dropped off at near by place and used our own sight to identify the direction back to the hotel. Not a big deal. But just that this hotel does not seem to be famous somehow. Maybe the hotel changed name recently.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We (2 adults and 1 kid) came back for a night's stay in Dec 2015. We took out 1 double and 1 single room as the hotel said it ran out of roller beds. We were on 9th floor this time so we are above the "wall" which is good. But the single room 903 was directly above the air-conditioning vents. For those who need absolute peace and quiet at night, the 03 rooms should be avoided at all cost! Beside this minor problem, the Courtyard is a great hotel. The service is crisp and efficient. Free WIFI. The rooms, although really not big, are clean and well stocked. The hotel's location, being only 30 minutes from the Tokyo station and Haneda airportis, is unbeatable if one wants to stay close to the Ginza area to do shopping or to explore the hundreds of small restaurants nearby! A family mart is located within minutes and an Open 24 hours Denny is right opposite to the hotel. To top it all, the airport limousine bus stops in front of the hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel is in a very high end area surrounded by shopping centers. The rooms are spacious for Tokio but I've been in cheaper hotels but with more amenities. Keep looking, you can find a better deal in the same area. The food at its restaurants is ok. The service is great.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: What a pleasant surprise this was. Both my husband and I agree that this was the best Courtyard hotel we've ever stayed in. If you are familiar with the chain in the US market, you will be pleased with the difference in this offering - definitely an upgrade.First, it has a great location. The subway is a short walk. Tsukiji Fish Market is about a 10 min walk as well. The main upscale shopping street is approximately 10 min walk too.Second, the staff was excellent. The front desk was so helpful. The concierge helped tremendously. All with flawless english by the way.Third, the room was comfortable. I was a bit concerned as I've read of the normally tiny rooms in Tokyo. This wasn't our experience. Plenty of room for two and our luggage, etc. My husband, who is fairly picky, deemed the bed quite comfortable. If you knew him, you'd understand this is high praise indeed. Pillows were great, no smell of smoke anywhere, bathroom and shower with great shower head, etc. Also - great, free wifi!I wish we were able to stay for longer than the one night we did!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: While working at my desk a cockroach crawled across my desk. It shocked me I just kind of stared at it and didn't catch it in time to kill it. I made the mistake of reporting it to the front desk and on my return there were people in my room wearing masks spraying bug spray. They were nice enough to have sprayed my suitcase and clothes. Really. Since the guy was wearing a mask I asked if the stuff was safe. He said very then quickly exited the room. I hope it is because I got to inhale it for awhile.They offered another room but I sent out laundry etc and needed to do some comp work and didn't want to wait for an hour in the lobby while they "got it ready". Or sprayed it w bug spray. Rooms are tiny, stuffy poor heat and Ac. I only stay here for the location and it's not worth it any more. Place is tired and there are many other options. I used to try and exclusively stay at marriotts for the reward program but that program has gone so far down hill along with their customer service that it's not worth it.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
