review_body: The Courtyard Ginza is not where our company normally books vistors in Tokyo but given that our usual hotel was fully booked the week I was in Tokyo, I chose the Courtyard for its location.While the hotel is not luxurious, it's pretty good for business trips. The staff are nice and friendly, the room is clean and big (I asked for the queen bed), the bed and pillows are comfortable, and the location is very central. It's only a 5-minute walk to Ginza station.I think this hotel is good value and can probably work for holiday trips as well.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Checked in late, but everything was well prepared. Staff was very helpful and friendly staff. Breakfast was good. Location is good, not so far from metro lines. I got an upgrade so the room was comfortable. Very easy to reach from Haneda airport, without transferring metro lines.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Would have preferred a Marriott to a Courtyard but there isn't one in Ginza. Nonetheless I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms are nice but some are heading towards an appointment with the renovators.Staff very nice indeed.Lobby cafe/bar has a nice buzz.It's also easy to get to from both Narita and Haneda by either Tokyo Limousine Busor the subway.I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My wife and I spent 4 night at this property kicking off our honeymoon. We wanted to stay at a Marriott property and in Ginza neighborhood, so the Courtyard was the obvious choice. We couldn't have been happier with our decision upon arrival. The hotel is new, clean and beautiful. The rooms were smaller compared to what I'd expect at a Courtyard in the US, but were tastefully put together with great views. The breakfast was fantastic everyday and good enough that I would happily have paid for it. I would recommend this property to anyone and hope to one day revisit this hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for a business trip recently. It was a more affordable option in the Ginza location. Well located near metro lines and trains. Convenient to Ginza shopping and restaurants. Hotel rooms were ok. Free wifi had some connectivity problems. Great breakfast buffet. free water in rooms. tiny bathrooms. mediocre toiletries. in room safe and iron/ironing board included. Bed was a bit firm. Bus to Narita conveniently stops right at the hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Am a little disappointed with the hotel, considering I've had many great stays at other Marriott locations before. I would generally be able to do an online check in via the Marriott mobile app but was unable to with this stay. But a quick email to their reservations and I was attended to (great service by Chikako Ema who was accommodative). Perhaps I've been spoiled with great services I have received so far from other Marriott locations but Courtyard Ginza doesn't seem to fit that picture of hospitality. I've been given a basic double bed and was told that I could change to a bigger room (only from a bed size perspective and not the space). I tried working at the narrow desk in the room and found the space too small to work. The wifi connection is the room was also weak. Maneuvering around the room can be a challenge for bigger sized people.But on the plus side, the hotel is well kept, clean and overall, comfortable. There is a metro subway nearby-about less than 5 mins walk and 2 JR train stations-about 10-15mins walk. If you are into high end shopping, there is a wide spread of boutiques (from LV to Rolex and the likes) around the Ginza street which is also walking distance away from the hotel.The breakfast buffet is decent but not that much choices.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I like the location of the hotel - a few minutes away from the main shopping street in Ginza and it's also 15 mins walk to Tsukiji market. Smooth and seamless check-in and out at the front desk attended by good English speaking staff. I was delighted when I could even charge the bus fares from hotel to airport to my room. Breakfast spread was quite good, well balanced between international and Japanese choice. I would definitely come back again for my next visit.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Location, location, location. What else? the service, restaurant are also good. The staff at reception is always helpful - multi language too. Never have problem there. It is close to shopping area - Ginza. Breakfast is excellent too....

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I agree with all the other positive reviews of this Courtyard Marriott - location, cleanliness, service, transportation all great but what makes it exceptional is that the rooms size is just like that of Marriott's you find in the United States - large and at a reasonable price point. An for a hotel located in the heart of Tokyo/Ginza that my friends is exceptional. Advise: book early if you plan on staying at this hotel as it fills up fast.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The room is very small but its location is great it is very close to Ginza and Fish market you can walk it.Friendly staff, nice breakfast and dinner buffet.The location is very convenient, close to everything. Staff are very nice. The shuttle bus to airport is very convenient and it cost the same as taking the train.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I found everything about this hotel right for me – rooms are nice, spacious (very spacious by Tokyo standards) and equipped with just about everything you need. Filter coffee, iron, ironing board, hot water jug, fridge, hair dryer, free wifi – everything. There was also clear instructions on how to use just about everything – so you never have to call down to the reception on how to access the Internet or anything. If you need a print out – I needed a 5 page document printed out – you only have to email it to them and they will have it done pronto! Breakfast is a wide range – western and Japanese. A Variety of cheeses, salads, pickles. Only small inconvenience is that around 8.30 a.m. the restaurant is quite full and you have to, at times wait to be seated. So if you are in a rush it can be a bit trying. Location could not be better – Ginza shops just a 5 minute walks; the Hibiya line just 2 minutes; plenty of restaurants serving a wide variety of food to fit every palate and every purse!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is an awesome hotel in an amazing location. The Courtyard by Marriott Ginza is a great place to stay if you want to go shopping and enjoy local food and culture. The rooms are large and you get a free beer on checkin. This is a great place for westerners as the staff speaks English.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel is in one of the nicest areas of Tokyo. It's in downtown. There are many cafes and restaurants and stores around. Cabs were always easily available to take us around. The hotel is clean and quiet. The room was spacious. The breakfast (not included) was very good. It's a buffet with Japanese and Western breakfasts.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Our family stayed four nights at the Courtyard Ginza-Tokyo, and were impressed with the generous room size including comfortable queen beds, nicely appointed bathrooms, and quiet location. The buffet breakfast is fantastic with a large selection of Japanese and Western choices all family members loved. The lounge-bar was a great meeting place after a long day. All of the Marriott staff went above and beyond to assist with our questions, and were extremely friendly. Each employee we talked to had a good command of English, which made our stay very easy.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Staff service was impeccable, hotel was very clean and well looked after, in a nice part of town.Breakfast buffet was good with a host of eastern and western food options.Would recommend to any business travellers looking to stay somewhere in Tokyo.View was pretty crap from the room as looked out onto a service courtyard, but that's about it for criticism.Pretty much exactly what you want for a business trip.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Unless you want to be in the heart of the shopping district, the location is not so convenient without taking train or taxi to the more lively social neighborhoods. easily connected by train system and walking distance to all shopping.Fairly decent hotel, service was average. food was average

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We had a nice and comfortable stay at Courtyard by Marriott. Great location in Ginza as it was near the subway station, malls, restaurants and boutiques. It was also a few minutes walk away from Tsukiji market where we enjoyed eating! The staff were all so polite and quite helpful. They even helped us go to our desired destinations by teaching us where to go using the map and recommend where to eat good ramen. Would definitely stay here again when we go back to Tokyo. :)

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I was staying in this hotel in September. It has been the place of my choice for the past few years for all of business trips to Japan. The location happens to be near to my office, besides it is right on Ginza where shopping and eating would be of no problem. This hotel is easily reached from exit A3 from the Ginza Station (Tokyo Metro). Around the hotel area there are many interesting spots, including my favourite Kyushu Jangara ramen stall (5 minutes walk), Uniqlo flagship store (10 minutes walk), Yamaha Building (10 minutes walk), Wako Clock Tower. Venture further to Yurakucho area (around 15 minutes walk) you can find Tokyu Hands and Muji. Tsukiji is a short ride of metro from Ginza, or even walking. Tried the hotel's gym this time. It is equipped with some weights and couple of hi-tech treadmills. It is not big however it is adequate for a quick workout to start the day. Remember to book for your Airport Limousine with the hotel desk, it can be charged straight to your room to make it easy for your business expense claim. This time, tried the lounge in the ground floor of the hotel, they serve fruit juices, some tea, wine and cheese and many more. The lounge closes at 10PM though, so watch your time. There is humidity control in your room, still if you feel the air is too dry, ask for a humidifier (Ka Shi Tsu Ki) from the hotel. Note that the humidifier here is a hot type, with boiling water, not the ionizer type. Another good stay in Courtyard Marriott Tokyo Ginza, always consistent with the service.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Visited the hotel as tourists. Excellent staff, most helpful and attentive. Clean rooms, good beds, both Japanese and European Breakfast.Close to the subway and near to both high end shopping and the fish market.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: It is in a great location- close to higashi ginza and ginza stations. When I checked in the first night, they gave me a smoking room which I have actually requested non-smoking. They won‘t be able to change as the hotel was fully booked. That was quite disappointing as i made the reservation 6 months beforehand. But they made effort to move me to a non-smoking room the next day. The room is spacious and clean, a Marriott Courtyard standard. Definitely one to stay for the next trip.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We were here for 5 nights in October 2015. Very comfortable good sized rooms, friendly and helpful staff who were always pleased to help. Enormous choice at breakfast, Western and Asian, all fresh. Hotel sited close to Ginza and several underground stations making moving around easy. Various restaurants and convenience stores nearby, enormous Fish market 10 minute walk, Ginza shops 5 minutes. Get the monorail to the Hot Baths Ooedo-Onsen-Monogatari, 2 minute walk from Telecom monorail station. Soooooo relaxing after a hard day travelling or shopping. Will go back to hotel next stay in Tokyo

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Even thou I regularly use the Courtyard chain in USA, this was far better. Care into the details, stuff very helpful, great breakfast buffet. And the location is very comfortable if you want to do some shopping, just a couple of block and you are on the main road.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Visited this hotel during a break in a Japanese business trip. The rooms are quite small but that is Japan anyway. The hotel is situated a few hundred metres from Ginza Street where most of the world's top designer stores can be found and also two metro stations. It formed a great location for touring Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and the service was exceptional, location was perfect, and breakfast was good. The staff met our every need. The only complaint I had was that the beds were very hard. I am somewhat used to this as I travel around Asia frequently, but I expected a more comfortable bed from a Marriott hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Loved the location - close to Ginza shopping area, Higashi-Ginza metro stop right around the corner, near the Tsuikiji Fish Market and at a reasonable rate - there was nothing really to fault about my stay. Sure the rooms are small and there are hardly any english tv channels, but the level of customer service is unrivalled. Usually when I book through those hotel booking sites - the level of customer service drops or is pretty much non-existent, but they really went above and beyond. From my first email inquiry to my extremely early check in and check out, the staff understood my requests and provided me with options, helping me with transportation and explaining my strange request to be dropped off at arrivals instead of departure. I will definitely return and stay here again and highly recommend.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: If you are looking for a great hotel, with a fabulous location and excellent customer service - this is the place for you. Easy walk to the famous Tsuikiji Fish Market, easy walk to the Kabuki Theatre and so much shopping. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and knew exactly where to send us when we were looking for places to see and things to do. English speaking staff were prevalent and they even helped me book tickets to the Kabuki theatre months before I arrived. VERY comfortable beds--that's important :) We highly recommend the Ginza Marriott Courtyard. You won't be disappointed.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This was my "last night in Japan" hotel because I thought it would be close to shopping. It is close to shopping but not the kind I was looking for. Ginza is mostly high end jewelry, cosmetics, accessories just like Paris, New York, or London. I was looking for more indigenous Japanese goods: enamel ware, tea sets, wood block prints. I was able to find some of these but, even with the concierge's help, it was difficult and what I wanted I found not too far away by metro. The hotel checked me in at 3:30 PM and my room was small but perfectly adequate. The A/C was good, the amenities OK, the light and noise factors were very good, and the in room internet (free for Marriott Rewards members) was excellent-in fact better than access in the lobby. There's a Keurig machine with lots of pods, tea, a refrigerator/minibar, and 6 pillows on the bed(!) The concierge spoke perfect English with an LA twang, and he helped a great deal when I tried to decipher the ingredients of a cold remedy I bought at the local pharmacy. Strangely enough, the cold remedy containing hydrocodeine and ephedrine is OTC, but the innocuous albuterol inhaler that I wanted requires a prescription (like the US). I had wanted to stay as late as possible since my flight was a midnight but 3 PM was the limit. 5 PM would have cost me 1500 Yen and any time after 5, a staggering whole night's rent. The lobby is comfortable and there are 5-6 times a day buses to Narita and Haneda direct from the hotel for 1400 Yen and 950 Yen, respectively. The hotel has a great idea in utilizing a map with commercial landmarks. I got lost anyway since I couldn't find many of the stores on the map. Japan is a very easy place to get lost. I wouldn't stay in Ginza again as other areas are more interesting to me. BTW, beware of Marriott's "Best Rate Guarantee." I found room on Apoda.com for half the cheapest rate on Marriott's website and another for about 2/3 Marriott's rate on Expedia.com. Marriott declined to honor their guarantee in both cases citing I had used a "voucher-type" system in a "non-US hotel" for my first claim and that I had "used more than one hotel in my comparison" as the basis for denying my other claim. I really didn't understand either reason for denial. When I wrote to customer service, I received the consummate corporate gobbledygook that essential said they had reasons and should any of them apply, then tough luck.It seems that if Marriott has a "best rate guarantee," that should mean that the best rate possible is obtained on their website. Maybe they call it the "best rate sometimes guarantee." The hotel, apparently, didn't hold my claims against me, and in fact, the free buffet breakfast was exceptional.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great hotel in an excellent location right near the Ginza shopping area and walking distance to the Tsukiji Fish Market. The best way to get here is by the airport shuttle bus. This is one of the best places to stay if you would like to make it to the Tsukiji Fish Market for the tuna auction at 4 am or line up for sushi breakfast starting at 3 am. Many interesting spots in the area. Busy but not congested. Just walk around especially at night. The room and amenities are standard. The room needs updates. Like anything in Japan, the rooms and bathrooms are small. The breakfast is good but nothing special.
user_name:
NewYorkWorldExplorer
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We booked the Marriott Courtyard Ginza at the recommendation of family and weren't disappointed. The hotels location was really good, staff were attentive and our room very comfortable. The complimentary water was a nice touch.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I booked my room last minute and chose Courtyard Ginza for it's great location. There are two subway lines at Higashi Ginza station with connections to both Haneda and Narita airports. When traveling to/from Haneda, take Keikyu line to station A7 in Asakusa line, switch to Asakusa line just by crossing the platform. The fare is 570 yen and takes less than 40 min depending if you've taken express or local. At Higashi Ginza station take exit A1 and walk about 150m to reach the hotel.The hotel is also serviced by airport limousine buses, which is convenient if you have lots of luggage. Just try to avoid rush hours if taking the bus.Rooms are very typical Japanese standard, clean and convenient. Internet connection was ok and breakfast excellent with lots of variety. Overall a great place!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for five nights and had a pleasant stay. As a Gold member, we had the free breakfast buffet each morning, and the food was good (though the selection was the same ones each day). The restaurant staff was very polite and helpful. The Bell Desk provided umbrella service for the days we were there as well as booked airport limousine for us. We didn't know we only had e allowance of 2 suitcases for the limousine ride, but they were able to negotiate with the service and let us brought five baggage son. overall the hotel was great , and I wish their shampoo/conditioner/lotion sets Cana be better.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We (2 adults and 1 child slept on an extra bed) stayed in the Courtyard at the end of July for a night. The hotel is very centrally located within Ginza within walking distance to the nearest subway station. The airport shuttle bus also stops in front of the hotel. There is a 24-hour convenient store just around the corner and Denny's is just opposite the street. The room was clean and WIFI is free if you join the Marriott membership. The only blemish of this hotel is that the lower floors have zero view. Our room looked out to a wall.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: It's a good hotel...the staff are great. Rooms are small but that's standard in Japan. I would definitely recommend this hotel. A 4-star Marriott property. Near Tokyo Station, which is the major transportation hub.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Tokyo can be a rather expensive city to find accommodations in especially at the last minute like we did. Although not cheap, the price we paid was very competitive to other hotels in this area and hotel class. We chose to stay at the Courtyard in Ginza because Marriott owned properties usually come with a standard set of amenities that you can depend on - this Courtyard has all that, plus great staff and location! Rooms are larger than your average Japanese hotel room, immaculately clean, and bright. Front desk was very friendly and accommodating, and all the other staff members we encountered always said hello. We did not eat at the hotel; however, we did stop by the lobby area for a quick drink and found the lounge area very pleasant - very business traveler friendly as well! This hotel is located near two different stations and provides easy access to shopping, as well as other neighborhoods in Tokyo. Very happy with our choice to stay here and will most likely stay here again!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The courtyard Marriott Ginza is a great hotel. Centrally located and easy to get to from Narita airport. They have a shuttle bus that drops you off in front of hotel for a reasonable price of 3100 yen. A cab is 25000 yen. Big difference. The staff is very courteous and friendly and also speaks English so can communicate. Rooms are clean and spacious. We enjoyed our stay here at the Courtyard Marriott Ginza. Highly recommended. WillCome back here if in Japan again. Mac T

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Staff member at front desk during late check in was superb. He genuinely cared and noticed I was very tired from travelling. Check in was a breeze, thank you!! I am sorry I did not get his name but he really made my stay memorable.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: In the heart of the Ginza, this hotel is a great location for business, sightseeing, shopping and eating. This is a typical modern Marriott hotel with a Japanese flare. It's much better than other Marriott properties we've stay at in other countries. Staff are excellent & bend over backwards to help you. We just came from staying at a Ryokan in Kyoto which was great but we needed a little more modern accommodations and this hit the spot!We took the JR train from Kyoto to Tokyo. Got off one stop short at Shinjuku but about the same distance to the hotel as the last Tokyo stop. Taxi to hotel about $20. Note about cab drivers in Japan: they do not speak English & they are not familiar with the city. Hand them an address (or street sign photo) in Japanese if you want a better chance of finding a location.Stayed 2 nights before catching a cruise around Hokkaido. Hotel is modern, clean & centrally located. Amenities & toiletries are numerous. Loved the Yukata, slippers, shavers, toothbrushes, shampoos, conditioner & bath soaps. We received a free upgrade so our room had a tub with a jacuzzi too. Of course I have to mention the Toto toilets that are famous in Japan. It's a combination bidet, washer & bottom refresher. Once you use them you never want to go back to your old toilets at home! Pay for the breakfast buffet…it's worth the money & saves you from hunting for a restaurant in the rain or rush hour. The buffet has both Western & Japanese food that are very good.King sized bed is very comfortable. Our room was very large with a sofa and desk. Internet service was very good too.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We are really enjoyed stay in that hotel. Excellent service, friendly staff, convenient location. The service people try to make evrything possible they have been asked for, even if it was no standard requests. Good breakfast.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The professional team that was behnd the scenes maintaining the fresh, sanitary, refreshing and welcoming atmosphere desreve the same credit for creating our memorable experience as those with whom we had the pleasure to directly experience warm Japanese hospitality. Complimentary bottled water and free in room wifi (as a rewards member).Bathroom amenities.One touch lighting controls at the bedside.Convenient to the nightlife of Ginza district.Onsite breakfast buffet.Room key to activate elevator for your floor only was a nice safety feature.Ceiling speakers at elevator chirped calming bird sounds.Onsite concierge to map out great ideas and directions.Recommended Tokyo Skytree (open for just 3 years). We were able to pre-purchase vouchers (Skytree Fast Ticket) at the front desk which eliminated the hour long line at the structure.Valet team secured our luggage and confirmed door to door motor coach shuttle to HND airport.Every one we met appeared to be there for one purpose: To ensure our memorable experience.
user_name:
J B
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I have stayed at this Courtyard a number of times. It is incredibly easy to get to from Narita Airport. It has its own stop on the Ginza Area Limousine Bus line. The desk staff is friendly and efficient with excellent English skills. The rooms on the 11th floor makes you think you are staying at a higher end property than a Courtyard by Marriott. The breakfast buffet has a good variety and being in Ginza there are many other dining opportunities. I understand there is another Courtyard near Ginza Station, but for now, this one will continue to be my first choice.
user_name:
DKNGT
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Location is excellent - a few minutes from the subway, 10 minutes from the Ginza shopping district and 15 minutes from the Tsukiji fish market. The room itself was full of tiny details to help maximize space and add convenience - very Japanese. The concierge was very helpful - booked a restaurant and the airport bus service. One of my best hotel experiences.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel is in a good location in Ginza and is exactly what you would expect from a Courtyard. It is a short walk to the subway. The staff was friendly and helpful. Spoke very good English. The "NY Grill" restaurant was terrible though - food was poor quality and served cold. Definitely don't recommend this as a place to eat. I did not eat in the downstairs Japanese restaurant.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great location for a Ginza visit in Tokyo. Staff is very helpful and service is just right. Buffet breakfast is good. And wifi works in room and lobby. Parking is a bit tricky, we had to ride around block to park in hotel basement. Hotel is close to metro station and the bus from airport stops directly in front of hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Our room was cramped and the shower leaked, the concierges barely spoke English and taxis had no idea where it was. But this hotel is a simple 15-minute walk from the Tsukiji Fish Market so getting to the early morning tuna auction was a breeze. If you're not interested in that, stay somewhere else.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel is right in the heart of the Ginza district. It is a block away from a subway station, so you can get anywhere you need to go in Tokyo in short order. Even though it is a Courtyard, you still feel like you are staying in a Japanese hotel. The rooms are smaller than a US Courtyard, but they were still quite comfortable. The breakfast buffet was much nicer than anything you will get at a US Courtyard, and the fitness center was surprisingly nice. One thing was found very helpful were the one page tourist tips they had printed up on about 10 of the major things to see in Tokyo. It included very detailed instructions on how to there, even how much to pay for your subway ticket and then lots of helpful tips on what to do when you get there.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Pros: Friendly and attentive staff, clean place, good restaurants, quiet room, location. Kudos to Mr. Yasunori Kitajima F&B Manager and his staff (you are doing a great job), and the people who always clean our room (unknown heroes).Cons: People smoke in the basement/parking area and it permeates in the guest elevator, you need to purchase the wifi if you are in your room (but there's a free wifi in the business lounge).The location is in Ginza (Japan's Beverly Hills), all tourist destination is just one train ride away (some might need a transfer) and the Fish Market is walking distance, There's a shuttle that pick you up from Narita Airport and drops you in the hotel, plus Denny's restaurant is in the other side of the street.I will be back.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I checked in here as my second hotel in Tokyo the first being the Millenium Mitsui, which whilst has a higher star rating than the courtyard, service and facilities do not come close.The location of this hotel in central Ginza is a great base to explore Tokyo from, 5 min in a cab to Tokyo central station and 2 min walk to the great shops in Ginza.I arrived early and so my room was not ready, the team at reception offered to hold my luggage. Quite hot outside so I decided to have a drink in the lobby bar near the entrance of the hotel, whilst I was actually waiting for my drink the reception team came over and told me my room was ready and they would escort me and my bag to the room. Now despite being a non smoking room, my room was a bit ciggie smelly ... but not overpowering, and I did find that the aircon struggled (a fan was brought up pronto) other than that the service cannot be faulted. A fully stocked mini bar, great breakfast buffet to fuel you for the day, multiple resturaunts onsite with rooms service. Everytime I rang down I was greeted in English by everyone. The little things matter ... I loved when I was checking out the gentleman asked me where I was going in general conversation and I said Tokyo central for Kyoto. When I then asked at the end could he arrange a cab for me to get there, he said, already done, waiting out front.The hotel is older than a few and a little dated, but the facilities, the warmth of the people that work here and the exceptional exceptional exceptional service make this a wonderful choice for tokyo

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for 3 night. Thought it was a 4 Star quality hotel and far far better than any of the dozens of Courtyards I have stayed at in the last year in the U.S. Perfect location to do our foodie tour of Tokyo. It is next door to the fish market and close to multiple train and subway stations so it was easy to travel all over Tokyo in search of the next great food experience. The breakfast buffet was excellent as was the helpful service. Everyone spoke enough English to understand our questions and requests.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My husband and I booked a room at courtyard at Marriott at ginza as a last minute booking. The hotel location is really fantastic. It is right next to the happening places around the Ginza area and walking distance from the Tsujiki fish market.The room was nice and comfortable and kept extremely clean.The staff were good and polite, although I think as an English speaking tourist they could not help me much with the directions around the city.The only negative I found was that in today's day and age where most of the hotels give complimentary internet ,Marriott charges you for it, unless you are a Marriott rewards member. I would recommend staying in this hotel for the location but not for the money.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The location is fantastic. Its just round the corner from the main Ginza street with all the vast departmental stores and a stone's throw away from Tsukiji fish market. also not far away from the Higashi-ginza subway. The staff could not have made me feel more welcome. Room is a decent size for Tokyo and comfortable with the usual amenities of a big chain hotel. Our room didn't have much of a view - request a higher floor room.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: In the largest city in the world you find this safe and VERY friendly hotel. Ginza (I found out) was the "Beverly Hills" of Tokyo. With high end shopping and great food this is close to everything and with its central location you an Uber to anything else you want to see or do. This hotel is clean and very well kept and offers a low price ride to the Nirita airport. The staff can speak good English and is very helpful and they seem to always have a smile. Great place to stay whilst in Tokyo or business or vacation!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My week-long stay at this well-positioned Marriott Courtyard in the Ginza shopping district, started on Jun 17 (past mid-night). As we checked in we were met with enthusiasm and a sincere welcome even that late in the evening. Check-in was quick and thorough (drink and breakfast vouchers for platinum members, wi-fi etc..)We had requested an upgrade and a bigger room - both were not available due to the hotel being sold-out. We did get our bed type and a higher floor room as requested. The front desk staff was very apologetic and advised me to wait a day and then check out of my current room to check-in to an upgraded room as it would be available then. We checked back with the front desk in a couple od days and even though the guy who had checked us at mid-night was not at the desk - he had left our info with the front desk to ensure our upgrade request was honored - not having to tell our request-story again and having someone ready with a key was priceless!Another instance was the free vouchers for drinks we got since their concierge was closed. Service at a super busy bar – where a majority were paying customers and we were using drink vouchers was amazing, professional thanks to the super nice wait-staff. Breakfast buffet staff was excellent as well. It’s easy to label all of this and say – ‘it’s cultural, in Asia to get better hospitality at higher-end hotels than in EU/US’ but that’s not the case – the staff truly was trained well and knew that small things make a difference even for a business traveler and those of us who travel this frequently. We were truly sad to leave the hotel – mainly for the care we received from all staff members we came in contact with. We will definitely be coming back and have recommended this hotel to all my business associates traveling to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We had a fantastisc Three night stay at this hotel and has nothing to complain about. Near Ginza shopping, clean, ok "gym", great breakfast, quiet and so forth. Ginza is also a great place to start for a first timer in Tokyo

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Don't let the Courtyard branding fool you; the service and facility are US main-line Marriott level. Very good English skills at the front desk; very comfortable US-sized rooms. Appreciated them giving us two connecting rooms. Lots of restaurants, bars, and shopping within a 5 min walk.Skipped the buffet breakfast and walked 10-15 min to Tsukiji market and grazed through the stalls before finding a great sushi place for breakfast.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Booked 4 nights here in the Courtyard and the location is very ideal. Less than 10mins walk to Ginza main street and the Higashi Ginza station. They have a huge lobby and the rooms are bigger than the traditional hotel rooms in Japan. The bathroom, however, I found too small. Carrying the name Marriott, you can find a lot of Westerners staying at this hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Congratulation and appreciation to the reception team of dealing with the error in my reservation dates. The team was most courteous and attentive. Our stay was brilliant. Excellent Sushi restaurant and superb breakfast. Thank you - you are wonderful!The position is great and conveniently situated for the Metro. We toured Tokyo independently with success!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I have given reviews of the Ginza Courtyard Marriott and only do so again as they continue to amaze me with their service time after time. My last trip was a terrific example of this.Yes there was the usual friendly greetings, smiles, great breakfast, rooms very roomy for Tokyo etc. I hesitate to use the word ‘usual’ as great service takes lots of work, but this is the level I have come to expect from this particular hotel on all of my stays. The stand-out event happened my last day. I had a very late departure from Tokyo that evening and was allowed to have a late check out, but this still left me with several hours and much work to do before leaving for the airport. I was able to do much of this in the lobby without issue but I needed a quiet place with Wi-Fi for a group Skype. The business center is in the basement level but I found it did not have Wi-Fi access. I asked staff for any ideas and they immediately whisked me up to the main restaurant where there is a single private room I did not even know about. This in itself was of terrific help and would have sufficed but with a smile and an ‘I have a better idea’, staff then escorted me to an empty conference room upstairs, spent several minutes turning on the WI-FI router and I was told I could use it as long as I needed. No questions asked, no groans at my need, no charge. WOW. All of it done without hesitation, and full of smiles and friendly discussion. There are a few more business-priced hotels in Tokyo than a few years ago and some of them are also members of the Marriott Group and some even tend to be listed at a bit lower cost than the Courtyard Marriott Ginza. I will stay loyal to the Ginza though. I’m not easily impressed and over the years they never disappoint and always go the extra mile to please. My compliments (again) to the staff and leadership.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Perfect location for us. Free buffet breakfast for reward members. Spacious room. Would choose again. Central to everything. Easy walks. Located on all maps on street so early found no matter where we wandered

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel does not seem to have many Japanese tourists. Nevertheless it is a very good convenient hotel. The room size is good, with everything you need. The bed is very comfortable and there is ample storage space. Location is good, but perhaps not as close to Ginza metro station as you would like. The buffet breakfast is better than most with lots of fresh fruit which is unusual for Japan. Wi Fi is free if you join the loyalty scheme and is fast. Concierge offered some good suggestions for eating. The bus transfer to the airport didn't stop at other hotels on the way so was very fast and convenient. There was some construction in the area. It didn't bother but we left relatively early but you might like to check on it before booking. Other than that, highly recommended.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The staff is incredibly friendly and most speak English fluently. Place is clean, and rooms and beds are large by Tokyo standards. Location is in heart of Ginza, and within walking distance of upscale shopping, fine dining, and subway stops. Taxis are never more than a couple of minutes away. This is my home away from home in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: When we first arrived we rather thought this was not a good hotel for westerners. We were wrong!The standard of service is very high in this hotel. The rooms are quite spacious and scrupulously clean. The breakfasts are extensive and reasonably priced and the Restaurant Muraki serves authentic and very acceptable food at a good price.Tokyo is an expensive city to eat well in. We dined very well and with a bottle of wine for less than 15000y.The concierge service is second to none and reception are delightful and extremely helpful.The location is close to the Ginza and all in all this is a good Tokyo hotel. By joining the Marriott Club which is free we received free Wi-Fi which is very fast. We would stay there again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed there for 1 week for Tokyo Lifestyle Show. Good hotel at a good location. Plenty of restaurants and shopping within walking distance from hotel. They serve a good breakfast but the same menu every morning. Don't go there with JW Marriott expectation and you will enjoy your stay

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel is in a great location only a few blocks from the heart of Ginza. Lots of great eating options around. The hotel itself is in good condition with cozy rooms and helpful staff. We were very pleased with our stay. Close to subway stations, this is an excellent base to see Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel has again, lived up to the Marriott reputation of Service Excellence. The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the Ginza area but still away from the hustles and bustles of the busy shopping and restaurant strip in Tokyo. My wife and I stayed 5 nights and managed to explore the popular sights in Tokyo thanks to the convenience and efficiency of the Subway and Train services. There are 2 stations within a 10-15 mins walking distance i.e. Ginza and Shimbashi, which pretty much takes you anywhere in Tokyo and beyond. The hotel staff all speak good English and is ever ready to assist you whether it's to find a good restaurant, shopping or sightseeing. Kudos to all who made our stay a comfortable and enjoyable one. And wait! The hotel is just 10 mins away from the famous Tsukiji Market where you can witness the daily live auctions of the fresh catches of Salmon, Tuna, Sea Bream, Octopuss, etc. There are also numerous restaurants offering different gastronomical Japanese cuisines all in one place!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Never talked to concierge but all front desk staff was so helpful with directions and timing for local atractions. Everyone spoke excellent English so there was no stress about learning Japanese. Higashi-Ginza station was just around the block, tried it for the first time and had no problems. Everyone in Tokyo is so nice and helpful, I would highly recommend it for American tourists. Skytree (currently tallest building in the world) was run like clockwork,- fask track for foreign tourists - so much easier than Eiffel Tower!
user_name:
Gerri M
Austin, Texas, United States

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed here since the other hotels were sold out and I would say it's average. I found some of the people in the reception desk a bit grumpy ; some of them were good though. The rooms are OK - I found them small. The breakfast spread was average. The hotel doesn't have a concierge lounge ...:One of the great thing for this hotel was that the Ginza shopping district was nearby. The fish auction place is also close to the hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My stay at the Courtyard was nothing short of fantastic, and I will definitely be back in the future!1) The service staff here were amazing. Shout-out to Yui Kuwazono, who truly went above and beyond to answer my questions and address my concerns. She deserves a raise!2) Location location location. The hotel is a stone's throw away from the train stations and the shopping district .3) Comfortable bed & spacious room

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Aside from just being around the corner from the Ginza shopping street the hotel is a short walk from the famous Tsukiji market. I did not wake up early enough to watch the tuna auction at 5am but the hotel is so convenient for a morning trip.The hotel interior is nothing really special. Rooms are quite small and the toilet is basic. My family enjoyed the buffet breakfast that had a good mix of japanese and western offerings.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My family stayed here for our second trip to Japan. Location is great because it is only a 5 minute walk away from the shopping strips. There's lots of restaurants to choose from around the area. The Ginza Metro station isn't too far away either. The wifi was weird though because for some reason, only one gadget could connect at a time.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for 5 days in April 2015. Loved the location - very convenient and easy to get to from main transportation station. After full days in Tokyo, it was nice to come back to some place familiar. Breakfast in the morning and light snacks and drinks available late afternoon thru early evening. Beds, rooms, showers - all were superb. Fun walking around the Ginza area too. Staff was super accommodating, as well as the bar/restaurant and coffee shop staff. Thank you to all of them for making our stay even better. So happy we chose this Courtyard.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel is in a brilliant location. The staff are extremely courteous and the rooms are lovely and clean (although a bit on the small size by European standards). Best of all the prices are very realistic for Tokyo. Rarely for me, I slept like a log because the bed was so comfortable. Will definitely be returning.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights in April. I usually choose higher end properties when on business trips to Tokyo, but all other hotels were booked full.Fortunately, the Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza exceeded my expectations - there was nothing at all to dread :) Rooms were small but well maintained, service was solid, and the great Ginza location was an added bonus.That said, business travellers might think twice about staying here for more than a day or two. The rooms (including the bathroom) are on the small side, and has a shower/tub combo. The work desk is small and shallow. And the desk chair is stiff as a rock - you'd be hard pressed to have an extended work session in the room because of this.By Courtyard by Marriott standards, this is a high quality and high value property, with very little to complain about, especially given its location and value.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Location location location. This is the a hotel with a grat location, food, and shopping right at your door steps as well as the fish market. The rooms as a little small but large for Japanese standards. They are very clean and definetly is more than Worth staying at. When coming back to Tokyo I would definetly pick to stay here again. But down side is that there is no swimming pool at this location.
user_name:
Jessica C
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great location in the Ginza area. Friendly staff and quick check in at the front desk. Rooms are basic but roomy for Japan with comfortable beds. Breakfast was very good with a wide selection of asian to western style food. Many good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel as well for lunch or dinner. Interior rooms are quiet but without a view of the city. For the price this is a very good choice .

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Excellent location, service, and amenities! The services at this hotel were on par with a Full Service Marriott. The beds were comfortable, the employees were friendly and helpful, and the location can't be beat! Sign up for Marriott Rewards before your stay and get free internet!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Good location. It's alot better than your average courtyard hotels. Clean sheets but it needs some update. Resturant is not worth visiting. Decent breakfast for platinum members since it's free. Housekeeping is very slow.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We are a family with two small kids aged 4 and 5. We stayed for 4 nights. This is a very high standard Marriott Courtyard hotel. We had two double interconnected rooms. Our experience was very positive. Hotel is perfectly located – walking distance to the main shopping street of Ginza and also the Tsukiji fish market.The concierge ( a lady whose name I don’t remember) was exceptional and helped organize our various sight seeing excursions. I’ve not met a concierge as helpful and precise as she was anywhere in the world.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Food wasn't good but in terms of accommodation, it was comfortable, spacious and well located! The hotel is located very near to the theatre if you are interested in watching Kabuki performances and many great eateries around the area.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: excellent location in Ginza, convenient for exploring Tokyo. Easy access from Tokyo station, JR lines and metro. When booking for four people, We got two nice connected twin rooms for a good price. While it may not have the ultimate details for a 5 stars, it's indeed a very good hotel with an excellent location at a good price. Room size is quite reasonable for Tokyo standards though the bath is relatively small. Didn't take Breakfast since is not cheap and there are a number of options out. Would recommend it as a base to explore Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Typical Courtyard hotel. There is no exec lounge but they do give you drinks tokens for the bar on level 1. Breakfast is very good. Plenty of choice from Japanese to Western. Service is exceptional (but normal for Japan). Rooms are large and spacious and very well equipped.Its in a great location for high-end shopping but not much else.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Recommended for short stays if location is important and budget allows. Comfortable western sized rooms, close to all the action in Ginza, Y1100 taxi ride to Tokyo station, good breakfast and dinner buffets. Unfortunately the requested twin bed room for our teenage boys was not provided so they shared a double bed. Wifi not very fast, especially byJapanese standards.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Yes, there are many more luxurious hotels in Tokyo, but all we needed were comfortable beds, a good breakfast, wifi and nice service at a reasonable price. The Marriott ticked all the boxes for us, and much more. It's essentially a business hotel, but was a great option for our family (with teens so we booked adjoining rooms). The concierge (Marina) was AMAZING, nothing too much trouble. Excellent location close to restaurants and shopping and 3 subway/rail stations within 3-10 minutes walk.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This was an unplanned short notice trip. We usually stay in shangri-la tokyo station but unfortunately everything was booked out, almost 90% of the 4-5star hotels are fully booked due to the cherry blossom season. I wasn't expecting much being courtyard and all but turned out to be a real pleasant surprise. This hotel is much better than expected. Excellent location. Smack in Ginza. 20mins walk to Tokyo station. 5 mins walk to Ginza metro. Close to all transportation. Friendly and english speaking staff. Decent size rooms (for japan standards) Nice furnishings. Great buffet spread, both eastern n western. Totally not what was expected of what courtyards are. Strongly recommended.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I recently spent 4 hectic days in Tokyo during Cherry Blossom time. I chose to stay at the courtyard by Marriott in Ginza. The hotel is walking distance to the heart of Ginza and has all the expected facilities what separates it from other hotels are the staff. The are friendly helpful and make the stay enjoyable. A surprise when I woke early and went for a walk to realise there was a very subtle background sounds of birds song it helped change my otherwise challenging business trip into a pleasant experience

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great location and easy access from air port with a direct shuttle buss .Ok breakfast ,Functional clean room ,No "wow" factor. great if on a simple business trip . Not luxury - Main stream,Well maintained friendly and safe . Good value for £ .

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I have been staying at Courtyard Tokyo Station for many stays because it was closer to Tokyo Station. Having just stayed at the Ginza property, I will forever change my stays in Tokyo! The staff was super attentive and friendly... from the front desk to the concierge to the lounge wait staff. They made it easy to catch busses and wire the transportation we needed for our stay. Breakfast was perfect to start the day. The rooms are large - the platinum premier upgrade we were give was an amazingly large room and bath with suite. It was clean and well catered for. The room was super quiet. Location here is key, we could walk everywhere, to easily catch the bullet train and metro trains. We will definitely stay here again whilst in Tokyo!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Do not let the "Courtyard" classification fool you. This hotel has the look and feel of a full Marriott. The décor is contemporary and trendy. The room (queen size) was spacious even for American standards. The hotel does not have an executive lounge but as a platinum member I received vouchers for the hotel restaurant. The breakfast spread was very generous and top notch quality. I used the gym a couple of times and unlike other hotel gyms where the mirrors enhance the size, this one had sufficient cardio and weight equipment. The only unusual aspect which seems to be common in several Japanese hotels is that they offer massage services between 8pm and 2am. As the title denotes, the hotel is walking distance from the metro stop and from the Ginza shops (Ginza is an area similar to New York's 5th avenue, the only difference is that Tokyo has at least 5 Manhattans). I booked this hotel because of its prime location but the experience was enhanced by all these other factors. A pleasant surprise

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed there for 5 nights in February and loved the room. The location was great, only 5 min to subway which can take you everywhere in Tokyo. The staffs are well trained and speaks english really well ( Not a lot of japanese speaks english) Special thanks to the concierge ( I don't remember her name) she helped us plan our whole trip in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Ginza is a great neighborhood im tokyo and this hotel has a good location. Close to subways and the main arwas of Ginza. Rooms are small, but clean and the service is good. Will definitely come back here.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Five days at the hotel really proved that we perhaps were in the best location in the city; the heart of Ginza - the shopping and entertainment district of Tokyo. The hotel was not only located near the best shops and eateries in town but was also a minute’s walking distance to the subway station making it convenient.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: To get to the Courtyard from Haneda Internatonal, just go to the Keikyu line inside the airport terminal building. For 570 yen and 20 minutes ride, get you to Higashi- Ginza station, where a less than 10 minutes walk gets you to the hotel. Check-in was fast and efficient. The extra bed is really a bed and not a cot. Room size for Japan is quite big. Of note is the concierge Marina who will go out of her way to help and recommend places to eat. She recommended a duck soup noodle place that is really outstanding and a Komodo Soba place where only local eats. Location wise, its near a lot of well know restaurants and walking distance to Tsukiji- where one gets the freshest 3 piece oysters for 500 yen and a box of 20 pieces Toro tuna for 2400yen. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: There are not many options for Marriott properties in Japan so this one is a must stay for me when traveling in Japan on business. It is a very nice Courtyard in a world class location. Ginza is a very exciting place to visit! I appreciate the free beverage coupon when checking in. I always enjoy the free glass of Sapporo beer. Sometimes it is the little things that matter...and being in Japan...no tipping!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Booked 2 rooms for 3 nights for the family at this centrally located Marriott property. Even though it's a Courtyard, we were very impressed at the overall facilities and hospitality we encountered. We took the Airport Limousine Bus (w/toilet) from Narita Airport and it was an hour and a half ride directly to the hotel dropping us off at the front door. So very convenient than taking a taxi or dragging luggage around on the bus or train. The cost per person was 3100 yen or $26. The hotel is about a 2 block walk (5 minutes) from the Ginza shopping district where you can find anything and everything. The hotel provided umbrellas for those rainy days. The room we booked was small (less than 275-300 sq ft, but expected in Japan) and was impeccably clean especially the bathroom, carpet and bedding area. I always look for cleanliness in a hotel, and for a Marriott Courtyard, I was surprised as I have stayed in 5 star hotels but have been disappointed. I believe Japan facilities in general are super clean compared to other countries especially in Asia. The breakfast buffet was plentiful, but the offerings were the same on a daily basis; no change in the menu and the usual suspects were available, bacon, eggs, bread, cereal, japanese fare, etc. The buffet was included in the room we booked. We were also given a complimentary welcome drink coupon and availed of that in the lobby bar. There was an issue with our room which was handled professionally and swiftly by the front desk. Newspaper delivery in English was at our front door daily. The basic bathroom toiletries were provided as well as dryer, ironing board and iron and in room safe. The closet also had a linen and clothing air freshener spray whose fragrance was absolutely wonderful smelling (should have inquired about purchasing that as it was better than an Febreeze or Downey fabric refresheners out there!). Wifi was free for Marriott Rewards members in room and free for all in the lobby area. As mentioned, the location of the hotel is centrally located and nothing is more than a 10-20 minute walk as far as shopping, supermarket, fast but good Japanese food and 4-5 star restaurants. The train station is also nearby, one dropping off right underneath the shopping center. Signs are in English so no problem traveling around by train to venture outside of the city. Since this is the only Marriott property in the Ginza area, we would definitely stay here again and looking forward to doing so.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This Courtyard has a good central location in Tokyo, and an easy walk to restaurants, shopping and train station(and there's even a Denny's across the street if you long for 24/7 breakfast meats!). However, standard rooms are very small (even for Courtyard) and the beds/furnishings are starting to show a little wear.Common areas and small rest/bar are adequate for small meetings if you need a little space to work for two.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel is very well situated in the Ginza area, with many options available for food and entertainment. The breakfast buffet is very nice with many options available to suit almost any taste from traditional Japanese to Full American breakfasts. Rooms were clean and the beds were good. A little disappointed in the size of the room as there was very little open space even though the beds were basically generous twin beds. The bathroom was extremely small with just enough room to stand at the vanity and no more. The toilet was old but still had the typical bidet functions, but lacked some of the more modern features found in most business class hotels in Japan. Showers were very good and the mirror was heated so it stayed fog free. Nice touches - two bottles of water every day, nice linens on the bed and an excellent concierge who was spot on with recommendations. Bus limo service between Narita/Hanada airport makes getting there easy.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed here on 3 separate occasions in the last month. It is NOT your average Courtyard! In fact I would say that it's as good as and possibly better than some Marriott properties. Updated interiors with Japanese accents, excellent service (as you might expect in Japan). Room sizes are closer to American norms than the usual tiny rooms in Japan (or Europe, for that matter). There are few and only minor clues that this is a Courtyard: the bathroom amenities (which are generous) are of a lower quality, and there is no executive lounge. There is a great breakfast buffet (free for gold/platinum members) with a wide variety of choices and a nice vibe. Gold/platinum members also get a free drink in the small lounge area. The location is near a number of different subway lines (less than 5 minute walk to each) and also less than 5 minute walk to the main part of Ginza. So convenient! Hotel faces a slightly big street but it's pretty quiet overall, which is really nice. As with most/all of Japan, neighborhood is totally safe. There's a Tully's, Denny's and convenience store within a few blocks. The "Airport Limousine" airport bus stops at the hotel -- soooo convenient, especially if you have luggage of any size -- why lug it through train stations and up stairs when you can get on a bus with your luggage and be dropped off at the front door of the hotel? Rooms are very quiet, have blackout curtains, and a bilingual tv with a handful of English language stations. (Be sure to press the "bilingual" button on the English language remote to switch the broadcast language) There's a fitness center in the basement but I've never used it or seen it. Wifi is strong (mine was free as I'm a gold member). Be sure to note: this property is not to be confused with the Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Station. Both properties are in the same general area of Tokyo, so be sure to check your reservation and make sure you know which you're headed to!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Lovely service, impeccably clean, just very slightly worn (the public spaces only, the room was A-1, if small). Very good breakfast buffet as well. And you can't beat the location if you want a Ginza experience: more stuff than you can imagine (or want), at prices only Russian oligarchs would pay. We actually saw a pen going for ¥3,800,000 (that's thirty-eight K USD), not to mention a rather small handbag for ¥2,800,000 (it was very well lit in the window, we did have to admit though).On the other hand, there are12 stories of Uniqlo, the best and cheapest casual clothes anywhere, and great eating, not all expensive either, everywhere you turn.Good, solid, Marriott performance. Very comfortable and convenient, but when will they figure out that charging for Wi-if is so 20th century?

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed two nights at the Courtyard. The room was big enough for the two of us. The room was cleaned each day and no problems at all. The staff was very helpful whenever we had a question. The hotel is closely located to the Ginza shopping area just a couple of blocks away. You have to walk a few blocks to the nearest subway station.The concierge, who spoke English, was really helpful helping us find the location of certain areas and landmarks. The fish market is a few blocks away as well as the Tokyo tower.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I've been traveling to Asia for business for close to 8 years now and have stayed in different types of hotels depending on our budget at the time. During our past few trips, we've been choosing lower cost hotels and this one fit the bill just right if booked well in advance.Aside from the Courtyard in Hong Kong, this one has been one of the best appointed Courtyards I have stayed at. Rooms are relatively spacious (compared to similarly priced hotels in Tokyo), and have all the expected amenities from an asian business hotel. Bathrooms are small as usual, but not to the point of being uncomfortable. Rooms facing toward the front entrance of the hotel have a nicer view of the boulevard and if high enough, might even see the Tsukiji fish market. If you are a Marriott platinum member or if your room is in the concierge/club level, you get access to a free breakfast buffet which is superb in quality and assortment. A great value even if having to pay for breakfast. What makes this place great is it's central location. It is close to the Ginza line subway station, and only two blocks from Ginza Dori, where all of the shops and department stores are. Plenty of restaurants around to choose from as well when returning from work.Getting from the hotel to the airport is very easy from here using the subway and the Narita Express, or even taking a Cab down to Tokyo station for a few Yen if you have more luggage than you care to carry by yourself.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: As a frequent traveler, I try to stick to Marriott hotels for points. This hotel is great for everything. awesome breakfast buffet. Bus service to and from Narita airport (for a fee). Great location to Ginza Street which has great (& expensive) shopping. Walking to distance to a lot of other places and near metro station to get around Tokyo. Quick cab service. Great hotel staff and service. English channels on TV. Nice rooms. Clean. My only personal gripe is the beds are a little too firm for my preference. WiFi is free for Marriott members.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I have been fortunate to stay at a number of locations in Tokyo, and booked this hotel on the recommendation of a friend. I am very grateful I did.From Check-in to Check-out, the service was amazing. Japanese hospitality is always fantastic, but the staff at the Courtyard Marriott Tokyo Ginza took it to a whole new level. I had asked for some parcels to be delivered ahead of check-in, and it was waiting for me in the room. Check-in was swift, particularly after an overnight flight, and the room is very large, even for Tokyo standards. Large King size bed, working table, and small lounge still allowed for plenty of room. The bathroom was modest, yet a little dated. I believe the key selling point for the hotel is its restaurant - I believe it is one of the best breakfast buffets in Tokyo. A fine mixture of Western and Japanese is offered for breakfast, and service was attentive and willing to go the extra mile (even when asked to switch the TV to the tennis!) I also had lunch at the restaurant, and the buffet was again extremely good. The location in Higashi Ginza is close to all the sights of Ginza, and is a 10 minute easy walk to Yurakucho. It is a good location to base yourself if you have not been to Tokyo previously. My room rate included free internet, but I understand not all room rates include this. The hotel is easy to travel to- and from Narita Airport - the Limousine Bus is extremely direct, taking only an hour to reach Narita. We caught the train to Tokyo on our early morning arrival, as it would have meant waiting a long while for the bus.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is the second time my family and I are stayed in this hotel as I rated this an excellent hotel previously. The service of the staff is still impeccable and always ready and willing to extend a helping hand. The buffet breakfast is fully stocked and the choices very generous. On our first day my daughter requested for crispy bacon as their bacon was not crispy They indulged her request, no problem, and we enjoyed it the way bacon should be cooked. When we ordered it again, it was no longer the same as the taste of old oil left a weird taste in our mouth. Hmmmm...we were so looking forward to our crispy bacon. But that's ok.The rooms and the housekeeping are always top notch but of course, Yokyo rooms are always smaller than other Asian rooms.I wish Marriott Hotels will change their policy of not honoring our nights' stays if the rooms are bought from Agoda, etc. We bought our 2 rooms for5 nights each and our stay was not credited to our points. I dont get it. I still stayed in their hotel and I still paid for it. For this, I feel a little cheated.This is a lesson in checking with your hotel's rewards policies.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This place has it all, the shopping on GINZA is amazing with restaurants and so many things to do. I do have to say though that they should offered transportation assistance from the airport to the hotel when I had initially call about transportation but I was offered only the train or the bus. I took the bus and it was late and RAINING so I didn't get there till late other than that everything was exceptional. The staff there are amazing especially MARINA ! ( Sorry, it has taken me this long to write this review Marina) she was awesome and DO listen to all her advices she gives you about things to do. I was there on a short trip so I was trying to do everything I can. Make sure to wake up early like she said about the Tsukiji Fish Market if you want to see the fish auction! it's a MUST do thing but you will be very tired! Again, Marina, thank you so much for your assistance! You made my first Japan trip worthwhile!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I chose this hotel because of reviews. I had points enough for 2 nights. It didn't disappoint. My son and I were there Dec. 23-25, 2014. We walked all over Ginza, viewing wonderful stores and their Xmas lights. It was close to subway so our trip to Tokyo Disney was easy. Breakfast was very good too.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I love this hotel for the following reasons: Location, Service, Cleanliness, Comfort, Close proximity to trains, restaurants and Tsukiji market (you can walk).I will definitely stay there again during my next visit to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The room was modern and a decent size for Japan. Breakfast was good with plenty of fresh fruits! The hotel is in a very handy location, luxurious shopping is just around the corner and there are some great restaurants nearby! Loved my stay in this hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Three of us stay in this hotel. We enjoy it a lot. CLEAN AND Good size of room. Location is great that you can enjoy Tokyo city. Friendly service and good room service. We will love to come back and stay here again. The room size is big for most tokyo hotels. They replied my emails fast and provide me a none smoking room as I requested. I highly recommend this hotel to people traveling to Tokyo!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed in this hotel for about a week. The breakfas buffet was great, the chef, an American from Hawaii is extremely friendly and knows his art very well. The hotel is very well located, clean, comfortable and nice. The only two areas where it could improve quite a bit is the hours of operation for the restaurant as the kitchen closes early and the room service which is extremely limited. Other than that it is a great option to stay in Tokyo, be sure to include the breakfast when you book your room, it is well worth it.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My daughter and I stayed there over New Year's and I strongly recommend the Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza. We took a shuttle bus directly from Narita. Excellent front desk staff and the concierge was lovely and informative. Great full breakfast (both American and Japanese offerings). Very clean and comfortable rooms with good bedding. Good location a few blocks from two subway lines. We walked to the fish market from the hotel, as well as to ginza department stores and shopping area. Comfortable kimono robes in room. Staff went out of their way to secure a cab in cold weather. Would strongly recommend due to its location and comfort but primarily due to excellent staff.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The location of this hotel is great. 5 minutes by foot to the main Ginza shopping street. The rooms are small but clean and modern. We forgot to request for a non-smoking room so our room smelled like smoke which was the only down side. The breakfast is not great but its decent. There are so many cafes and restaurants nearby so you have a lot of options. One plus is that the airport limousine bus stops right at this hotel so its very convenient to go to and from the hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Family of four stayed for four nights. Concierge helpful. Rooms adequately sized. Free wifi in foyer but not in rooms which is puzzling. Buffet breakfast full of choice & good value for roughly $18 AUD. Two subway stations in very close proximity. Would recommend.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Tokyo is one of my favourite destinations in Asia and mostly in prefer to stay at the Courtyard Ginza. The hotel is close to more than 2 different tracks on the local train network and is close to Tokyo station for the Shinkanzen. There are lots of interesting food choices close by ensuring you wouldn't starve for food. There are Indian / Sri Lankan food choices for people who prefer spicy veggie food within walking distance. Some words of caution. .the hotel sometimes offers some very attractive prices and you should check if the rooms are standard or no, because they have some corner rooms that would be smaller than a toilet in some larger hotels. These rooms fit a single bed a single table and a toilet similar to one you would find in normal cruise ships. If you get a standard room , it's relatively decent. An average sized gymnasium is complimentary. This is not usual in all hotels in Japan as many hotels charge for usage of the fitness center. The breakfast spread is average but the chefs in the breakfast area are quick and don't have issues in cooking eggs or any other requirements the way you want it , quickly which enables you to manage your early morning rush easily.The Hilton and Hyatt at Shinjuku are better hotels in Tokyo , however for the price range and location, Courtyard is a decent choice.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: convenient location,it's near the metro there is a hanamasa 24/hour supermart just nearby(10mins) walk lots of Family marts and Ramen shops till late.Fashion stores Chanel, Abercrombie & Fitch ,H & M ,UNIQLO (tax free if spent abv 10000).Love it the hotel Breakfast (Egg Benedict)

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and even relatively large for a Tokyo hotel. But what really sets it apart is its staff. The concierge (Ms. Ahmed, when we were there) was amazingly helpful - suggesting restaurants, making dinner reservations, and even drawing a map of how to get to places (a critical thing in navigating the downtown area, as we discovered). We are both seasoned international travelers, used to being self-sufficient, but found the concierge help here utterly invaluable to our having a positive experience in Tokyo.Other good things: breakfast buffet was excellent, with a good selection of both Western and Japanese fare; fantastic location near several Metro stops; and easy walking distance to Tsukiji fish market (critical if you want to get there at 5 AM!). I would certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed here again during a mother/daughter trip with my mom. It's very convenient. I'd say it's about a 2 minute walk from the main street in Ginza. Everything was literally minutes away. The subway wasn't far either. The subway is very convenient. Once you're on it, you can get to just about anywhere. As with the usual Japanese experience, service was excellent. They were very accommodating. The beds were comfortable. No issues with sleeping on them. I had a great night sleep. The shower is a little on the short side. I'm not tall (5'6"), but I was maybe a couple inches from bumping my head off the ceiling in the shower. Very clean hotel.The hotel is far from Narita airport, but that's through no fault of the hotel. It really is just that Narita airport is far away. We had an airport shuttle that picked us up and dropped us off right at the hotel lobby. The hotel staff organized the airport shuttle for us with no issues. We asked in the morning before we left for a day of exploring. All they wanted to know was when our flight left. They had everything ready for us when we came back that night.
