hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Staff ROCKS - Breakfast ROCKS - Location ROCKS ... whatelse do you have to say? Okay, I can say something negative - if you are 6'6" like me, watch out for the shower :). Went there for a week with family - I would recommend a second room ... it does get tight, but talk about being in the heart of Tokyo/Ginza - it is a must. Staff is just fantastic!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Wonderful location to explore Tokyo. Walking distance to the main Ginza area, Tsukiji fish market, and Tokyo subway which was only one block away. Excellent hotel staff that really do their best to make your stay enjoyable and stress free. Breakfast buffet was a good value especially with a complimentary discount ticket that was given if your stay was two days or more.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: In the past, we used to stay in Shinjuku for all our past few trips to Tokyo. This time, we decided a change, and is all worth the effort. We requested for extra bed to accommodate the family of 5. (2 adults and 3 young kids). The room is spacious in Tokyo standard, very good facilities with many cupboards and drawers to keep ally out shopping, dirty laundry etc. we realized that Marriott Ginza is really a perfect location! Is within Ginza shopping district, few mins walk to Uniqlo, H&M etc and 10mins walk to Tokyo Station, and 5mins walk to Tsukiji Market! It is being surrounded with lots of good food! What's more, the airport limousine is right outside!!!! On the day of checking out, all we do is onboard the bus, all luggages are handled by the hotel staff, loaded to the bus. We will go back there again!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Just finished a six night stay here, comfortable and quiet room with little traffic noise, a/c worked great. Used the airport limo service to get to and from the airport - very efficient and convenient - staff loaded and unloaded baggage. Staff were helpful. One minor problem with Wi-Fi access was resolved within a few minutes with two members of staff coming to our room to test and reset the router. Only used the bar on the lobby level once- food just ok - but in Tokyo there are so many eating options else where. As mentioned in other reviews the nearby Lawson's was very handy with a fridge in the room to keep drinks cold. There is also a Tully's coffee very close by. Several subway stations in easy walking distance giving access to different lines. Free English newspaper outside the room every morning. We decided to travel to Hakone for the day by ourselves rather than do an organized trip and the hotel concierge was very helpful with info on where to go to catch the bullet train and transfer to the Hokane Tozan railway etc. She had some good recommendations on local restaurants also.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed here when I travelled on business and needed to be in the central part of Tokyo, with easy commute options to other places. I chose this hotel because of its brand and its location near Ginza line metro. The hotel itself is pretty simple and straightforward, efficient and adequate for the frequent business traveller. Decently furnished rooms of just about adequate size, decent bathrooms, very good breakfast spread and quite efficient and courteous staff. A step out and one is in the busy Ginza district with all forms of commute available. What more can one ask? I did find the hotel a trifle expensive - surprisingly so, as I understood that there are much grander hotels in the vicinity, charging only slightly more.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Had an excellent stay here in November. As mentioned in other reviews, the location is great and very convenient to Ginza and also to Tsukiji fish market. The guest rooms were very nice and a good size. The staff at the hotel is very friendly and helpful and the concierge is terrific. Plus for you runners, it's easy to get to the Imperial Palace for a 5k run (the hotel has a mini running map for you).

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My wife and I stayed at this Marriott for 2 nights from Dec 1-3, 2014. It was part of a travel package we had bought from our travel agent (Jessica Rajaratnam - www.affordablevacationplanners). The hotel was excellent and met all of our needs. The room was very similar to hotel rooms in North America in terms of space and amenities. Definitely not the "small room size" that I had read about in most hotels in Japan. We received free wifi at the hotel and the signal was great (it met our needs for checking email, using Google maps, writing Tripadvisor reviews, playing online games on our apple products, etc.). Our bags didn't arrive until the next day, but the hotel room provided everything we needed (including toothbrushes and toothpaste, combs, razors, shaving cream, after shave, etc.)... which was awesome! I also loved the fact that the hotel (like all hotels in Japan) was very Eco friendly. There was also a free safe in the room, which came in handy to lock up our valuables before leaving the room (and not having to carry it around with us).The location of the hotel was great as well. There were tons of restaurants and shops all around us. The subway station was 1.5 blocks away from the hotel, making travel around Tokyo a breeze (getting used to buying the tickets and figuring out which subway lines takes a little getting used to, but the local people were very helpful and even offered to help us without us having to ask). The hotel provided printed out maps of the hotel's location and surrounding areas, which came in handy at other subway stations when we were tying to buy tickets (we just pointed to the hotel location on the map and the train personnel directed us to the right trains - when going back to the hotel).There was also a Lawson minimart on the same block just a short walk (less than a min) from the hotel. It has all your essentials, including prepackaged meals which were very affordable (made for a quick breakfast). It is open 24/7, which was very useful when we woke up form our jet lag around 1:30 am (not having eaten dinner) and needed to grab some food quickly.There is a Japanese theater 2 blocks away from the hotel. We saw it on from the bus on our half-day tour of Tokyo and went back to see if we could catch a show after the tour was over. We were able to catch one act (cost was around 1,300 yen per person) and it was very entertaining. English audio guides are available for 500 yen rental price (with 1,000 yen deposit that you get back when you return it) - it provides a summary of what is going on (not a direct word for word translation). My wife got one, but I decided not to get one. I was actually entertained throughout the entire play even though I didn't understand a single word - it's completely in Japanese. Definitely recommend getting the audio guide. My wife and I stayed at this Marriott for 2 nights from Dec 1-3, 2014. It was part of a travel package we had bought from our travel agent (Jessica Rajaratnam - www.affordablevacationplanners). The hotel was excellent and met all of our needs. The room was very similar to hotel rooms in North America in terms of space and amenities. Definitely not the "small room size" that I had read about in most hotels in Japan. Our bags didn't arrive until the next day, but the hotel room provided everything we needed (including toothbrushes and toothpaste, combs, razors, shaving cream, after shave, etc.)... which was awesome! I also loved the fact that the hotel (like all hotels in Japan) was very Eco friendly.The location of the hotel was great as well. There were tons of restaurants and shops all around us. The subway station was 1.5 blocks away from the hotel, making travel around Tokyo a breeze (getting used to buying the tickets and figuring out which subway lines takes a little getting used to, but the local people were very helpful and even offered to help us without us having to ask). The hotel provided printed out maps of the hotel's location and surrounding areas, which came in handy at other subway stations when we were tying to buy tickets (we just pointed to the hotel location on the map and the train personnel directed us to the right trains - when going back to the hotel).There was also a Lawson minimart on the same block just a short walk (less than a min) from the hotel. It has all your essentials, including prepackaged meals which were very affordable (made for a quick breakfast). It is open 24/7, which was very useful when we woke up form our jet lag around 1:30 am (not having eaten dinner) and needed to grab some food quickly.There is a Japanese theater 2 blocks away from the hotel. We saw it on from the bus on our half-day tour of Tokyo and went back to see if we could catch a show after the tour was over. We were able to catch one act (cost was around 1,300 yen per person) and it was very entertaining. English audio guides are available for 500 yen rental price (with 1,000 yen deposit that you get back when you return it) - it provides a summary of what is going on (not a direct word for word translation). My wife got one, but I decided not to get one. I was actually entertained throughout the entire play even though I didn't understand a single word - it's completely in Japanese. Definitely recommend getting the audio guide. A big thank you to Jessica Rajaratnam (www.affordablevacationplanners) who convinced us to go with this hotel package. This is definitely a much higher end hotel than we would have chosen if we had booked by ourselves and I am actually surprised it was included in our package. We paid about $2,100 US for the package (for both of us) which included: 2 nights at the Courtyard Marriott in Ginza and 3 nights at the New Miyako Hotel in Kyoto, free wifi in all hotel rooms, airport-hotel transfers in a private car (to the hotel from the Narita airport and back to the airport from Kyoto), 1 half day tour in Tokyo, a full day tour of Mt. Fuji and surrounding areas (including reserved seats on the shinkansen train ride to Kyoto with JTB travel representatives meeting us at each train station to ensure we transferred to the right trains and even walking with us from the Kyoto train station to the New Miyako Hotel), a full day tour of Kyoto & Nara, all entrance fees included and an English speaking tour guide. Initially I thought this seemed a little expensive (I am a thrifty traveler), however after staying at both hotels and receiving excellent service throughout the entire trip, this was actually a bargain... I feel like I should have paid a lot more for the experience I had... simply amazing! I would personally recommend anyone planning to come to Japan for the first time (which was the case for my wife and myself), to definitely book this type of package (you will be taken care of well and it takes the stress out of being in a new country and culture). I would also recommend Jessica as an excellent travel agent who can help to plan out your trip to your customized specifications and she ensures that you always get more value for your money (which I love!!).

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great location near Ginza. The treat was finding the Tokyo fish market in the opposite direction. The restaurant in the hotel (Basement) was a surprise find when the heavy rain resulted in needing another plan.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Yes, the location is good, but there are dozens of hotels around, so it's not a decisive factor. The room is well-decorated, but its ceiling is like 190cm high, so you'll feel its pressure all the time.Wi-fi is NOT included into the room price, so be prepared to pay extra USD10/day of enjoy a very poor signal at the lobby. The breakfast selection is VERY poor for such type of the hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel is ok. It is near the shopping mall and high end shop streets near the Ginza area. OK if you like high end shops but I certainly don't. Breakfast very mediocre. Good concierge lady. Taxi ride to the hop on hop off buses if you want to get the bus early.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great stay with nice rooms and great service. Was able to get around with ease to the main attractions with the printed directions offered by the hotel staff. Location was great being able to walk to many places including the famous Tsukiji Fish Market. A must if you are visiting Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: in heart of Ginza (top notch shops) this hotel meets all needs. The staff were unbelievable especially Marina who gave us so much help getting about. The breakfast was by far the best we have ever eaten and nothing was too much trouble for them. The rooms were terrific and the bathroom marvellous. I cannot fault the hotel in any way.
user_name:
Anne B
Greater London, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Location is great - walking distance to Metro Tokyo stations (Higashi- Ginza & Ginza stations), close to midrange and premium international brand shopping, diverse food choices around, convenience stores, breakfast at Denny's across the road from the hotel, airport shuttle although with charges but convenient. Medium sized rooms but comfy enough for 2 and a bit small for 3, well stocked minibar. Loved the hotel's initiative to give good heplful guide through leaflets with map of the area - a helpful guide for those who want to explore the City on their own- well thought of. Overall definitely recommended, in fact i already did! Thanks Marriott's label of great service!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: It’s not often that I’ll give 5 stars when a visit starts out bumpy, but here goes: I stay at the Courtyard Ginza frequently so I know the room layouts and had requested one of their larger rooms weeks in advance as I was staying with my family. My request was confirmed by room number. When we arrived, the room was not available and I wasn’t happy as my wife had recently had hip surgery and would have difficulty navigating a small room. As unhappy as I was, I must admit the staff moved mountains trying to make up for the error. They gave us various options including moving rooms mid stay, other hotels, discounts etc. and they did so quickly, efficiently and in a very friendly manner. After we did check in, the rest of the stay went like clockwork. Terrific staff, clean and (for Tokyo) VERY spacious rooms and a good breakfast each day. The restaurant in the basement was fun, laid back and had wonderful food and staff. The star of the excellent staff is definitely Marina the concierge. She has helped with various tasks over my many stays and is always prepared with suggestions, help for my family and always a kind word. Yes we have stayed at more upscale hotels in Tokyo including the Ritz Carlton, sister hotel to the Courtyard Ginza, which is a spectacular, world class property, but dollar for dollar, you simply can’t beat the Courtyard Ginza for value and relaxed style.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel is excellent, the rooms have a nice sizes for Japan standards. The decor is nice. Recommend the Hotel. The concierge is the best !!! She new well English (which is very difficult to find) new Tokyo well and whatever she didn't know she would find out and have the answers for you !!! All her recommendations and directions were perfect ! Good job !

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Just came back from a business trip to Japan. I booked this hotel mostly for its location but did not have high expectations, particularly it being a Courtyard (as opposed to a Marriott or a JW). How fool I was.The location of this hotel is unbeatable, close to two main subway lined and walking distance to Ginza stores and shopping. The service is top notch, the rooms and amenities far beyond what one would expect from a Courtyard.Breakfast was always a treat. Staff was friendly and accommodating.My particular praise to Marina the concierge; she is a world class concierge (what you would expect from a Four Seasons, Peninsula, etc.). In addition to helping me with hard to get reservations, she always answered questions politely, even before my trip. I was more than surprised when she recovered an umbrella I had left at a restaurant the prior evening.Don't be fooled by the fact that this is a Courtyard. In my mind it should be rebranded as a Marriott (and FAR better than the JW Marriott Houston where I stayed earlier this month).If I make it back to Tokyo, I will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Spent 3 nights with my family prior to taking cruise from Yokohama. Breakfast buffet included with room rate was average nothing special but OK. Upon check in was given free drink coupon good in hotel lounge for one glass wine, beer, coffee or tea. There's Lawson convenience store next door. Hotel within easy walking to Tsukiji fish market, Ginza shopping and nearby Higashi Ginza subway station. For those who rather take taxi to/from Tsukiji or JR Shinbashi station, the taxi fare was minimum 730 yen oneway. Some taxi drivers not familiar with Courtyard Marriott Tokyo Ginza hotel and more familiar with previous name Ginza Tobu hotel. Ask front desk for hotel card to show taxi driver so no trouble with taxi driver finding hotel. Rooms seemed to be recently renovated and we appreciated international English television channels. In-room WIFI was free for Marriott Rewards members and we had no troubles with connection. Overall pleasant stay and we would stay at hotel again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stay at this hotel when I visit to Tokyo due to nice location and clean with good service. Hotel is old but renovated. Breakfast is always excellent with good service. Nice location near hotel for shopping eating and traveling

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Pros:- great location. Easy walk from the subway station- walking distance to lots of shopping, Uniqlo, GU, Donki, department stores, Tsukiji Fish Market- spacious room (for Tokyo standards!)- you can take the bus to the airport right outside the hotelHotel made a boo-boo with my luggage. We checked out early and went shopping. When I returned and asked for my luggage so that I could pack my shopping buys, they rolled out a luggage that was not mine. It was discovered that my luggage had gone on the earlier bus to Narita Airport. Hotel staff also forgot to give my husband a luggage ticket and we got told off by the luggage handlers at the Narita Airport bus stop for not having a ticket to exchange for his luggage that was on the bus like all the other people on the bus had.While I'm glad my luggage and I were re-united at Narita Airport, I was not impressed with the way the hotel handled the situation and the inconvenience it put us through. There was no service recovery done.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I generally have a hard time reviewing an hotel, because personal expectations makes up so much of how each person finds a hotel. Here is my perspective. I'm Premier Elite Marriott awards member, based in North America, but I have traveled extensively in Asia. I have stayed at some of the really great hotels in the Marriott chain, and this is not one of those. What the Courtyard Tokyo Ginza Hotel is though, is a safe, clean, good hotel, in a great location, with an excellent staffThe advantages of staying at this hotel, starts at the Narita airport, where for around $30 dollars a person, you can get a limo bus ticket inside the airport, whose last stop is the hotel entrance. Depending on traffic the ride will take an hour. A return ticket can also be purchased at the hotel. A taxi will cost around $300. Upon arrival at the hotel, you will be met by a friendly, helpful desk crew, who in my experience all spoke English quite well. The rooms are small, but this is typical of most hotels in Asia. The rooms though are kept very clean, and the bathrobe kimonos, morning paper, and waking to birds singing through the hall's audio system are nice touches.The hotel has several bars and restaurants, but I only took advantage of the breakfast buffet, which was given to me, because of the absence of of a executive room at the hotel. The buffet is above average with a wide selection, and includes both local, European, and American, breakfast options and an omelet bar. My only small complaint is that for the week I stayed there, the selections were exactly the same.The big plus of this hotel is it is right in the Ginza district. The are massive amounts of great high end entertainment, dining and shopping options within a short walking distance. A must visit is the Tsukiji Fish Market which is an easy 5-7 minute walk away. Go early since many of the top sushi places close before noon. Can you say sushi breakfast. Also watch out for traffic, zooming around the small roads at the market, since its main focus is not tourism, and many workers are just trying to get the job done.When it comes time to spread your wings and explore other areas of Tokyo, I found with a little experimentation, that the Tokyo subway system was quite easy, if a little crowded. Just around the corner of the hotel are the Ginza and Higashi Ginza stations that can get you almost anywhere you want to go easily. The break through for me in understanding the subway, was the realization that most of the numbers you see is on the routing maps, are the amount of money you need to put on a ticket to get to that place. Make sure to grab your ticket if you haven't reached your destination. Also the JR line is owned by a separate company and requires a separate ticket.Finally take advantage of this hotel's secret weapon, their concierge Marina Ahmad. She seems to have an answer to all questions. She was able to get me tickets, to the sold out Sumo tournament in September, and arrange for tickets to a show I saw on Anthony Bourdain's travel show. She was also a wealth of knowledge on shopping and dining and getting around Tokyo. Don't put all your eggs in her basket though. Top events in Tokyo sell out early and making reservations prior to your trip is recommended.In conclusion then I definitely would recommend a stay here unless your main priority is high end in hotel luxury service.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Simple and effective, and in a good location - but which hotel in Tokyo isn’t? (Such a great city to get around, and so many interesting places to see!)This hotel has picked up its game a little in the last few years; especially the breakfast seems to have improved. There is no executive lounge, which is a bit of a disappointment if you are entitled to its use. You will get some vouchers in lieu of the lounge, but not quite the same. They play birdsongs in the elevator lobbies on each floor - once you work out this is not a sparrow stuck in the A/C duct it is quite soothing, and you always need something quirky like that in a Japanese hotel!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My family of 5 (3 young boys) stayed 5 nights. We had connecting rooms with extra bed in one of the rooms. The rooms are a bit small but this is normal in Tokyo. The bathroom does not look very new but everything was in perfect state and very clean. Limited international TV channels. The beds are really, really comfortable, and the rooms are quiet at night. All of us slept very well every single night, and awoke fully rested every morning. I'll say it again: great sleep.Staff were super nice, as seems to be the happy normal in Japan! We didn't have any problems they had to solve but every single staff we addressed was always courteous and helpful. Check-in and check-out were a breeze.Breakfast was good: egg station, pancake/waffle station, hotplates with several cooked dishes, cereal, bread & toast, cheese, pastry, fruit, yogurt, Japanese breakfast items (tried the miso soup, was good). Juices from a drinks fountain, didn't try them. Tea, brewed coffee and machine for espresso coffee.We had the buffet dinner one night and, with the 30% discount voucher provided plus the half-price reduction for kids, it was a very affordable dinner, cheaper than most outside places around the hotel. Not a very large selection but surely enough for us; we liked the foie rice bowl & salmon sushi bowl most. Desserts were also good, our boys enjoyed the chocolate fountain.Location is really great, smack in the middle of Ginza, a 5-minute nice walk to Higashi Ginza station, 10 min to Tsukijishijo station and 12 to Shinbashi (a big station with several lines including the circular Yamanote line), which is the one we used most often.The attention I received as a Platinum member was very good: free breakfasts for all of us and, since the hotel does not have an executive lounge, a free drink for all of us each day at the lobby lounge. The breakfast deal was the best thing for our family.Wifi was spotless during the whole stay, both in the rooms and public areas.There are plenty of breakfast/lunch/dinner options around, the concierge will give you a Ginza map with the restaurants marked. I recommend Tenkuni, great tempura! Also, do go for sushi breakfast to Tsukiji market (a 15-minute walk from the hotel). Sounds a bit weird for breakfast but it is the freshest sushi you'll ever have, at reasonable prices, and we heard the market will move maybe next year so grab the opportunity while it is there.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We used our marriott vacation club points to stay here. Expensive compared to other marriott hotels but that is probably because it is situated in one of the most expensive districts of Tokyo! The location is awesome, centrally placed, closer to the train station and restaurants nearby. It was easy to travel around using the metro which is an essential point to consider when booking stays in Tokyo. There is a space crunch in tokyo and the rooms are usually very tiny. But Marriott rooms were spacious compared to the other hotels we stayed nearby and it was great for a couple. The staff speak good english and the service is excellent too. Would go back to stay here for sure!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed as a family of 4 for 2 nights. Hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of Tsukiji Fish Market and surrounding shopping (ideal if you want to attend early morning tuna auction) and close to Ginza shopping streets (closed to traffic on weekends). Many restaurants nearby catering to a range of budgets. One stop on Ginza/Maranouchi subway lines to Tokyo Station for easy bullet train access. Hotel was clean and well maintained, and rooms were reasonable size by Tokyo standards. Service was excellent, especially the very helpful concierge. Excellent breakfast buffet with good range of Western and Asian choices.Excellent value for money. Recommended for families, business, couples, solo travellers.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The Courtyard in Ginza in conveniently located, easy to access and offers good amenities for a business traveler. I have also found the concierge, Marina Ahmad, to be extremely helpful in suggesting and arranging several different events for me over the past months.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I have stayed here twice now and both times have been good and I will go back again. The rooms are among the largest that I have experienced in Tokyo but if you are a first time visitor to Tokyo your first impression may be that the room is small but for Tokyo standards, they are good size. The location is good as the hotel is a five minute walk to the main boulevard in the Ginza district. Saturday and Sunday is a must too see if you like people watching as the main shopping street is closed off to cars. I am never at a loss on the weekend in Tokyo. The staff are very friendly and for a 3.5* hotel, I highly recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: A visit to Tokyo is not complete without a visit to Ginza, so what better than choosing to stay in a hotel in the Ginza location. The Mariott is nicely snugly located at its fringes closeby to loads of food and beverage and konbini outlets. Easily accessed by train, taxis and bus - we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Mariott. The rooms are well laid out and the staff service was great. Special mention goes to the Reception team (lin, Yamashita), and of course Marina the ever helpful concierge.While its touted as a business hotel, this hotel is great for families too.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed three days at this hotel in Tokyo. Good location, just 2 blocks from a major train station, and walking distance to the fish market. The rooms are good size, the breakfast buffet is great. The bellman and concierge were very serviceable and helpful.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott for hour days on our recent holiday in Japan. The breakfast buffet was great, rooms spacious and clean, and staff helpful. There's nothing super special about this hotel but it was well worth the 35,000 points per night compared to $250-300/night in Tokyo for something comparable. The location makes a great central location for sightseeing around Tokyo. You can get a direct bus from Narita airport for ~$15/person.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Whilst the Courtyard by Marriott at Kyobashi is not luxurious in the sense of a five-star hotel, as a four-star it works., it is a perfect hotel for business travellers who need to be close to Ginza, Kyobashi or even Nihonbashi. It's always clean and comfortable. Check-in and check-out are smooth and quick, and it's generally a good business hotel. I'll be back, and after all, what's better than a repeat recommendation?

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We enjoyed a week in the marriott courtyard hotel and found everything to be very good. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel itself is located in a fantastic area with a sbort walk for bars, restaurants and shops.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I have stayed here twice now - both times for 5 days, and I will go back again. This hotel was not built as a Marriott, so the rooms and public spaces are not quite up to Marriott standards, but they are very good indeed. The rooms are among the largest that I have experienced in Tokyo, including much more expensive hotels. The location is good for subway access and restaurants and GREAT for shopping. The Ginza district is the best for shopping in Tokyo, and I am never at a loss on the weekend, the people watching is great too. The restaurant serves a very good breakfast buffet, with something for every one's taste, and lunch and dinner are very good as well. I spend over 200 nights a year in hotels and this one stands out for the staff. Even by the very high Japanese standards everyone you will come in contact with will stand out. They will make you feel welcome and appreciated. And they are very used to the ways of westerners, with their excellent English and attention to detail it is a stay to remember.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: To be honest, I was first inclined to give a negative review. As I was expecting to arrive early, I had enquired about an early arrival, and they wanted to charge a whole extra night's stay for that!However, upon arrival, I have to say that the staff was very helpful. The service was really excellent. After, I returned from my meeting (which I moved early, as I could not check in early), they had already brought my luggage to the room. Staff was very helpful in response to any questions.The hotel is right in the Ginza shopping district. The airport bus ends at the hotel, and it is only about a 15 minute walk from Tokyo's central station. Next to all the designer stores, there are some nicer shops nearby (e.g. for electronics and also a Tokyu Hands). Rooms are ok, not too big, just fine. Despite the busy downtown location, the rooms are quiet. Beds are fine, and shower/bath are also good. Breakfast is very complete, with both Japanese and western-style food. Service again excellent.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We arrived by airport limousine bus from Narita Airport and our bus stopped right in front of the hotel The rains made us feel worried that we would get wet when the bus stopped, but the doorman with an umbrella helped us right into the hotel. That was Great!Upon check-in, our front desk receptionists found us a smoking room for the whole duration of of our 6 day stay even when they initially said we had to transfer rooms after 2 days. They were very accommodating. Another great!Emma (or was it Emy) of the concierge group was so helpful settling us into our room. Another great!Buffet breakfast was another pleasant experience.Excellent food and presentation both Asian and continental selection. Another great!The rooms are large by Tokyo standards and complete with amenities and supplies of a 5-Star hotel. Thank goodness we're Marriott Points members so we dont have to pay for wifi. Shopping and restaurants are all-over. Great location!All in all, a great start to a week of staying at the Courtyard by Marriott.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: All the staff speaks very good English -makes things easy. They are extremely helpful with taxis, directions etc. Airport limousine stops right out front. Rooms are comfortable though TV channels are limited. Very nice breakfast buffet.They also have a nice exercise room. The only disappointment was that I couldn't get sushi & sashimi from room service (I had in the past but now it's not offered).
user_name:
Gerri M
Austin, Texas, United States

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Hotel is in super location close to shopping area and the fish market is few minutes away. The team is suoer helpful, concierge excellent. Hotel is super clean and the facilites are ok. We stayed for 2 nights and really enjoyed the stay. The facilities of the hotel need to be updated a bit.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I chose this hotel as part of my itinerary last July due to its central location where all places of interest are blocks away. Be a first timer or regular visitor of Tokyo, this is a complete package for all your needs. Staff are tremendously polite and help you direct to all your inquiries. Not to mention the hotel is a regular stop for Limo bus and restaurants big and small are just in the vicinity.Although rooms are very small in western standard yet you will be happy for its cleanliness and attention in details.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We always book american products in foreign countries because typically you know what you are going to get. This hotel was an unexpected bonus. The rooms are big for a major city especially downtown. The star could not be more friendly. The location is perfect for working in downtown Tokyo. Top all that of with a breakfast buffet that is probably the best I have ever eaten with an unbelievably diverse amount of selections and it cannot be beat. This will be a regular stop for business in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I spent few days while I was In Tokyo, This was my base place to visit the city. The welcome I had on my first arrival was so impressive that it amased me : the bellman welcomed me by my name while I was very late (got lost in the tube) and they might not expected me anymore. I remember the GM assistant a swiss lady who was also very welcoming Great location, wonderfull service.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Hotel interior is modern design and room is quite comfortable although the room's size is quite small. The best of this hotel is the location that is just 5 minutes walk to ginza road, the premium shooping area in Tokyo. Another plus point of this hotel is that u don't need to worry to go to the airport since the airport shuttle bus will stop directly in front of the hotel's lobby. Bear in mind that from Ginza to the airport will take about 60 minutes driving, so use the airport shuttle bus would save u a lot of money compares use taxi to the airport.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Very central location. Great service by the front desk staff who patiently answered our questions on where is this & that ; and gave a great recommendation for tempura restaurant (Tenkuni, go for the counter seats for best food & experience) and walking distance to Ippudo noodles. Good & clear maps of Ginza and other districts. Room is spacious & quiet on the 8th floor. Lack of view didn't bother us as we were out most of the time. 10 min walk to Tsukiji market but was unfortunately closed during Obon. For its location & ease of going to shops in Ginza, I will stay here again . PS: do check out the Sapporo Beer Hall right outside the Main Street. Offers lunch & dinner & beer. V decent hangout place which closes at 11 pm.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This Courtyard by Marriott Hotel is a nice, mid-size hotel in a very convenient location about one block (5 minute walk) to the main Ginza shopping area. It's close to the Higashi-Ginza subway station and if you need to get to the JR station, it was about a 10-15 minute walk, if I recollect properly. You can also get to the Tsukiji Fish Market by walking about 15 minutes. You'll find the service to be exemplary, compared to Courtyards in the US--but that's mostly a consequence of service levels to be expected in a decent hotel in Japan. There are ample English-speaking staff as well. The restaurant is pretty decent and the breakfast buffet is actually pretty good. The rooms are well appointed (especially compared to some of the rabbit hutch hotel rooms I've had in Tokyo in the past). The Wi-Fi was BLAZING fast!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Nice hotel in the centre of Tokyo, with reasonable transport links. Comfortable bed, minibar, coffee and tea making facilities, safe, electronic toilet. Internet access was extra which was disappointing for hotels these days. Hotel rooms see to be fully booked up early at weekends.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Our family of 4 (two adults and two teens) all thought the hotel was clean, attractive, and well located (easy walks to both the Ginza and Higashi-Ginza stations). The morning breakfast buffet has ample Western selections, including excellent baked goods. We especially appreciated the English-language flyers at the concierge desk describing major attractions in the Tokyo area with specific detailed directions from the hotel. In the morning, there are recordings of birdsong playing the hallways!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel is well located for easy access to the tubes/trains. Good size rooms and comfortable beds. Very good breakfast buffet catering for everyone. Staff were very helpful providing us with maps so we could navigate Tokyo easily. Good bar with a range of cocktails, just what you want when you are on holiday!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Hotel is perfectly located in the famous Ginza shopping district at a walking distance to the famous fish market, tube stations and several restaurants. Taxis are always at the doorstep. Conceirge Marina Ahmed is the best that you can get with all informations at her fingertips. Good breakfast options and lovely atmosphere. Narita airport shuttle bus stops right at the hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We were pleasantly surprised to find a hotel in Japan that caters to the size of a western hotel room! With 4 of us traveling, it seemed every hotel in Japanonly accommodated double occupancy and we would have to get 2 hotel rooms. The Courtyard hotels have been our favorites in the States so we can continue to say we LOVE the Ginza location. Great customer service, room size was perfect for 4 and perfect walking distance to the famous Ginza shopping district.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel on more than one occasion, and if its warm, don't stay here. The air conditioning in both the rooms and the fitness center barely work. Not very impressive as a Marriott property.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The best part of this hotel is the location. It is in Ginza area, and close to subway stations and all the shopping areas. The hotel left me a good impression of their service. I called them to book a cab pick up from the airport before I got there. But for some reason, they did not take my credit card information so they did not book the cab for me. I had to took another cab from the airport and I told them this. They felt very sorry and gave me free breakfast to make up for it, which I think is fair. Later, I found out I could not connect to the wifi in my room, and one of the front desk staffs came to help me. He had to bent down under the desk and reconnect the hub. I felt grateful for that. Yes, they do have a little this and that issue, but they try to fix them and in general, I am happy with their service.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The Hotel is located in the Ginza district, just 2 Streets away from the main shopping district streets with lots of High-Fashion brands.I had a room on the top floors to the back of the hotel, so street noise was next to zero. The room itself is smaller than in Europe, but still at a decent size. My room rate also included a free ticket for the Tokyo Sky Tree.Breakfast ist a mixture between Asian and American Styles, but with everything you need. Even if you come at the last minute, the staff is still friendly and prepare fresh Omletts for you.If you want to travle by underground/subway in Tokyo, but the Pasmo Card at one of the maschines. It is a prepaid card, which you can use for Taxi, Subway, vending maschines (not all) or in grocery stores. You can charge as much money on it as you like. Very convenient.....

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Wonderful location. Staff went out their way to be helpful. Always pleasant calm atmosphere. Breakfast was really worth the cost ate in hotel one night in japanese restaurant and it was fun. Staff explained every dish to us and the sake was great

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Pretty close to Higashi-Ginza and Ginza subway station, there is subway from Haneda airport to Higashi Ginza station. Breakfast was really nice, variety of food and clean. Only 5 mins walk to Ginza St. I will go back there again

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff was so helpful and friendly. The Concierge, Marina, was fantastic. She made reservations for us, gave us directions and helpful hints about where we wanted to go and she translated for us, acted as a go between with some distant relatives who live in Tokyo. The only downside was the fact that the hotel has no handicapped rooms. It was impossible for me to get in the very deep bathtub to take a shower! Housekeeping tried to construct a stool out of a box but it just didn't work. The only walk in showers are apparently in the expensive suites, we just could not afford 200 yen more per night. I appreciated their trying to help me. The breakfast was outstanding as were the lunch and dinner buffets.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We really enjoyed this hotel. It's easy to reach from Narita via the orange airport limo bus, which stops right at the front door. The staff was very pleasant, and gave us good recommendations for local restaurants. We wanted to attend the tuna auction at the Tsukiji Market, which requires getting there around 3:30 AM. We were a bit worried about getting lost on a back street in the dark! But the front desk gave us good directions, the streets were very safe, and we walked only about 10-minutes straight to the tour office door. The hotel is close to several subway stations, and great shopping in the Ginza district. There's also a Lawson (convenience) store and a Tully's Coffee less than a block away. Our room was very nice. It wasn't large, and it didn't have an outstanding view, but we didn't care. We were too exhausted from touring Tokyo to look out the window! If room size and view are important to you, be sure to request that in advance. Otherwise, the bed was very comfortable, there was a coffee pot in the room, and the bathroom was nicely appointed with a deep soaking tub, bidet, hairdryer, and an assortment of toiletries (including toothbrush, the kind of things you often forget to pack). We would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stay several times during past2-3 years, this hotel is good for business trip as its located in central Ginza. We can reach all most popular shops around Ginza by walking.HOtel staff is charming and helpful, from and to airport is easy by airport bus (good ticket price).Lobby is very narrow for Marriott class hotel, same with the room. But again for your business this hotel is okay..

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed here with my wife on a 2 week business trip. It had all the amenities that I have come to expect of a Marriott property. Clean and we'll maintained with a very friendly and helpful staff. Worth a visit.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed there for a short break earlier this month (June 2014) and were blessed with reasonably good weather and mild temperature. My title of the review says it all - we like our choice. It is very close to the main subway/rail stations - just a few minutes' walk, and the environment was nice for such short walk. Close to the hotel are many restaurants, both up class ones fit for business entertainments but also ones for family and solo business visitors. The UNIQLO store on the main road is huge and was having a super sale drive going on.Coming back to the hotel itself, we found the buffet breakfast very good, especially for the health conscious. We should have tried its dinner buffet as well, but we were attracted to other restaurants outside. We did have dinner at the Japanese restaurant on its basement, nothing spectacular, though.Its lobby lounge cum cafe is quiet, fit for a refreshing drink after venturing outside. It appeared to be popular amongst locals during the afternoon, too, and offered high tea set.The hotel is also served by the airport shuttle service from/to Narita, Passengers should buy the return tickets at the airport upon arrival, and will be rewarded with a very good discount. We paid 9,000 yens for two adult return tickets, i.e., covering both arrival and departure trips.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed a week on business in mid June 2014. Reception was quick. Upon check-out se3rvice was quick.Room was comfortable and clean. Bed was excellent. Hotel is close to a multitude of restaurants. Ten minute walk from the fish market, a must-see seafood market. Near Hama Rikyu garden. Narita and Haneda airport buses provide affordable transportation directly to the hotel. Taxi fare to Haneda runs about $60 and takes 25 minutes or so. Internet was a free but a bit spotty with wireless connection. Only a few blocks from the main Japan shopping area in the Ginza area. Ask for a room with a street view or you will be looking at a rooftop of a nearby moving.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Lodged at the Courtyard Marriott in Ginza again and it was another excellent stay. The staff were friendly and helpful as usual. The concierge sorted airport transfers, luggage storage & laundry whilst we were in Kyoto for 3 days, made local transport recommendations to various attractions and suggested, then booked some great restaurants. [I was not asked for credit card details or other 'no-show' security on this occasion or on previous stays].The Courtyard isn't huge or opulent but it is nicely appointed, well presented and very welcoming. It has an intimacy that you don't always feel at bigger hotels. It also has a good choice of restaurants & shops. The breakfast at Fiore offers an extensive buffet that is great value. There is also a comfortable coffee lounge that looks out onto Showa St which is a great place for a light meal or a drink at the end of the day. The hotel has fantastic proximity to the all of Ginza & surrounds, on foot: main Ginza shopping strip (intersection of Chuo & Harumi streets) is <10min, Tsujiki Fish Market is 10min, Higashi Ginza station 3mins, Tokyo station about 20mins, Kabukiza 5mins and Imperial Palace plaza about 25mins straight up Harumi St. By taxi: you are 20mins from the zoo and museum precinct in Ueno Park, 10mins from Roppongi & Minato and about 25mins from Shinjuku. You could choose a larger and more lavish hotel in the palace precinct but you would be some distance from the sights & sounds of Ginza. If you want a great place to stay whilst you are on business or vacation, I recommend the Courtyard by Marriott in Ginza.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The Courtyard Marriott Ginza is a great hotel in a perfect location to see lots of Tokyo's sights. It is a very short walk to the Higashi Ginza subway station and about a 20 min walk to Tokyo Station. It is also walking distance to Tsukiji Market and Hama Rikyu Park. Being right in the Ginza, the shopping and restaurants around are fantastic. The hotel itself is nicely appointed with modern, clean rooms that are reasonably sized with all of the good amenities a japanese hotel often has: bar fridge, washlet, kettle, ironing board, coffee machine, wifi, etc.The hotel has a great restaurant for breakfast with great variety and a really good mix of japanese and western food. My wife and I loved our stay here.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Read some of the reviews before deciding on this hotel and felt that as it is under the Marriott Group it should be ok.Have to say we were a little disappointed when we saw the room as it looks a little dated. Worse of all it's on the level that have several small conference/meeting rooms, and our room is just opposite one; with a public toilet next to it; (Room 422).Would have requested for a change of room but was informed earlier that the hotel is fully booked, it was only after my husband made a big fuss that they agree to upgrade us to a Premium room the next day. Is this how The Marriott treat their Platinum Members?Strangest thing about this hotel is that housekeeping only starts after 10am and by late afternoon you cannot request for your rooms to be freshen up as the housekeeping staffs have already left for the day. Anyway this is what we were told on the 1st day that we stayed and requested for our room to be freshen up in the evening.As in all Japan hotels, the bathroom is small and cramp too.Do stay at the Premium Rooms if possible as it is a huge improvement to the standard rooms.Pro of this hotel is that it is a 10-15 minute walking distance to Tsujiki Fish Market and 5-10 minutes walk to the main shopping street of Ginza.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I've booked this hotel for my upcoming stay in July. I got in touch with the Concierge desk via email to try to book some of my usual restaurants in advance. It took 7 days before the Concierge desk even got back to me, which is quite poor. The Concierge is asking me to provide them with my Credit Card information including expiry date and security code before they'll even try to make the bookings. They are claiming that if I 'no show' at the restaurants, the hotel will need to charge me because the restaurant will charge the hotel. This is very strange....I'm a frequent visitor to Tokyo and for the past 3 years, have stayed at the Peninsula. The Peninsula have never ever asked me for my credit card information for restaurant bookings. I'm basically booking the same restaurants I've been to at least 3-4 times, so I'm wondering whats going on.The email for the Concierge was provided by the hotel reception when I called them directly.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed at this hotel on a business trip to Tokyo in May 2014. It is an excellent hotel. The restaurant buffet breakfast was excellent and the lounge bar restaurant was geat for a friendly evening meal or afternoon snack. The hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating, helping with advice on what to see and where to eat,Room servce was excellent, quick and hot food.Wifi was excellent strength and never had any issues.There is no lounge at this hotel but Gold Eleite and above membership get free drink vouchers and free breakfast.I would recommend this hotel if you are working in the local Tokyo/Ginza area

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Helpful staff and close to all the great shops in Ginza. The staff are very polite and willing to assist travellers. The lobby cafe is expensive but quiet. The main restaurant has a great buffet which is very popular. Lunch a la carte can be slow but the menu is adequate. The rooms are small and not much fresh air so ask for a fan if it is too warm. They will bring you one. Beds are comfortable.Many small shops and cafés nearby so enjoyable to walk in this safe area.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Friendly and helpful staff. Convenient location. Walking distance to a lot of restaurants. Rooms were a little small and worn out but clean. Free wifi for marriott club members. Good coffee store named Tullys just a few blocks away. If you are seeking for Kobe beef there's a restaurant just behind the hotel named Gyu an.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We recently spent two very enjoyable nights at the Courtyard by Marriott, Ginza in Tokyo. The room was great and we found the staff very helpful with any questions and they arranged for our tour to pick us up from our hotel instead of another, some distance away. Ginza is also very convenient for shopping, restaurants and sights. Overall, very impressive.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Friendly hotel. Friendly accommodating staff. Narita airport shuttle stops right at door. A short walk to many tourist attractions and high end shopping areas, cafes and restaurants. Handy to train stations. A few doors down is "Lawson", a convenience store chain found all throughout Tokyo. They have the freshest, tastiest, cheapest sandwiches ever! Great location and a great boutique hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Ginza is probably one of the famous and well known Japanese word and vocabulary, may be after the word arigato. The word Ginza is easily associated with Japan and one start thinking of Japanese women dressed in Kimono. In reality Ginza is just like any other city in the world. It is here that Courtyard by Marriot Tokyo Ginza Hotel is located and part of Marriot hotel chains around the world.Having been to one of the most astounding hotel in Tokyo previously, it is not easy to make comparison with Courtyard by Marriot Tokyo Ginza as this hotel has its own uniqueness. The best part of this hotel is when you arrived they will bring your luggage in and deliver them to your room with you. The check in process is superb and efficient and touch of class as they would allow you to check in to your room slightly earlier than the given time which makes you feel welcomed. The staff are well trained and they know exactly what the guests wanted and assist them by just looking at our situation. The best part while staying in this hotel is that you feel wonderful and appreciated.I would say their basement restaurant offered the best price for simple Tempura in the whole of Japan with Yen 1,000 one can have tempura for lunch or dinner with a cozy ambiance of a hotel [price may change over time]. Breakfast is reasonably well stocked with American/European selection plus some Japanese dishes. There were no rushing at the time we stayed and we managed to spent our time tasting all the delicacies.The room are up to Marriot standard and they have a Room with No: 911 which we stayed but was peaceful and no explosion. The hotel is just 5 blocks away from the famous main street for shopping for almost all branded items. There are restaurants and cafes all around which you will never feel hungry. It is important that when you are in Japan that we try to sample many of the restaurants and cafes and taste the various food and cakes. Presentation of sweets are chocolates are marvelous and they painstakingly wrap your purchase and it is only happening in Japan.Courtyard by Marriot Tokyo Giza is centrally located and we can easily reach Shinjuku, Shibuya - Haraju/Takeshita, Omotesando, Roppongi Hills, Mid Town and Asakusa from there, although Ikebukuro is slightly further away. You may choose to be located in Ginza, or Shinjuku, Shibuya or Ikebukuro and you will always be right as each one has its own characteristics and you can always travel to the others. Public transportation is super efficient but taxi is also affordable if you travel in group of 3 or 4 and avoid the rush hour in the morning and in the evening. On saturday and sunday the streets are less congested. The hotel is also well connected with the Airport limousine which makes it more easier to come from Narita airport and vice versa.All in all, we had a wonderful stay at Courtyard by Marriot Tokyo Ginza and the opportunity to stay in different hotels gives a better understanding of the world of hospitality as each hotel has its own strength, attractiveness and uniqueness. Next time in Tokyo why not try this hotel for a change and write your own review.Saharudin Muhamad TohaKuala Lumpur, MalaysiaElderly CoupleStaying May 2014Report: 27/05/2014

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great location !!!! Airport Limousine stops here. Metro station, main JR and private railroads stations are near by. Highend boutiques, department stores and mini marts are near by. WiFi works well. Bedding is VERY comfortable. Bathroom is modern. Valet, Reception and Housekeeping staff are all well trained and kind. We stayed here all together 8 nights in April. We were in and out of this hotel to travel all over Japan. Everytime we came back to the Courtyard we really felt like we were back at home. This is the only hotel we would stay in Tokyo. My husband said the breakfast was also the best. I rather sleep until noon though.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Courtyard Marriott Tokyo Ginza is an old hotel. If you walk through the street, you might miss it because the door signage is not very distinctive, and the lobby is weirdly designed: as you enter the hotel, you are confronted with a staircase that goes to the basement (and you have to walk around it to the flight of steps). Reception is tucked in the right hand corner. The area surrounding the hotel lacks any lustre (no nice shops or restaurants, just a highway ramp that divides the main road). But the hotel is blessed by a confluence of bus services: from/to Narita & Haneda airports and Sunrise tour buses that pick you up at 8.15 am to the bus station to be sent to various tour sites. The breakfast spread in the hotel is nice. The hotel is full of people in business suits and glued to computer laptops. If you stay here, you are not likely to get the feeling you are in Japan. While it is a brand name hotel, it is very generic business hotel with mostly corporate clients.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: + Nice size of room - I understand this isn't the norm in Tokyo+ Good internet connection+ Passable fitness centre+++ Great location+ Professional staff+ Decent breakfast - has all the essentials but not much more+/- The corridors need a revamp. I think Marriott has simply picked an old local hotel and rebranded it - Very expensive for what it offers. There are other hotels close by that offer the exact same deal at nearly half the price. We moved out the moment we realized this and that's a pity as we are generally loyal to Marriott. I can see it working okay for tourists but it wouldn't work for slightly longer business stays in my opinion.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: If you're in Tokyo for 1 or 2 nights, this is a very central location. We love Ginza and this hotel is very easy to find and close to subway stops. The staff was very very friendly (never met unfriendly staff in Japan) and the rooms were updated and very nice. Speedy WIFI. The food was good too. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The hotel was very clean, staff was very helpful, breakfast was excellent with a variety of Japanese as well as international breakfast foods--including a fresh omelette made to order. Discrete sounds of tropical birds were played in the hallways. The location was ideal for a visit to Tokyo, close to the Tsukiji fish market and centrally located to the Tokyo Train station. We found that traveling to all parts of Tokyo were easy with this location.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We had a three night stay in Tokyo. We took the bus service from Narita Airport and it dropped us right in front of the hotel. Check-in was quick. As a gold member Marriott Rewards Member, I asked for my upgrade (based on availability) and was upgraded to the executive level rooms... which were much bigger and had required keycard access in the elevator. With being gold or platinum members, you got complimentary breakfast and drink vouchers.The room was gorgeous! Very big, side area with couch, and an expanded bathroom. It also had complimentary bottles of water and a great Keurig coffee maker. The top floor rooms also had a better view. Beds were very comfortable and the room was spotless. Great Robes too! In the minisuite bathroom, it had a separate standup shower and tub. Like everyone where in Japan, there was an electronic toilet... with heated seat and bidet features.The Breakfast was EXCELLENT! It had both Asian and American Dishes... and it was delicious! This breakfast had so many options including omelets, muffins, waffles, pancakes, cereals, juices, coffees, teas, etc. Honestly, it was an amazing spread and I felt compelled to take pictures. Once again, breakfast was one of the best parts of the stay! The downstairs restaurant during the day was a great place to grab a drink and they have great desserts.Wifi was excellent and complimentary! The TV only had 2 or 3 English stations..... CNN International, BBC, and one other.The staff were very friendly and spoke English well. The area was very safe and a few blocks from the main shopping street in Ginza. The hotel is close to multiple metro lines and the fish market. We also booked a tour via the hotel and the company picked us up right at the hotel.Overall, an excellent stay! I highly recommend to anyone visiting the Tokyo area.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This was the first hotel we stayed in when we first got to Japan. It was perfect for us because we weren't used to the Japanese food and it had a great selection for both. The rooms were clean and big especially for a Japanese hotel! The service was great and the staff spoke English very well and were very helpful. I recomend trying the Japanese style dinner because it was Amazing!! The hotel was also very welcoming and perfect for getting over jetlag.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Currently staying at this property (10- 12 May 2014) and very impressed. I have stayed in Courtyard properties in Asia and they are to a high standard. This isn't any different. As a platinum member we also got breakfast coupons and drink coupons for each day of stay. Always a nice perk and grateful when they occur. Within about 2 minutes walk from Higashi-Ginza station and 4-5 minutes from Ginza station. Both exits have maps outside the station @ street level which indicate where the Courtyard is -- easy to find if arriving via subway. More than plenty of food choices in a 4-5 minute walking radius. Japanese, Indian, Turkish, Portuguese, Italian, etc. Plenty of coffee shops as well as 7/11, Lawsons and Family Mart convenience stores also very close. Pro's: ++ Marina the concierge has been great. Very informative and pleasant. ++ Breakfast foods in wide variety and good quality-- even has an omelet station++ excellent WiFi (free for platinum guests) . Came with 2 laptops, 2 iPhones and 2 iPads and never had problems even with all of them running on the same room-based Wifi. Lots of charging ports in the room also. ++ room fitted well and overall property in very good condition. ++ had a non-smoking section of the restaurant/lobby so it was nice to have a location to have a drink or afternoon tea. Things to be aware of (certainly not not cons)  - As stated in several other posts -- Small rooms. We have two overhead-bin sized rollaboards and there's little room to store them and still get around the room. We have a 2-double bedded room.  - I'm 6'1 and while standing in the shower, my head just almost hits the vent. Still plenty of room, but if I were taller would need to stoop.  - Noticed they hadn't refilled the room tea/coffee supplies and had to ask. ^^^ for all the above Would certainly recommend for those OK with spending 200-225USD per night and wanting a great location with the brand-recognition of a Marriott property

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: stayed here for a night with my family.They have good restaurants and a convenience store around, and 10 minutes walk to Tsukiji (fisherman's market).All the receptionists I met could spoke both English and Japanese, and were polite enough.I bet you could enjoy this hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We just completed an amazing stay in Japan and can confidently say that this hotel was an absolutely fabulous part of the experience. Great location, wonderful and helpful staff, and modern and clean amenities made this everything that you would expect.There are many restaurants as well as Tokyo's best shopping steps from the front door, and the hotel is an easy walk from either the Ginza or Shinbashi metro stations. While we never ate at the hotel restaurant for lunch or dinner (there are SO many choices in Tokyo!) the restaurant hosts a fantastic breakfast buffet that allows you pick your choice from standard Western breakfast options or the fabulous Japanese breakfast options.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I spent five nights here and recommend it highly. Very convenient location and professional staff made it a pleasure. Breakfast included a wide variety of selections (buffet). This Marriott property does not have a member's lounge but offers complimentary drink tickets for Marriott status members.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Position wise this hotel fits the needs of any Tokyo tourist, business person.It is only a short stroll to Ginza subway and the shopping district of Ginza. There are many small restaurants around the area if you decide to eat close to the hotel.This was our second stay in the hotel and would recommend it to our friends, it offers fair value for money.Rooms although not large are still bigger than some you would encounter elsewhere in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Modern, very conveniently located hotel. You can walk to the Ginza, train stations, parks, shops, restaurants. You can exchange money at the desk easily. The rooms are large and well-appointed. We were able to walk around easily without using taxis or public transportation. The breakfasts were delicious. The desk staff and concierge were very helpful. My only complaint that we had absolutely no view except roofs and sides of other buildings.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Finding a strategic transportation location when staying in Tokyo is a must. The Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza offers a superb location in Tokyo. Here you are walking distance to Shinbashi JR station and not to mention, Ginza, Marunouchi, Hibiya, and other Toei Asakusa metro lines. It is a short walking distance to Ginza 4 Chome and Tsukiji Fish market. You can also take the Toei Oedo line from there.The hotel provides superb service and great breakfast. If you become a member of the Marriott club, you are entitled to free Wi-Fi. The rooms are very well kept, quiet and spacious for Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: - We just spent six nights at the Ginza Courtyard. We enjoyed our stay and had mostly positive experiences. Previously we have used several Courtyard properties throughout Europe, but this was the first in Asia. I am glad to say that the "Marriott attention to guest satisfaction" is applied at the Ginza Courtyard. The service was usually excellent.- Location is a real plus for this hotel; Ginza being an exciting part of Tokyo. There is a metro stop within a five minute walk from the hotel. Tokyo Station is a short taxi or subway ride away. The hotel is one of the stops for direct coach service between Tokyo and the two Tokyo airports (Narita and Haneda). While it might take a bit longer on the coach rather than by taxi and train, getting to the airport without having to handle any luggage until actually at the airport has appeal.- We were not expecting a gigantic room, after all this is Tokyo. But we were a bit surprised at the size of the standard room. The bathroom especially is very small. They have a fairly decent fitness center. A respectable WiFi service is available though-out the hotel. It is free for Marriott Reward members or about 12USD otherwise. The central heating in the hotel was turned off so they provided a small portable heater that eventually warmed up the room in the evenings.- Guest Services has a very extensive collection of material prepared on Tokyo and the surrounding area tourist sites. Not only does it say which metro/subway station to get off at, it also says which station exist to use. Overall this service was outstanding. The staff there would go out of their way to provide information if it wasn't already prepared.- Breakfast at the hotel was limited to the buffet. It does include an extremely large variety selection, all well prepared and presented. However, for those of us who normally eat a lighter breakfast, 25 USD for a Continental style breakfast gets a bit pricey. We asked about a la carte but were told it wasn't available. Fortunately there are numerous eating opportunities right outside the hotel doors, including an excellent Indian restaurant directly behind the hotel and an excellent cafe directly across the street.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed for a week on a business trip and had had our expectations so expertly managed rgarding 'small tokyo bedrooms' that the reality was a pleasant surprise. Rooms are of international city standard size -perfectly acceptable with room for a double bed, couch and a work desk , and the bathrooms are compact but work well- although some of my taller colleagues had to crouch a bit because of the low ceiling in the shower.What impressed me was the great sound proofing - the hotel was totally full while we were there and yet I did not hear anything once in my room. Wi Fi in room is free if you join the marriot loyalty scheme. We ate once as a group in the japanese restaurant and had a wonderful time in a private room with a sunken table.Breakfast offered a good range of both east and west with a really good egg station.So - its not mind blowing luxury - but its a safe efficient and friendly hotel- I would return. Please note there is no pool or spa - but I can' t work out how not to rate them!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My preferred hotel is Marriott and, unfortunately, I feel as though there are somewhat limited options in Tokyo. While I love the Ritz Carlton in Roppongi, my clients don’t always love their prices!! The Prince Sakura Tower and the Tokyo Marriott in Shinagawa are also options, but not as convenient or centrally located for my purposes. On this trip, I debated between staying at the Courtyard Marriott Ginza Hotel and the brand new Courtyard Marriott Tokyo Station. Ultimately, because I would have been checking into the Tokyo Station hotel on its opening day and I was concerned about delays, I decided to stay at the Ginza location – and it was a good choice.Here is what I liked about the hotel:• The front desk, as well as people throughout the hotel, spoke very good English, were friendly and helpful, and there were always several people working – so there was never a significant wait.• The breakfast buffet was included for Marriott Platinum members and it was quite good. It offered both Japanese and western food options.• The fitness room was small, but the equipment was clean and in good working order. There were several treadmills, as well as other machines and free weights.• My room was spacious with a modern bathroom. It also had a safe that was big enough for a laptop.• Wifi was fast and I never had to reconnect during my 5 day stay – I think this is one of the first hotels I have stayed in where that has been the case and I travel every week.• The location was excellent – it’s within walking distance to subway lines, as well as to the Ginza. Plus, the airport limousine bus stops at the hotel.There was one area where I thought the hotel could improve:• The concierge - while I have read in previous reviews that she is quite good, during my stay it seemed as though she was never there. On two separate days, I was told that she was “off” and there was no replacement. On both days, I could have used her help – and, while the front desk did help, they didn’t have all of the information that I would have liked. I do think concierge service should be provided on a daily basis and I found it frustrating that she wasn’t working for so much of my stay.Overall, this is a good choice if you are looking for a Marriott property. I’d love Marriott to consider a JW/full-service property around Roppongi, Shinjuku, or Ginza – there are some wonderful Marriott properties in Asia and I’d love to see one in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed at this property at the end of 9 day trip. It was the 3rd hotel during this trip and by far, one of the best hotels I have stayed at, which is saying alot, since I travel every week. We were on the premium floor, the room was fantastic and the service great. Food offerings were very tasty and plenty to choose from. Marina, the Concierge was absolutely fantastic!!! She spoke perfect English which I appreciated very much. Very easy to get to everything we wanted to see and do in Ginza. Wonderful property all around.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Excellent location in the heart of the shopping district of Ginza. Very attentive service, wonderful breakfast buffet and most importantly a great nights sleep. Small but worthy gym on sight which is rare in Tokyo. A must stay!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel is great if you want to go to the fish market and intend to hit the shops. As it wasn't our first time in Tokyo - hence we were more here to look around the shops, this is the ideal location. Everything was within walking distance and only had to take the subway once. The other plus point is the airport limo bus stops just outside the hotel so we didn't have to fight our way with luggage through the train station to Narita. The room is a little on the small side but hey this is Tokyo! Overall had a great stay

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: stayed there during Christmas, the location was superb pretty close to several train station. They also have direct transport from hotel to airport (with fee). The concierge was nice, gave me complete information and update you with information such as booking availability at restaurants.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This was not a great experience - I checked in with 3 business guests, running late for a dinner meeting, and the check-in was slow, confused and inefficient. Despite our bookings all being made by my Japanese office's travel agent, it was a painful process. And there was a further problem with my room (but thankfully not my guests') - my reservation, which was supposed to be for 2 nights, was only for 1 night. And they were fully booked for the following night. It's easy to say 'be pragmatic, mistakes happen' - but when you're left with no room for tomorrow it's not much fun. And it shouldn't happen: in hundreds of nights in hotels over the years, this is the first time it's happened and I've been met with a blank look from the (slow, vague) check-in staff. Not great.But regardless of that, because that could be a one-off, how was the rest of the experience? OK, but no more. The room was new-ish, but tiny and extremely expensive. The location's good, if you want to be near the shops of Ginza, but otherwise I wouldn't bother. You can do way better at a number of hotels in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed here in March 2014. Convent location staff very helpful with excellent English. Rooms are just fine. The place is very expensive but I always stay at marriott's when I can. If you are going to drink save yourself a ton of money and go out the side door less than half block on left and visit the liquor store you can buy a whole quart of scotch for the cost of one drink in the courtyard. The same applies for food. Two dinners and a bottle of wine for less than one dinner at the hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
