review_body: I have always been amazed about the elevators in this hotel. This does not allow you to enter any floor other than the designated ones.. The hotel is very close to all the attractions and a easy access to the Sky Tower..

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: loved everything about this hotel. service, amenities and breakfast was top notch and the location is simply great. front desk agents were very helpful. If you're craving for an american all day breakfast or need to withdraw cash, Denny's is right across the street. Different transit routes about 5-10 mins walking distance from the hotel. and ofcourse the famous Ginza shopping is right around the corner.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We spent 7 nights in this hotel. All of the staff was most helpful, particularly Marina, the concierge, but everyone went out of their way to see that we were taken care of. Hotel is very convenient to subway, as well as lots of restaurants and shopping. Room was adequate size, I can't compare with others in Tokyo, but certainly I've had much smaller traveling in Europe. Most importantly, it was impeccably clean. Breakfast buffet offers ample choices - whether one is looking for a Japanese or American breakfast.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Our stay at the Courtyard was about what you may expect from any other Courtyard worldwide. You can tell the property is relatively new and several training issues need to be worked out with the staff on service. The room were a nice size by Tokyo standards and very nicely equipped. Perhaps the best feature of the hotel is the location with numerous dining, shopping, entertainment and transportation options around. If you are a Marriott loyalist, I would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I spent 4 nights in this hotel and the service was good. The price was also OK. The area was great for shopping and some good restaurants nearby. Try the Tsukiji Fish market when you are in this hotel. I would definitely book again in this hotel when I am in Tokyo!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I spent 2 nights here (2 rooms with 3 friends). I don't have any complaints and would stay here again.Big Pluses- Location it is less than a 5 min walk to shopping and restaurants- Seven minute walk to the Metro- Free breakfast, beat some 5-star I have been to (for Gold and higher)- Rooms- Staff- Free drink for elites at the bar- Easy to get to Narita on the Airport Limousine Bus (which is about US$30)- Fast Internet (some hotels really need help with this)

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We loved the location and the ambiance of this hotel. The concierge Marina was fantastic and made life so easy with her directions, organization and helpfulness. Lounges etc good and breakfast was good..plenty of choice. A great start to a great holiday.i think it is good value for money and we will stay there again on our next visit.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This Courtyard has friendly staffs and brochures for attraction and direction. It is a good location because it is 1-3 blocks away from everything. 2 blocks away from a good shopping and business street. 2 blocks away from restaurants. 3 blocks away from the subway lines. 5 blocks away from the sushi market. We did not want to be in busy loud area so this was perfect for us. The room was good size and clean and we got free breakfast.
user_name:
Minh O
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for four nights over the New Year period 2013/14 and found the hotel to be in an ideal location for shopping, dining and access to the subway. The hotel staff are outstandingly courteous, hospitable and efficient and nothing was too much trouble for them. This included a delightful and knowledgeable female concierge, who treated all of our enquiries regarding directions and attractions with utmost patience and accuracy. The hotel is also an easy 10 minute walk to the Tokyo Fish Market and located just around the corner from an underground walkway to the nearest subway station. When we departed the hotel to catch the Shinkansen to Kyoto the porter arranged for a complimentary taxi to take us and our luggage to the central Tokyo railway station. There is also an alcohol/grocery store located adjacent and a number of traditional ramen restaurants worth visiting down some of the side streets nearby.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is an expensive place but service was cold. Got luggage? Help yourself. Not to mention no lounge or not much space for upgrade for Marriott elites. Breakfast was pretty nice though, with a full spread of western option plus some Japanese options. I wish they have more Japanese options. Room is small but this is Ginza so not much complaint about that. Bed is comfortable. Bathroom clean. I did hear noise from nearby rooms. Reasonable walk to Ginza line, but long walk to JR Shimbashi or JR Yurakucho. They do have some written guides of Tokyo attractions for you to grab on a table near the elevator, but I guess this is because too many people ask such question and they want to save time. Again, service is mechanic and not very personal for this kind of property. Next time probably book another place.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The Courtyard is at Ginza which has great shopping and great restaurants - both top rated (if you want that special night) and inexpensive if you just want great food at low pricesThe hotel has a great breakfast (buffet style) and a bar that offers wine at reasonable pricesInternet is free if you join the Marriott club

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I took the opportunity to have a 3 day stop over whilst returning from Vancouver BC to Brisbane Australia. The Marriot was my hotel, well the service was second to none, the staff were ultra friendly and could not do enough to see me happy!The room was excellent and food lovely, the Marriot is in a great location within a 10 minute walk to all the shops and restaurants you could want. I loved Tokyo and this is definitely somewhere I want to return to and stay and see more of,Enjoy.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Good location, a short walk from the subway. Also close to the best of Tokyo shopping if you're looking for high-end international brands and Tokyo's mammoth department stores. A little less nightlife than other Tokyo neighborhoods if that's your thing. The hotel's rooms are Bland, basic, clean, and Tokyo-sized (small). You may also hear some noise from your neighbors. Excellent staff and service, and a very nice Buffet breakfast make this a comfortable base in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Extended my stay in Tokyo for one night and chose the courtyard, little did I realize what a great location it's in, everything within two blocks, great shops and restaurants. The hotel is clean and the breakfast buffet fantastic

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: For year end qualify stay I had to stay here again (with great hesitation...please read my previous review). I still dont' get why this hotel is considered level 6 on Marriott, this is like level 2 in American standard. Cheap amenity (no name brand soap, ready to fall apart toothbrush, poor wifi). Building is very old, Marriott got really poor deal on this hotel M&A. And yes, people are still smoking indoor at this hotel and staff won't care. Great. Room is...well, after my complaint they gave me upgrade (wait, I should get free upgrade through Marriott loyalty membership!) I like the new coffee maker they installed. Closet is small and barely fit my luggage. Bathtub is poorly made or maintained, don't take bath, just take shower. The bottom of bath is all scratched up from God knows what. House keepers are okay, compare to other hotels in Japan, poor quality. Room service was great, very prompt. When you check in, and if you are Marriott gold member, be sure to ask for meal coupon. They don't offer it unless you ask. again, poor service. Restaurant has been renovated since my last stay, and this is the best part. Open kitchen with great selection of breakfast. Front staff is still the same, I remember the bozo who was nasty to me 6 and 2 years ago, yeah he's still there, acting like a jerk, pretending to be busy, but I finally figure out how to deal with their racial profiling and my recent stay was not bad...

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Unbeatable location and good value for money too though it seemed to get a lot more expensive over the weekend. Loved the breakfast here. Many Japanese dishes available. Also loved the bar downstairs. Excellent atmosphere. The whole hotel is nicely lighted, providing a good ambience. Service was top too and everything the right snug size.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Came here for a work trip and was pleasantly surprised at the general atmosphere of the hotel. I've stayed at Courtyards in the U.S. before, and they seem very vanilla compared. The breakfast buffet is somewhat pricey, but know that you can order off the menu and get just what you want for probably less money. The staff was consistently friendly and helpful. Located in a very popular are close to many restaurants and shops.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Hotel is in good location, easy looking of it, near fish market and big station, clean room and room area is larger than most hotels in Tokyo , nice r restroom, besides has alot of restaurants, metro, train station

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This was my 3rd or 4th stay here. This hotel is not fancy to look at but its well maintained and I always have a comfortable stay here. The people at the front desk do whatever they can to make your stay successful. The breakfast buffet is delicious with an omelette station every day. Best apple juice Ive ever had here. Theres an iron and full sized board i every room. The elevator reads your room key and selects the floor for you. In the hallways they play bird sounds and crickets chriping sounds instead of playing bad musak all day. Small details that make this hotel a pleasure. The location is fantastic - we never had to take a taxi and walked to shopping and food places all around Ginza over the weekend. For the Americans theres a Denny's right across the street for a quick western meal. Highly recommend this hotel for access to Ginza and the main Tokyo train station (only a 5 min taxi ride away). I was upgraded on the last night to the executive room on the top floor. so spacious for a Tokyo downtown hotel. I highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Polite staff, very quiet and clean room, great location. Outstanding breakfast buffet. As a platinum member, we received free breakfast and drink coupons plus free Internet service. We enjoyed our stay at courtyard Ginza.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is the place to stay in Tokyo! It's in a great location, wonderful room, and the service of the staff is warm, friendly, fun, and extremely helpful. My husband has stayed here several times. This was my second stay, and it keeps getting better. The front desk staff speak very good English, but my husband enjoyed practicing his Japanese with them. At the front desk, Kang-san, Yamashita-san, and May Mon Win were especially wonderful. They made our stay here feel like home. We stayed for about five days, then went to Kyoto and Hiroshima, and then came back to Tokyo and were re-welcomed like long-lost friends! The breakfast buffet was excellent with great variety of Asian and non-Asian foods, and the service there and also at the lobby bar was also very good. The hotel is a very short walk to the metro, which is very easy to use. Get a Pasmo card! There are also many great restaurants within a short walk. There is very high-end shopping on the main street, but check out GU! It's amazingly inexpensive with very stylish clothes. Also, being a platinum elite member gets you free breakfast and free wifi.The only down side to visiting Tokyo is that there is no partner bank for Bank of America, so make sure to get your yen at home and bring enough, so you won't need an ATM, since the fees are quite high. This, obviously, is not the fault of the hotel--it's something our bank needs to work out..but just be aware and check to see if YOUR bank has branches here.One huge amazing note: we happened to mention that we were going to a restaurant for my husband's birthday, and about five minutes later,there was a knock on the door and he was presented with a beautiful fruit tart with a happy birthday message--so thoughtful!! We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great simple place in the heart of Ginza. 1. Rooms were very decent sized, with western style bathtub and toilet. We were offered free wifi. Overall very clean, as is expected in Japan. 2. Breakfast- we had buffet breakfast as part of our travel package. Modest in size, but caters to western and eastern breakfast regimens. 3. Small but clean gym. Had 3 treadmills and 3 ellipticals, as well as weights. I didn't use it much but was satisfied. 4. Located near shopping districts, if that is your vice. 5. Service with a smile. English is not a problem. 6. Close to several subway stations for easy commuting. Overall - would recommend for a cozy, no frills spot in Ginza.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The Courtyard Marriott is a more western style hotel and lots of the guests staying there are businessmen and women. As the rooms were smaller, to fit our family of seven we needed three rooms.The hotel is in such a great location. Ginza is is famous for its upmarket shopping, dining and entertainment district. It is close to public transport, the fish market and other cultural attractions.We really enjoyed the amenities and the service at the hotel :- Staff were very helpful to us when we arrived late at night and for our entire stay- They gave us coupons for cheaper buffet breakfasts. The buffet breakfast was fantastic and a great start for the day for the kids. We ate lots at a late breakfast and then just had snacks and dinner.- They have a fab set of tourist guides which explain clearly in English how you can make your way via public transport to major tourist attractions.They organised our shuttle to the airport (after a day at DisneySea we felt public transport would be too much for the kids and we were right as even the older two kids slept on the bus. -The gym is very small but functional.- While they don't actually have activities for the kids, they were very accommodating and attentive to our kids.You can see my full review here http://planningwithkids.com/2013/11/19/tokyo-with-kids-hotel-and-sightseeing-2/

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great location near to two subways, walking distance from fish markets. The rooms are fantastic - we were on the top floor and the room included a sofa and lounge area. Bathroom well fitted out and incredibly good toiletries range was provided. Kimonos in the rooms were a nice touch. Rooms were very clean and appeared new. Marina the concierge was one of the best concierges ever - friendly, efficient and informative. The gym is small but has all you need. The lounge is great as is the bar on the lower level. All the staff are extremely helpful, friendly and knowledgeable, making this hotel an absolute pleasure to stay in. We will be back!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Close to everything in Ginza area. Excellent very clean. A great spot to say. A good portion of the staff speaks english. Nice breakfast buffet. If you don't want there's a Tully's right next door. Really nice bar in basement which seemed kinda weird but turned out to be really cool. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: From nartia took the skylines to ueno station. Cost was 2400 yen, then transfer to ginza line to ginza station 160 yen. Transit is around 90 minutes, there is some walking involved between ueno stn to ginza line, and from ginza stn to hotel. It can be quite complicated when you first emerge above ground. At ginza station, take exit A3 and then walk on the main road until you see ferragamo on your right hand side. You will pass prada and You will see a very big uniglo, before ferragamo. Turn right at the ferragamo intersection, if you see zara, you went to far. Then walk about 4 blocks towards the hotel, it will be on your left hand side. The hotel is also very close to higashi ginza stn. There is a Lawson variety store at the close to the main entrance, you can buy snacks here. Reco to go to Yokohama, fun day!Breakfast was good, usually 2400 yen, we paid 1500 yen bc I am a silver marriott elite member. Apparently,if you are Gold, breakfast is free. Internet is free with a marriott rewards card.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed one night at the hotel , roughly it met my expectations( in high season period)Positive:Staffs, cleanness, location Negative :Small room, bathroom ( small, shower curtain), a little expensive And,,,,Out of ordinary!!!!! No free wifi in hotel ??? In Japan!!!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Really??? Level 6 hotel? Just to start location is great, stop here. Constant smell of smoke in the lobby, Poor service at the Oasis lounge, same workers making same mistakes, first night worker was very sick, with runny nose and cough attempting to serve us drinks and food, just gross, where the Manager? Girls during day taking forever to serve gin/tonic, asked for teaset, got it 30 minutes later and never received tea, when we asked them about it, they were apologetic, but not sure they aware that for afternoon tea, tea set should be accompanied by tea; they still charged us for full amount, tea included, asked for the drink to go they make you to commit into brining dishes back after you done and room service would not take care of it . Breakfast buffet sucks, and evening even worse, choices limited and servants look like they are lost, they do not clean tables and you have no choices, but to pile up dishes on the table as you proceed with "BUFFET" or just walk away that you would not be embarrassed. Mediocre at its best. Poor management.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: If you plan to spend no time 'hanging out' in your hotel room, you can keep reading. The rooms are tiny, sterile and uncomfortable for anything other than sleep. The bathrooms are tiny and offer no extra amenities...I had to ask for conditioner.That said, the rooms are very clean. The workout room is sufficient for the average workout. The breakfast buffet is fabulous! The front desk service outstanding. The location is exceptional. If you like to spend some time in your room or the hotel lounges to wind down after the day, I would look elsewhere. If you want a base from which to launch sightseeing or daily business in the Ginza district, I think you will be satisfied.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I had to come to Tokyo on business at very short notice and ended up staying at the Courtyard Marriott Ginza. The hotel is rather bland and somewhat dated. That being said, the rooms are well maintained, clean and although small, perfectly adequate. The bathroom particularly is rather cramped but again is in line with a 3 start hotel. Breakfast has a very good range of both Japanese and Western options of cereals, breads, fruit, yogurts and omelettes. The room service menu is rather limited but there are many options available in Ginza which is right on the doorstep. For the best sushi in Tokyo, try Kuybei which is just around the corner... amazing!!! Service in the hotel is efficient, polite and always helpful and the staff work hard to make ones stay an enjoyable one. Overall a perfectly acceptable option for a short business stay.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This Courtyard meets or exceeds it's three star rating. It is pretty utilitarian, there is nothing glitzy, romantic, or glamorous about it. My room was basic and clean, with a superb view of the air conditioning compressors. There is great free internet as a Marriott Rewards member. You will also receive a breakfast discount, so don't forget to bring your membership number.The hotel has a great location, 3 blocks from the heart of Ginza. The fish market is an easy 10 minute walk, and the subway station is five minutes. You can also get here from Narita on an Airport Express bus for about $30. It's the third stop and drops you right at the front door.The staff is very friendly and helpful, and there is an adequate gym in the hotel for working out. This is sometimes difficult to find in Tokyo hotels, but the Courtyard has weights, machines, and treadmills to keep you fit.Overall, you'll stay here for the location, accessibility, and Yankee style familiarity. For business, it is also quite useful. However, if you want charm or luxury, there are other choices that you might find more suitable.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The Courtyard by Marriott Ginza Hotel is a great hotel with very friendly staff and well-presented rooms, far above the usual Courtyard standards. The people in this hotel are fantastic and go out of their way to help. I have stayed here many times and most of the staff recognizes me even if they may forget my name or cannot pronounce it. It is small and over recent years the only Marriott property in Tokyo which is a missed opportunity for Marriott. Fortunately they have seen the light and will have two new properties in Tokyo in 2014 but I will probably continue at this hotel because of its great location in the heart of Ginza

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My husband and I stayed in Tokyo October 2013 for 3 nights. First, I am a gold elite member with Marriott, we were upgraded to a room on the top floor and got free breakfast daily. Our room was large and comfortable with a seating area. The bathroom was wonderful (two sinks, separated toilet and shower, and a large tub that one could also shower in). The breakfast had a good amount of variety, western and Japanese. There were a variety of cereals, hot items, fruits, meats and lox, and others. They would prepare made to order omelettes.We did not spend a ton of time in the lobby, but got some advice from the concierge who was enthusiastic. My only complaint would be the construction going on in the hotel during the day to upgrade bathrooms. We were not informed of this before our stay. We were able to walk to Tokyo station in approximately 20 minutes with luggage. All in all, this was a great base for our stay in tokyo, near the imperial palace, shopping in ginza, and the fish market.
user_name:
opalk
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I have been coming to this hotel (different chains) for over 15 years. Whilst not the most modern hotel in the world I always feel welcome when I walk up to the reception desk and the staff are always keen to help. The public areas are a little tired and small but value for money in Tokyo is sometimes hard to find. I stay about three times a year and often head to other cities before my night flight home. The airport limo is a great way to get to Narita on the way home and the staff are always helpful to hold the luggage until departure time. Room size is adequate and breakfast is a good selection and quick. Location is central to the Ginza and the subway and only a yen970 (us$10.00) cab fare from Central station. I will keep coming back!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Yeah I know...a brand loyal guy giving another nod to Marriott Courtyard. But this was less than what I hoped for. The room furnishings are getting tired and the public spaces in this hotel are less than inviting. I found the staff to be ambivalent to foreigners who are the mainstay support for a foreign hotel brand. Half our group stayed a block away at the Gracery, and if I wasn't getting the points for the stay, I would have considered moving. That's the perils of brand loyalty. The breakfast buffet food is decent. The best part of the hotel is the location and the concierge named Marnie. She has great suggestions of where to eat. Take her up on local knowledge. Otherwise, go in to this property eyes wide open!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Compare to other international chain hotels at this price, I vote for Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza. The room is spacious. Breakfast is unbeatable. Location is not far away from main street of Ginza. Nearby there are a lot of restaurants and convenient stores, also, department store.From Narita or Haneda airport, you can take Keisei train then connect to a metro to get-off at Higashiginza station. It is 100-200 meters away.Business traveller may like this hotel as well.However, if you have a budget constraint, you may try other cheaper hotels in exchanges with half of the space you have from Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza......
user_name:
Anucha T
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Our group of eight (two families: four adults, two 13 yr olds, two 11 yr olds) stayed here Sept. 28-30. We wanted a standard western style hotel as we adjusted to the time difference and this fit the bill. The location is good: easy access to the Ginza district, the fish market and the subway. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast.One note about traveling as a family in Japan: hotel rooms with two queen sized beds are very, very rare. Rooms tend to be either a queen or two fulls. Given the ages and temperaments of our kids, we were able to rent a queen room for my husband and I and the kids were in the room next door on two full beds. Our friends' kids are not quite so independent so they had two adjoining rooms, each with full beds. Rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable.The hotel concierge helped us with dinner reservations and the hotel had a variety of preprinted sheets with info on various neighborhoods/sights which was very helpful.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: What can I say, this is an international hotel chain. It feels about the same in Tokyo as it does in Beijing as it does in the good old USA. Its clean and comfortable, but a bit of walk from the subway with luggage.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: What more can I say. It's a Courtyard. It is clean, bright, and staffed by incredibly polite and helpful people. It's in a great location near the Ginza shopping district, and easy walk to lots of shopping and night life. Metro stop is a 3 minute walk. Rooms are small (as you would expect in Tokyo), clean, and fairly up to date. Lots of nice little amenities, like toothpaste and shaving gel in supply without even having to ask.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Location is great.Tsukiji and Ginza is very close. The hotel looks a bit worn out and might need rennovation.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stay here some times. The location is just near Higashi-Ginza station and Ginza station, so the transportation is easy. Nearby quiet, but busy area just in the distance of stone throw. Easy to get food and go shopping. Additionally, very close to fish market Tsukiji. If you like fish food, do not miss that location. You just can visit there by foot around 10 minutes.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Only spent 8 hours in the hotel, as was out at 3:30am to catch a flight, and had had a really busy week leading up to it, so sleep took precendence.Room was pretty decent, two slightly bigger than single beds, decent shower (shower curtain always a negative) and very clean.Room is pretty tight, two people would be squeezing past each other at times, didn't get a chance to sample the restaraunts or any of the hotel facilities

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I returned to the Courtyard Ginza, because of the location, near the shopping area of Ginza and the subway.I got the nice surprise of the improved restaurant, where they serve breakfast. Now is more modern and as well the quality of the food is much wider and better.I have the Marriott gold card and for the first time I got the voucher for the free breakfast, another nice surprise.The service is always excellent and even if the rooms are small, I consider a very good choice for Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My daughter was picked to play Baseball in Osaka so we were going to Japan. Not knowing much about the country we chose to fly into Tokyo and spend a few days in Tokyo. Well being a novice traveler one cannot pick a better location than Courtyard at Ginza. The staff is exceptional at making sure they meet all your needs. English in no problem and for first time travelers they go out of their way to answer questions. We were able to exchange money right at the desk and then we were able to go across the street to Denny's and take money out of the ATM, even a better at a better rate of exchange. The rooms are modern and comfortable but if you have a family you will need two for four people. The breakfast was one of the best I have ever had in a hotel and worth every cent. We ate so well that some days we just went straight to dinner. The food is a mix of Western and Asian. Great location as Denny's, Starbucks and the Ginza shopping area are a treat to see. The hotel is located near the Fish market and the Imperial gardens. Beds, bathrooms and amenities are what you would expect from a Marriott so take the guess work out and stay here. When I do get back to Japan for more baseball this will be my first stop.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We had a great experience staying at this hotel with our 2 sons, ages 4 and 8. Very firnedly staff. Want to call out the concierge at this property -- she was extraordinarily helpful. Always provided tips re tourist destinations and travel. Good food at the cafe too.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is a nice hotel located in th heart of Ginza, close to metro and shopping. Room was nice, good size for the Japanese standard, everything clean and modern. Buffet breakfast was good with continental and Japanese/Asian food. Good stay.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is a nice hotel if you are doing an overnight in Tokyo. It's efficient, professional and location is great - close to metro and shopping. Room was standard size but little added touches, such as the robe and origami swan on the bed, made it truly welcoming. Bathroom was clean and modern.Buffet dinner at the restaurant was outstanding and staff, especially Ms Kang, were very helpful.
user_name:
NOIDK
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed here last year APR so maybe better for now.Myself was Marriott gold member but, no membership recognized at check-in and nothing special for tier members such as No upgrade, No breakfast, Not even one bottle of water. I know this is Ginza, Tokyo but at least WIFI?? NO WIFI in ROOM! only available in lobby area.Staff in general kind and helpful and easy trip by limousine from NRT. Clean rooms but, small. I will not go back or commanding to any Marriott members unless they change their attitude for their own royal members.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stopped in Tokyo on our way back from a business trip to Hong Kong. We wanted a hotel that was well situated for everything and also not a mega-hotel. This Courtyard is probably one of the best in the world. Nice rooms, great staff, 2 restaurants, 2 bars, walking distance to the subway, the BEST shopping location, and on the last pick up / first drop off for tour buses and the hotel shuttle. The concierge there is particularly helpful. She did not give up finding us a Teppanyaki restaurant on a Saturday night (most were full) - and she found a great one.
user_name:
Maryann B
Salt Lake City, Utah

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed 3 nights in Tokyo during a transist from Los Angeles.The hotel is splendid and ideally located at the heart of shopping and restaurants in Ginza, Tokyo.It is within minutes of walk to famous branded stores suh as prada, burberry, A&F etc.. and easily accessible by JR and subways. Stayed at the premium level due to my platinum status and the room is spacious and clean compared to other hotels in Tokyo.There is also a direct limousine bus from the airport to the hotel.The staff are polite and always at their utmost to serve you.They do not have a concierge lounge but the restaurant offers a well-spread of both western and Japanese breakfast buffet spread.Can consider one of the best hotels in Tokyo situated in Ginza area and I will definitely choose this hotel again for my next visit.Dr E. Chow

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed at the Courtyard, sight unseen, and I couldn't have been happier with my choice.My stay was during the last week of August and while it is HOT in Tokyo in August, the hotel provided an excellent base to venture out and truly experience Tokyo. With its Ginza location you are a short walk from the subway, the famous Tokyo Fish Market, the famous shopping strips and a multitude of excellent restaurant choices. Further, throughout my week in Tokyo, as I ventured to the other main areas of the city, I repeatedly reaffirmed my choice and would happily stay at the Courtyard again. Getting there was a cinch, as the Airport Limo from Narita Airport stops right in front of the hotel and runs essentially on the hour. As for the hotel facilities itself, the rooms are big for Tokyo, the service was excellent and the Staff is bi-lingual, which is a relief after spending a day struggling to use the same 10 Japanese words to accomplish life in Tokyo. My one complaint (and a common one here), is their internet connectivity. It is poor at best and for the life of me I cannot imagine why they don't get it fixed, as there were many who were frustrated by it.The on-site restaurants were excellent as well, with fairly good prices by Tokyo hotel standards.All in all, the Courtyard is a great choice for any visitor, but particularly useful to the first timer. The prices are excellent and the location can't be beat. Reserve your stay in confidence. You won't be disappointed. Spoiler Alert: There is NO swimming pool.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Finishing up our Japan tour after a tiring few days in Kyoto, finding the hotel within 10 minutes is great, especially in the heat. Location was superb, accessible via 3 stations: Higashi-ginza (closest), Ginza and Shimbashi. This pretty much covers all the lines we needed to use regardless of where we were going. It was a relatively quiet and clean area but you'll be surprised to find all the shopping just the next street away! So many restaurants as well in the area. Lawsons is just around the corner too if you need something urgently. The hotel immediately took our luggage and handled it for us all the way up to the room. We only had to take care of ourselves. Check in was easy, smooth and it was nice to come into comfortable and cooling room. The room was nicely decorated and sheets wonderful to sleep in. They also had a yukata in the wardrobe for you to use, nice touch of Japanese culture. The room even has a power socket that has an in-build international converter so any sort of plugs can be used through there. Staff were extremely service orientated. Wifi in-room available with signing up of Marriott card foc, lobby has wifi. Reliable and quick internet, no complaints. They had suggested activities for guests, front desk was helpful with advice on attractions and English was not a problem. I also booked this hotel because the limousine buses to the airport stops here. The hotel saved us so much hassle since we were all going to different airports and terminals. We just needed to tell them the time, turn up and follow their instructions. If you can, get the pass that includes the TM one day ticket for 100 yen more as well, very worth it. Each ride on the metro usually costs at least 160 yen one way. A very convenient option especially if you don't want to spend time finding out where to book, how to book etc. although we did that. All in all, nearby everything and even if public transport is necessary, it is only a 5 minute walk away. It was so easy to get around anywhere around Tokyo staying here and our stay was pleasant and hassle free. If anything, the hotel assisted us in making our last stop a stress-free and comfortable one, without the heavy price tag.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: One block from kabuki theatre in Ginza. Best lunch value in town, $10 for soup, salad, curry with rice, and desert with coffee. Room more than adequate. Best part was free with Marriott points. Great location, but a bit of walk from Tokyo Station with luggage, so spend $5 for cab. Walk to fish market, to boat rides on river, to anywhere in Ginza. Usual Japanese service, great by any standards. Free Internet if rewards member. I will stay here again, you bet.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed at this hotel during a business trip in August 2013. I travel to Japan on business about once per quarter. The company I visit normally puts me up in a business hotel near their offices in the Aoyama District. On my most recent trip to Japan, I was only stopping for one night before traveling the next day on a domestic flight out of Haneda. This gave me the perfect opportunity to stay at this hotel, and I am glad that I did.I should mention that I am at an elite level with Marriott, which gives me a few amenities free of charge that others would have to pay to receive. I was given a normal sized room, which was huge by Japanese standards. I was also given breakfast free of charge. The breakfast was a nice buffet with eggs to order, fresh fruit, oatmeal, pastries, etc. The hotel is a very short walk from the Higashi-Ginza subway station. I traveled to the hotel from Haneda and returned the following day via this station. An amateur traveler can navigate the Tokyo subway fairly easily, and the hotel is conveniently located nearby. The area also has many stores and restaurants. I would also be remiss if I did not mention the friendliness of the staff. I arrived late into the hotel, and the hotel staff greeted me by name even before I showed them my passport. They were awaiting my arrival. Tokyo tends to be a very expensive city for business travelers. One might expect to pay a lot for this hotel, but I have paid far more and gotten far less. This hotel is less expensive than many inferior hotels in the city. Great location, great staff, and a great price make this hotel one that I hope to patronize again in the future.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I travel to Tokyo every couple of months. Have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions and just did again this week.Location is great if you are a subway user like me and need to move around a lot. Two stations within 3-4 minutes of the hotel. Its on the doorstep of the Ginza district so easy to pop out and find numerous restaurants and if your wife is along for the visit then she can shop at many stores.Rooms are kind of small ( but thats a common issue in Japan) but very well maintained and exceptionally clean. I like fact that you dont pay for Internet ( just make sure you are Marriott member of any level... its free) Staff are very polite and friendly. I tried breakfast in hotel on recent trips and was overly excited and thought expensive, so I dont eat there anymore, just pop out to one of many coffeee shops close by, or Dennys right over the street.And the price for Tokyo is always at lower end of what you normally pay. Can often be fully booked so make sure you do it in advance.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Although I stay only one night in this hotel, I can say it is very good. The area where it is located is the heart of shopping in Tokyo. Additionally, the Central Metro Station is near as well as the Hop-on/Hop off bus stations that go around the city. Staff is very friendly and most importantly, is room amenities are complete. As part of their oriental touch, instead of including a robe the provide you with a kimono, excellent detail!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: spend one nite only in courtyard marriot for a transit before leaving for nagoya. it was really good location with a quiet neighborhood. if you love bars and cafe and night life it would not be suitable for you, however many minimarts and small cafe, bakeries nearby. we loved it as it was close to tsukiji fish market. the airport bus also drop you directly in front of the hotel lobby. room is really small but still can fit extra bed. evertyhing was so clean, neat and functional. it was a good quality hotel considering ginza area is an expensive place.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for three nights before and after a brief Japan tour. An excellent hotel in an ideal location. Much better than the three star rating I believe it is given.Very(!!) helpful staff, good breakfast with choice of Japanese or Western. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The location is great, in Ginza and close to the JR Station. The lobby is grand. The staff are helpful and friendly, we arrived a bit early and they were so nice as to give us complimentary passes to the bar for beer and coffee while we waited for the room to be ready. The room is of decent size, with good bedding and a pair of nice kimono. We stayed there in March of 2012
user_name:
Ron S
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We spent a week at the Marriott Courtyard Ginza and couldn't be happier. As you walk out the secured area into the public area of the Narita airport we were facing the desk for the bus that would take us directly to the Marriott Courtyard Ginza. They call it the Airport Limousine or Friendly Airport Limousine. The ticket purchase was quick and easy (35 Yen per person, cash or credit) and the bus left in maybe 20 minutes. They stow your luggage for you under the air conditioned bus and drop you off right at the hotel's front door. There is a desk right inside the hotel to make reservations for when you need to return to the airport. We were upgraded to a Premium room (11th floor) which had lots of room , two bathrooms, a massage chair, a sauna, and heated toilet seats. TV reception was excellent with, I believe, four English channels including CNN, Bloomberg, and a FOX movie channel. There were bird sounds chirping in the hall in the morning and an English newspaper at our door every day. I found the wireless internet connection to be excellent, both on a laptop and an Ipod. I used it every day and never had any problems. It's hard to beat Japanese service. Every member of the Courtyard Ginza front desk staff was extremely helpful, making calls for us for tour and restaurant reservations, breaking our Yen to smaller denominations for subway trips, answering all questions in English. Most, if not all of the front desk staff appeared to read English as well. We mentioned a couple of festivals when we arrived and the next day we were surprised by a personal letter under our door from the concierge explaining each festival and giving us directions on how to get there. They have a rack with papers in the lobby on popular Tokyo sites, how to get there, even how much each leg of the subway or train trip costs. The paper rack is right next to the concierge desk to the left of the elevators. It's an easy walk from the hotel to the fish market, Kabuki theatre, train/subway stops. One train change gets you to the Disney parks. We ate the discounted hotel breakfast twice (15 Yen for Marriott members) and thought it was excellent, mostly American but also some Japanese items...nice mix. There is a Denny's directly across the street (you have to walk a half block down, cross the street then back to get to it). We ate there once but didn't like it and didn't go back. Not your typical American Denny's. There's lots of Japanese places to eat. I suggest very early in your stay you go out the Marriott's front door, turn left and just start walking. Many restaurants have plastic food plates in the window showing you the dishes. That seems to be a big thing in Tokyo. It's not too appetizing to us but It helped. We would just point to a dish we wanted. Many windows also have pictures of the dishes as do some menus. We tried McDonalds, once, maybe six or so blocks away. Disappointing. We hoped for some Japanese type items but it was just like in the U.S. although the fish sandwich did have shrimp in it. Don't miss the Food Court at the Mitkusoshi department store (floor B2), maybe a 4-5 block walk. You will be amazed. We arrived as it opened (10AM) and were the first one in. They have lots of people behind the counter and each one gave a deep bow as we passed (since they weren't yet busy waiting on customers). There is counter after counter of all kinds of prepared foods and pastries.Try their Bento boxes. The Japanese people were courteous, friendly and very helpful. Many times we were looking at a map, either on the street on a subway train and someone would come up to us and ask if they could help. Most spoke a little English but some volunteered to help with no English at all. The Marriott Courtyard Ginza....we had a great experience there from start to finish with excellent service and would highly recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: First of all it s not Marriott which I know at alll, not big room , only u 'll enjoy the restaurant coz it s western, the staff s good but again not as u this , coz I saw Marriott other country, nooo it s totally different

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Tokyo is a delightful city but not easy on the traveler in terms of value/service for the money. The Courtyard is hands down the best value in Tokyo considering its location, quality, room size and amenities. The size of the rooms is large by any standard and MUCH larger than anything else I’ve seen in Tokyo. The bathroom portion of my last room at the Courtyard was literally bigger than other full hotel rooms for the price in Tokyo. The 10th and 11th floors have the largest rooms and many of these are large enough for families and certainly large enough to conduct business in. Most of these are split into sleeping portions and a large living portion. They are not all laid out the same, and some have large meeting-room-style desks sectioned off from the sleeping area so you don’t need to book a meeting room as you would with other hotels.The location is equidistant from the various business areas and not far from most tourist destinations. A great deal of shopping as well as parks well-worth long walks are within a short stroll. A multitude of local and international style restaurants are also nearby. Can’t be beat!

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed here on two different occasions during a trip to Japan. The hotel has a great location in the heart of Tokyo. It is on a major street and just two blocks off the Ginza itself. The Ginza features lots of high end shops which are very overpriced. The famous fish market is an easy walk from the hotel but opens at 4 AM and closes early. It is a short taxi ride to the main railroad station. The hotel is also within walking distance of the Imperial Palace and its gardens. The rooms are small but very nice and quiet. The bath was very tiny. The room was neat and clean The airport bus from Narita airport stops right in front of the hotel. Travel time to the aiport is a bit over one hour by bus. You can buy a ticket at the hotel. The food in the main restaurant is delicious but high priced like most things in the area. Breakfast was about $25 per person. For lower food prices try Denny's across the street from the Courtyard. There is also a second restaurant in the basement and a bar in the lobby which offers drinks and snacks. There is no pool nor spa at this hotel. WIFI was free and the staff offered good service. Tokyo is a high priced city with the Courtyard being a good value for its location (and the price of other central Tokyo hotels).

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed here on the way home from Bangkok.The rooms are small but very nice and quiet. The Limousine bus from Narita stops right in front of the hotel. It is approximately 1.2 hours by this bus. You buy the first ticket at the airport. For the return, buy the ticket at the hotel and charge to your room. It costs about $10.00 each way.The food in the restaurant is delicious.There is no pool nor spa but I was unable to uncheck the rating below.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Location is unbeatable. It is an older hotel located in the heart of the city with 5-10 minutes walking distance to both JR (Shimbashi) and Several Subway lines (Hibiya, Marunouchi, and Ginza Line). Close to great shopping area and eateries and lots of nightlife. (For ladies traveling alone, definately be careful for drunken male at late night). It is 15 minutes distance from the Imperial palance with great jogging trail. The facility and amenity at the hotel is a bit lack. The hotel just started providing wifi (since about a year ago). The gym is what you would expect of a courtyard, and not a regular Marriott. Cafe onsite is so-so, but the Japanese restaurant on the lower level has a pretty good Japanese lunch set menu. Rooms are decent size for Tokyo but definately not the regular American size room.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This is a very nice hotel in an excellent location and it is available at a price that will not blow your budget away. I have stayed at this Courtyard five or six times and found it to be more than adequate each time. The location is superb right in the heart of Ginza. It is within walking distance of the Higashi-Ginza and Nihombashi Metro stations. There is also an airport bus that makes a stop at the hotel which is a very useful amenity. Each time I have stayed, my check-in and check-out experiences have always been very efficient and the staff were always friendly and helpful. The rooms are adequate as they are a bit larger than most Japanese hotels but not nearly as large as those in the US Courtyards. Nonetheless, I have always found them clean and reasonably comfortable. I think the biggest drawback to the facility is that it only has two elevators. That makes for some logjams in the morning on occasion. The breakfast buffet is very good and I was particularly happy with the choices on my recent visit. If you want to save a little money, however, there is a Denny's across the street (and I have taken that option before). For what you get, the price is not bad though it rides the edge of my budget just a bit. But the room rate is actually quite fair considering the location and the prices offered by other similar hotels in the area. In all, this is a very good hotel and I would consider staying again here if it is convenient for my business.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Having read. Tripadvisor reviews before booking I was prepared for the long drive in from Narita Airpot. Frankly I didn't mind as I wanted to check out the scenery anyway. I am a huge baseball fan and it was nice to see all the ball fields and the kids working out. If you didn't know better you would think you were back home in the US. The hotel staff couldn't have been more accommodating. The hotel is in a great location with easy access to all the shopping and restaurants you could ever want. I did dine at the hotel restaurant bar one evening. Service was good but seemed a bit disingenuous. There were free snacks still out but I was told it was too late yet several guests were still happily helping themselves, so that was a bit disappointing. There seemed to be a good mix of locals and international guests at this hotel in general, and I took that to be a good sign. I'd definitely stay here again. The rooms would be a little small for my family of 4, but that is to be expected most everywhere in Japan.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: *** Let’s start with the good:Excellent location, city center not too far from Tokyo train station, and Haneda airport (but far from Narita airport).The entire hotel is extremely clean.Very comfortable bed.Free internet (for Marriott members) with both WiFi and cable. Bandwidth was reasonable.Good bathtub with good water pressure.Ultra-modern “Toto” bidet in toilet.Friendly helpful and efficient staff, including concierge and a very helpful front office manager.I checked in 10:00 AM instead of 14:00 and the room was available at no extra price.*** The badThere’s no bottled drinking water in the room, you have to pay for each drop of water you take from the minibarLight switches somehow confusing.Air-condition has no temperature settings, just a switch choosing from 0 to 3Bathrobe and slippers are very small sized, is this hotel intended to be only for small people?Theirs is no one standing outside of the hotel entrance door to help you with the luggage. You have to go in call someone to help you before the taxi leaves. However, once they see you, you get all the help.Business center is a disaster, not manned at all, you have to insert coins to get service, but there’s no help in English.And the worst of all, this hotel is by far overpriced.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Courtyard marriot was a fantastic hotel for our short stay in Tokyo. Central location in Ginza. The hotel was fantastic in every way. Wonderful friendly efficient and helpful staff. The staff were able to understand English and were very polite and helpful in all aspects of our stay.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Ginza is one of the top areas in Tokyo. Lots of great places to eat and tons of shopping. The staff is very helpful and most speak english. The rooms are fairly standard for Japan - a little small, but clean and who spends a lot of time in a room anyway? Others posted that they had problems with the internet - according to my son, the wireless needs to be reset since it can only handle 200-300 IP addresses and once all of the address occupy the server, no one else can log in. We encountered a problem with the public WI-FI in the lobby on our fisrt night and once we told the front desk to reset (unplug and plug the wireless router), we were able to get online every time without any problems. The in-room WI-FI worked great and free if you have attained "gold or platinum" Marriott reward status. My 22 year old son did all of his shopping at the DonK (short for Don Quixote), three blocks towards the Shimbashi JR station. What a great store - everythinkg from inexpensive gifts to high end electronics, watches and liquor. I would highly recommend purchasing a Japan Rail pass before arriving in Japan - the JR station (Shimbashi) is about 7 blocks (less than 10 minute walk) from the hotel. Very walkable and convenient to take the Yamonte line to either Shinagawa or Tokyo station to catch the Shinkasen. We paid $375 for "green car" (first class) unlimited use, 7 day pass. After adding up day trips to Nagano, Sendai, Niigata, Kyoto and Hiroshima, it would have cost over $1500 each, so we saved over $1,100. The subway is within a block (Ginza line) but the JR pass does not cover the subways. I would defintely recommend this hotel to both leisure and business travelers.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the Marriott Ginza for 5 nights while in Tokyo. The hotel is situated just off the main drag in Ginza. It is great for seeing Ginza and taking in the sights of this busy district. It is conveniently located for that purpose. The rooms were clean and ok sized. I do have one complaint about the head clearance in the bathrooms, when standing in the shower the overhead clearance is maybe 6'3". Rather short for a taller person. They did have amenities such as soaps and lotions. But the bathroom was rather cramped. The room itself had a decent sized bed with a TV and a minibar. Wifi & LAN cost extra so we didn't use it.There are a few subway and train lines that run nearby but if you are using a JR rail pass (like we did) then you'll have a hefty walk to the nearest JR station (maybe 15-20 minutes at a normal speed). There are other options for transportation such as the subway system, but for JR rail pass holders you'd have to shell out about 200-300 yen per way.There are numerous food options around the hotel, but if you are looking for the mom & pop type of ramen or small eatery, they are few and far between in Ginza. The area of Ginza is more high scale with fine dining options and fine entertainment. If you are looking for a more low key approach then I wouldn't recommend staying in Ginza.Overall it was a good hotel, but for the cost I would rather stay in one of the other prefectures of Tokyo and travel to see Ginza rather than stay in Ginza.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Agree with the positive comments here. Ginza is a fun, pleasant area. I took the train from Narita and had a two block walk to the hotel. This was not built as a Courtyard but works fine. The room was a little small but worked fine and was very comfy. Plus, in Tokyo space is at a very high premium in this market. The bathroom was quite cramped but it was just me, was spotlessly clean, and had nice amenities and plenty of hot water. The fridge, safe, and wifi all worked great. Folks at the front desk were friendly and jumped to help. Can't comment on value as it was a company direct pay. I did not use any food services in the hotel but I never do. Bottom line, Courtyard Ginza is a modern, comfortable, well-located, welcoming choice in a very expensive market. Wouldn't even think of going elsewhere if I return to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We usually look to stay at Marriott or Hilton when traveling due to points. So we booked originally based on that. But this hotel proved to be in a very good location for all the sights we wanted to see. We were there for 4 days and its within walking distance to the fish market, Ginza for great shopping and food, and tow subway stops that can quickly get you to Asasakusa, Roppongi, sky tree or the major shrines with no connections needed. The discounted breakfast buffet was very good. Plenty to choose from. The room was bigger than we expected and very nice. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This hotel was selected by me for a 5 day stay in Tokyo for one most important reason - Very well located in the middle of Tokyo with ease of access to many attractions. This is a cost effective, convenient and a very nice place to stay in an unbelievably quite environment in the middle of Ginza. I managed to visit all most all key attractions and come back by the same day evening. I booked the hotel and all my visits through Japanican.com which provided a very efficient and convenient service without any issue. Places I visited were Observation deck, Shimada river cruise, Asakusa temple, Imperial palace, Ginza and city tour, Sky tree and aquarium, Mount Fuji, experience in Shinkansen train, Lake Asahi, cableway up and down Mt. Komagatake and many others including Akinhabara during my leisure. Hotel staff were very helpful and assist in good English. If you are traveling in Aug, expect long ques for all attractions as it may be the summer holiday period.
user_name:
Rohitha R
Port Harcourt, Rivers, Nigeria

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: At the time this was the only Marriott in town, so I was stuck being loyal to Marriott. (new one opening in Dec. 2013). The location is great. Ginza is an awesome area to walk around. Shops, restaurants, very safe. The big department stores within walking have grocery markets in the basement levels. The breakfast buffet is awful and expensive. (they give a small discount to status members - approx $18 vs. $26). There is a Denny's right across the street where we ate every morning. The staff was very nice and helpful with everything from booking tours to quick responses to problems in the room. There was a small refrig in the room (mini bar) but you could push things aside to keep your personal items cold. There is a convenience store on the corner to buy items from water to sandwiches, also a coffee shop two doors down. The room was very, very small. I had an issue with the desk. I'm 5"8" but my knees hit the back of the desk when I sat straight in. That is how narrow the desk is. Shower was awesome, hot and strong. Fitness center was dreary and depressing but good equipment (in the basement). I have Marriott status and they gave us one drink coupon per night in the public lounge off a rot gut menu of wine, but did offer Sappora beer withthe coupon. My colleague order just fries (small dish) one night in the lounge and it cost equivalent of $8. US. yikes. Yet a couple of things off the room service menu were good at $11. Subway was very close by. The airport bus to/from Narita was very comfortable and quick. This hotel is situated pretty close to Hanida, which I'll be coming from next month. But really can't wait for the other Marriott to open so that I don't have to stay here anymore. Then again, it could have been worse. I was there for 2 1/2 weeks so it seemed especially hard. It really wasn't.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My wife and I had a 32 hour layover in Tokyo and spent one night at this hotel. The staff is very friendly, and the room is very comfortable. The only thing that stopped my review from being "excellent" is their food selection. Typical Japanese food is hard to swallow when you are not a sea food fan, so the international selection was not very good for dinner. Breakfast on the other hand was ver good and there was a great variety.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We are loyal Marriott customers and stayed at this property on our recent visit to Tokyo. The location is excellent, in the center of the Ginza, just 2 blocks from the closest subway station and within walking distance of the Imperial Palace, the Tsukiji Fish Market and Tokyo Station. Service was courteous and the front-desk staff spoke excellent English.Like most Tokyo hotels, it is pricey, especially for what you get - in our case a rather small room with a Queen bed (not a King) and a small, albeit functional bathroom. It's not prominently signed and our taxi driver had problems finding it. To be safe, make sure you have the name and address of the hotel written in Japanese.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We have just spent 2 night at the Courtyard by Marriott in the Ginza area of Tokyo. This hotel is great for a stop over. It is very close to the Ginza shopping strip with all the big name brands. The Imperial Place Gardens are close enough to walk to. A visit to the fish market is only a 10 min walk and a great place to watch a small part of life in Tokyo.The hotel is clean and comfortable. It is not a 5 star but had all you need for a couple of nights in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I stayed here for 2 nights on a Japan trip with my Mum. Ginza is such a wonderful area. The hotel is a pleasant 5 minute walk to Ginza street which has fabulous shopping and food areas. This area of Tokyo is very stylish and lots of great quality eating and retail. The location of the hotel although close to the action in Ginza is very quiet and relaxing so you can be confident of a good night's sleep. We stayed in a standard room. It was small but well designed (like everything in japan). The room had most things you would need to be comfortable. It was the only hotel we stayed in whist in Japan that did have a couple of english speaking TV channels at no extra charge although wifi did have a charge. There was a stocked fridge, tea and coffee supplies, hairdryer and nice kimonos to put on. Bed linen was quality and matress firm but not as uncomfortable as some japanese bedding can be. Service was flawless although service in japan is amazing generally. We were given a discount voucher upon checkin so the buffet breakfast worked out to be only $18 australian so a 'bargain' by hotel standards in australia (i travel a lot for business in australia and the average buffet in australia is $30). For $18 you get hot and cold options. A little japanese food but mostly western style breakfast. There is an egg station. But overall worth the money. Service in the hotel was very good. Professional and helpful and staff spoke good english.This hotel will be my choice when returning to tokyo hopefully next year.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Nice comfortable rooms, perhaps a little small. Good shower over the bath. Tea & coffee making in the room. Good breakfast. Very polite, efficient and helpful staff. Very good location - Close to main shopping with some very up market designer shops. Lots of restaurants in the area apart from the hotel restaurants. Very Good room service. Perhaps the hotel lacks a little character.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Great location in Ginza ; it's just 5 mins walk away from train station, and about 10mins walk away to the infamous Tsukiji market. Staffs speak English relatively well, polite and ever ready to assist the customers. Room was kinda small for Marriot standards ( comparatively to Marriot hotels in the United States), but nonetheless, still pretty comfortable and clean. Free wifi is pretty handy, and breakfast was pretty tasty too :) All in all, I enjoyed my stay in this hotel, and will not hesitate to come back again next time :)

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: This was the last of four hotels in which I stayed during my two week stay in Japan. The room was smaller but it was in a great location in Ginza. As is true with most hotels in Japan the staff was attentive and eager to please. It was not as luxor\urious as some hotels but the location and price more than made up for it. I would defintely stay here again.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Front desk, bell stand, housekeeping not too bad, but the restaurant and lounge were among the worst I've seen and I'm a lifetime Platnium with Marriott. Disgustingly dirty floors in the restaurant made me wonder what the kitchen looked like..yechhh. Service in the restaurant was terrible, and the lounge was no better. Being accustomed to friendly, smiling Japanese service, I was extremely disappointed with this hotel's level of cleanliness and attention to guests at their lounge and restaurant. This is Ginza for heavens sake...stay somewhere else, there are tons of choices.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Walking distance to Ginza shopping. Rooms fairly small. Fair/poor WiFi in room. Had to go down to lobby several times to connect. Small lounge in the basement, relatively quiet with good service. Front desk staff very pleasant and helpful. Good value, very clean. Would have no problem staying here again though would look for something a little larger and a touch more upscale if I had the chance.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: My wife and I had the opportunity to spend four nights at the Courtyard Ginza Hotel in Tokyo. We had a wonderful stay and I can highly recommend the hotel.First, when we arrived at the hotel by Taxi from Tokyo Station, my wife left her purse in the taxi by accident. We noticed this shortly after checking in and went to the bell desk to see what we should do. Mr. Suzuki immediately began trying to help us. I had paid the taxi in cash and did not get a receipt so we had no idea which taxi company we had used. Mr. Suzuki started calling taxi companies and reporting our loss. A couple of hours later, much to our surprise, Suzuki San called our room. The taxi drive, a Yamada San had brought my wife’s purse back to the hotel! Of course, everything was in order. This is an example of wonderful service from Mr. Suzuki, one of the hotel associates, but Japan in general.Our room was 814. By U.S. standards, it was small, but for the two of us, perfectly adequate and very comfortable. The room was very quiet, something we both appreciated. The bathroom was, like the room, compact, but very nice. The toilet had the feature to wash your private parts at the push of a button. I had never experienced this before, but really grew to like it! There was a combination deep tub and shower. The mirror had an area that must have been heated from behind because it did not frost up from condensation – a cool feature.The room had a large HD TV with about a half-dozen international channels. I used both the wired and wireless internet service and found it to be quite fast and trouble free. Being a Marriott Rewards member it was complimentary.The room had a small refrigerator which was mostly filled with drinks for purchase. There was enough room to put a few things of ours into the refrigerator. The room also had an electronic display that could be set to “clean the room” or “do not disturb.” I liked this feature. Our room was perfectly clean when we checked in and the house keeper kept it perfectly clean during our stay.The Courtyard is very conveniently located! It was less than a 10 minute walk to either Shimbashi station or Ginza subway station. Nishi Ginza was even closer. For my wife and I we really appreciated the Denny’s restaurant right across the street! We had breakfast there daily. A full breakfast for the two of us was about US$ 15.00. Service was really excellent and the food quite good.We also visited a Starbucks that is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel each morning for our Venti Lates. Prices at Starbucks were just about the same as at home in California. They packed our to-go order in a bag with a cup holder so that the drinks would not spill. Excellent service.There are so many restaurants within a short walk from the hotel that we did not have any meals at the hotel. Being in Tokyo for only four nights, we wanted to experience as much of the city as we could.The Courtyard hotel was very convenient and the staff very friendly while giving excellent service. I would definitely return which is about as good of a recommendation as I can give.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: The purpose of my trip was visiting some financial institution in Tokyo. The hotel was close from the companies that I have meeting, The room wasn't big, but was really clean. The daily price was good. Next time if go to Tokyo definitely will stay in this hotel.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights in courtyard Ginza tokyo on a business trip. Was excellent value for money. Centrally located in Ginza area, with busy shopping and food options, was a good place to stay in TokyoI agree with some of the others that this courtyard is even better than some of the courtyard i have stayed in US (though breakfast was not as good). Its very comfortable, no fancy stuff, but very convenient for the business traveller,Rooms could be slightly spacious, but we cannot complaint as the price is very reasonable given the location.Highly recommended for business trips.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We picked this hotel for it's location and that was not an error. But it was a step down from the hotel we stayed in in Kyoto. There was no concierge, which in a country where you do not speak the language is a big disappointment. The staff were very nice but the level of their ability in English was low so they could not understand our questions or offer us any help outside the hotel. The room was on the small side but was manageable. It would have been nice to have a second reading chair. The bathroom was small but it had everything we needed. The amenities were of good quality, though they were not always replaced when we ran out (we were there for 5 nights). If you are a member of the Marriott loyalty club there is free wifi in the room, otherwise it costs $13 night, so join the club before leaving. The wifi is a bit slow. The breakfast was good, but depending on the day, sometimes they were out of croissants or fresh fruit. Even though we had a non-smoking room, the hallway always smelled terribly of cigarette smoke.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: I recently stayed here for a period of four days, three nights on a non-business trip to Tokyo. I was on the fence prior to coming about staying in a place off of airbnb.com, or craigslist, in order to get a different lodging experience while traveling, but ultimately decided on the safe choice with Marriott.The hotel is located in a great location in Tokyo (Ginza), lending itself to great shopping. It is a short walk to the Tsukiji Fish Market, an emerging tourist attraction in Tokyo. Highly recommend verifying the tour registration start times for this attraction, as they can shift depending on the time of the year. Also, ensure to check out 'Sushi Dai' inside the market, and get there around 5am, or you will be in for an at least three hour wait. Prepare yourself for some top quality sushi. Otherwise, the hotel is a short 5-10 minute walk to Ginza Station, which will get you anywhere you need to go in Tokyo, assuming you have some sense to read a subway map and take the correct trains. Also highly recommended in the Lion Sapporo Beer hall (3 min walk) Go nuts on Yebisu, one of the top quality beers in Japan, and thus the world. They make draft variations that are only sold in Japan that you have to try if you are a fan of beer.For the hotel itself, the staff was top notch. The concierge was helpful in lending an umbrella for the days (2 total out of the time I was there) when it rained, lending a phone (appx US$6 a day base charge, but it doesn't allow outgoing SMS... that is bad), and booking a shuttle back to Narita (directly services the hotel - very convenient).The hotel boasts a decent gym with treadmills and some free weights. Great for when you need to get in a workout and detox from the prior night's activities. As a bonus, there are TVs above the treadmills that have international broadcasts. I brought my own jumprope (working on double unders these days), but the low ceiling in there largely prevented me from being able to comfortably do them there.I checked out the breakfast buffet on the last day before checking out and regret that experience. It's in need of some definite work - the espresso machine was needing attention when I came upon it (out of beans), the line for the omelet station was too long (one man making one order at a time - opted not to wait), and the scrambled eggs on the buffet line had a strange consistency. There just didn't seem to be the variety and quality that I'm accustomed to when staying at Marriott properties, understanding that this is a Courtyard and not a JW, but I think they can do better.The room itself was large with good cable tv (both International and Japanese channels), the shower was strong and hot, and the toilets even had bidets, which is a plus. There is a small fridge in the room with cash items (food and drink) that aren't unreasonably priced.Overall, the hotel has a great staff and location, with a high quality room. Just avoid the downstairs restaurant pending some revamping of service and offerings.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: A first class experience in a great location at a reasonable price. 2 Nights with my daughter at the start of our Japanese vacation, in one of the more exciting cities in the world. Close to all the Ginza shopping delights, the stay at the Courtyard was as expected, value for money, clean and reliable with good service, complete with a map of all the stores in Ginza.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: As a frequent business traveler to Tokyo and Osaka Japan, I have found this Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza, to be as good and perhaps better than any Courtyard where I've stayed, in the United States. Because the company I work for has its headquarters in the Ginza, this hotel is most convenient, only a 10 minute walk to our headquarters. The staff is more than courteous, and the hotel is spotlessly clean throughout. Any questions I have had about the hotel or the surrounding areas of the Ginza were answered politely and always with a smile. As a visiting guest, I'm always entertained by my company, and am taken out for all meals during my stays. Therefore, I cannot comment on the food at this Courtyard facility. Before staying at this Courtyard by Marriott, I would stay at the Ginza Dai Ichi. It too, was a fine hotel but the Courtyard is a little more spacious. The closets in particular have far more room that the Ginza Dai Ichi. I would highly recommend staying at the Marriott Courtyard location.

hotel_name: Courtyard by Marriott Tokyo Ginza Hotel
review_body: We lived in Japan from 2004 to 2007 and loved it so we go back whenever we can. Hotels can be pricey and small rooms although service is always good. We were delighted to see that there was a Courtyard now in Tokyo as I`m a Platinum member and we knew the Ginza area to this was perfect. On arrival we were upgraded to a room on the Executive top floor and it was a decent size and with the usual amenties you would expect in a Japanese hotel. Location is close to two subway lines and very easy to get around Tokyo.
